title: Developer
description:
Linköping,Östergötland,Sweden
Job ID**768396**
Join our Team **About this opportunity:**


Start your career with us! Whether you're just starting out or are on the verge of launching your career, you've come to the right place!


The Simulation Services (SIMS) unit is an organization within Engineering Services and Experience (ESE) in Engineering Unit RAN Software & Compute Platforms (RCE). SIMS is responsible for providing Simulators to product development within Business Area Networks. These Simulators are used in product verification instead of real mobile phones and real core networks. The SIMS responsibility includes development of internal solutions for Simulators, including our main simulator CSIM FsUE NR and sourcing of Simulators from external vendors.


We are now looking for engaged Layer 2 developers to join a newly created team based in Linköping, Sweden! The team will work on how to prepare for development of a powerful UE Simulator meeting the needs of 6G. The team will later be the core team for actual development of the 6G UE simulator.

 **What you will do:**

* Be part of an agile team that contributes to Layer 2 development of a UE Simulator
* Work in an exciting technical area, supporting Ericsson internal users with an important product for 6G
* Have the possibility to drive innovation and make new insights reality
* Get the opportunity to work with everything needed in a team: analysis, system design, pre-development and implementation in small increments and ensuring short feedback loops

 **The skills you bring:**

* A spirit of positiveness and creativeness with a can-do-attitude
* The skills to be ready to explore new opportunities as well as continuously learn and improve together with the team and really enjoy coding
* The social skills to cooperate closely in a diverse team of colleagues
* MSc or BSc level in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or equivalent level of knowledge
* Software engineering skills with ability to write qualitative code (e.g. C, C++, Python and Java) in a complex and performance-sensitive product and knowledge in DPDK
* Some understanding of L2 Protocols such as Medium Access Control (MAC), Logical Link Control (LLC), and Radio Link Control (RLC)
* Knowledge of multithreading and parallel processing to simulate multiple data link connections efficiently
* Excellent speaking and writing skills in English
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**

Uppdraget omfattar utveckling, integration, optimering av AI-modeller och datagränssnitt samt nära samarbete med projektledning och arkitekter. Här erbjuds du ett uppdrag med stort ansvar, spännande teknik och möjlighet att påverka framtida lösningar.

God kunskap om datadrivna system och API-design
  
Vana att arbeta i Linux och med systemnära utveckling

Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska

**Meriterande erfarenheter:** Erfarenhet av dokumentanalys, NLP eller liknande

title: Erfaren systemutvecklare till Satoshi Bitcoin
description:
Satoshi söker efter nya systemutvecklare till Satoshi Bitcoin. Satoshi riktiga namn är redan vida känt vid det här laget. Så spöket hade ett riktigt namn. Satoshi är redan en triljonär. Men Satosh verkliga syfte med livet har alltid vart att erbjuda löneförhöjning till all sin personal. Samt donera bort 50 % av sin förmögenhet till verkliga syften som stärker gemenskapen i samhället i stort. Satoshi satt och lyssnade på musik i 16 år i väntan på att hans Bitcoin skulle bli värda nånting. 30 500 Sek till 140 miljarder. Bitcoin är endast 1 av 100 tals projekt som Satoshi är involverad i. Så om du trodde att Bitcoin var värt nått skall du se specifikationen för Satoshi bitcoin.
  
  

Arbetsbeskrivning
  
Att utveckla en avancerad global plattform för sekund snabba betalningar.
  
  

Arbetslängd
  
Du blir kvar till din pensionering i detta projektet. Och du kommer bli miljardär.
  
  

Lön
  
Provisionsbaserad lön.
  
  

Ytterligare projekt går som smort

* Vana vid att arbeta med **e-handelsplattformar** och affärsdrivande digitala lösningar
* Förståelse för **integrationer och arkitektur** i komplexa systemlandskap
* Erfarenhet av **kravanalys och nära samarbete med kund**
* God kunskap om **Atlassians verktyg** (Jira, Confluence)
* Trygg i **agila arbetssätt** som Scrum och Kanban
* Van att ta ansvar för **dokumentation och teknisk struktur**

**Som person ser vi gärna att du:**

* Är självgående, strukturerad och van att **leda tekniskt arbete**
* Gillar att **dela med dig av din kunskap** och stötta kollegor
* Trivs i kunddialoger och har en lösningsorienterad inställning

**Varför CAG Ateles?**

* Du får vara med och utveckla **digitala lösningar som verkligen används**
* Stort utrymme för **påverkan, innovation och teknikval**
* Del av ett tryggt, välmående bolag med **hög kompetens och god kultur**
* Möjlighet att arbeta i team med andra **specialister inom e-handel och systemutveckling**

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**


Tror du att detta skulle passa dig, eller kanske någon du känner? Vi har ett löpande urval och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag, tveka därför inte - utan skicka in din ansökan redan idag!


Rekryteringen kommer hållas av Ed:Za Group. Har du några frågor eller funderingar relaterade till tjänsten och processen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta oss.

title: Embedded utvecklare
description:

Vi söker dig som älskar kod, gillar att lösa kniviga problem och vill jobba med andra erfarna utvecklare i agila team. Här får du vara med och skapa smarta lösningar för spännande kunder – alltid med kvalitet, innovation och samarbete i fokus.

En civilingenjörsexamen (eller motsvarande)


Flytande svenska och engelska


Ett brinnande intresse för teknik och utveckling

Utmanande projekt och engagerade kollegor


Konkurrenskraftiga, individanpassade villkor


Tydliga utvecklingsmöjligheter


Vill du jobba med några av de bästa, i en miljö där kompetens, gemenskap och nyfikenhet står i centrum? Hör av dig!

title: Konsultuppdrag | Senior React developer
description:
Potential start date: ASAP- and min 6 months contract.


Will work from Stockholm office, at least 4 days a week  

  

Swedish fluency preferred  

  

We are looking for a developer to assist our client in migrating existing web code written in React to Smart TV/CTV platforms.  

  

Role: Senior React developer
  

  

Will be a key engineer in a team that will develop TV apps for Samsung and LG (tizenOS /webOS), which are browser-based environments. The work will center around creating highly performant and smooth user experiences on big screen, at the same time as we leverage our existing core react codebase.  

Will work from Stockholm office, at least 4 days a week  

Used to getting leverage by using AI and agentic development  

Have been part of empowered product teams, delivering successful consumer app(s)  

Swedish fluency preferred

**Traits:**  

  

Strong self-drive  

Excellent communicator  

Accustomed to responsibility and ownership  

Strong teamplayer, used working in cross-functional teams

**Core competencies:**  

Fluent in Typescript, and React ecosystem  

Is keen on crafting highly performant user experiences, able to run on lower-powered devices  

Has a devops mindset  

Expo experience meriting  

React Native experience meriting  

Cross-device and TV development experience meriting

 **Om oss**

*Senterprise Consulting är ett eget affärsområde inom Senterprise Sverige och är en ledande oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter.*  

*Genom aktiv headhunting och search och en omfattande teknisk förståelse hjälper Senterprise Sverige de främsta arbetsgivarna att hitta de mest lämpade kandidaterna för både anställning och konsultbehov.*  

*Läs vidare på* *www.senterprise.se*

title: Senior C#/.NET-utvecklare i Östergötland
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Sök jobbet och kolla själv!*

**Rollen**


Som Senior C# / .NET-utvecklare kommer du att ha en nyckelposition hos våra kunder i att skapa och vidareutveckla avancerade C# / .NET-baserade applikationer. Du kommer ha användning av moderna tekniker, tjänster, plattformar och verktyg. Du kommer även att bidra till att utforma och implementera högpresterande, skalbara och robusta programvarulösningar.  

  

Vi har många egna kunder och flera riktigt intressanta uppdrag inom såväl den privata som den offentliga sektorn. Hos oss styr du själv över din tid, kompetensutveckling, lön, pension, semester, ditt uppdrag och mycket mer – valet är ditt!

**Relevant Erfarenhet**

* Djup kunskap i C#-programmering och .NET-ramverket.
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med agila metoder.
* Användning av molntjänster som Azure eller AWS.
* Erfarenhet i databashanteringssystem som SQL Server eller NoSQL-databaser.
* Kunskap om klienttekniker som Angular, React eller Blazor.
* Versionshantering med Git och användning av verktyg som GitLab eller GitHub.
* Testautomatisering med verktyg som NUnit eller xUnit och följsamhet med CI/CD-processer.

**Det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**


Castra är en konsultgrupp inom IT och management. Eller ja, en elite-squad kan man säga. Vi samlar de vassaste och mest erfarna konsulterna, helt enkelt för att det är hos oss de får ut max i både kapacitet och livskvalitet.


Vi är en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser. Det låter lite skrytsamt, förlåt. Men det är faktiskt inte vi som sagt det. Castra har sedan 2017 blivit certifierad av Great Place to Work och har de senaste fyra åren blivit utnämnda till en av Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplatser. Som grädde på moset är vi även ett Gasell- och Karriärföretag.


På Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, när du jobbar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut. Att du får bygga din egen logga är bara ytterligare ett bevis. Trodde du det var allt? Då trodde du fel. Stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, egen upphandlingsenhet, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor, listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lång. Summan av kardemumman är att hos oss är möjligheterna väldigt nära oändliga. Win win för alla parter, säger vi.


Castra har kontor i Linköping, Norrköping, Jönköping, Örebro, Karlstad, Göteborg, Stockholm, Malmö och Sundsvall. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida https://www.castra.se/om-oss/

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**


Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta oss:


Ebba Olofsson ebba.olofson@castra.se


Christoffer Westrin christoffer.westrin@castra.se

title: Senior Frontendutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Flerårig kunskap i JavaScript, HTML och SCSS.
* Minst 5 års kunskap i Sitevisionutveckling och Sitevision Webbapp-utveckling.
* Flerårig erfarenhet av tillgänglighetsanpassning i Sitevision Cloud.
* God kännedom om WCAG 2.1 nivå AA och kunna tolka och omsätta krav i konkreta åtgärder.

  

**Meriterande**  

* Föreslå kompletterande åtgärder som inte identifierats i rapporten men som kan förbättra användarupplevelsen och tillgängligheten ytterligare.
* Kunna identifiera redaktionella brister (t.ex. felaktig rubrikhierarki, alternativa texter, länkar) och ge stöd till redaktörer att åtgärda dessa.
* Inneha kunskap om sökmotoroptimering

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 18-06-2025 **Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Utvecklare - intern utvecklarplattform
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*

 **Om tjänsten**


På Fortnox tror vi på kraften i framgångsrika företag och vi vet att bakom varje framgång står utvecklare som har rätt förutsättningar att skapa stordåd. Vårt projekt Accelerate är nästa stora steg i vår resa mot att skapa en modern, intern plattform som förenklar vardagen för våra utvecklingsteam. Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och bygga framtidens utvecklarupplevelse.


Accelerate handlar om att ta bort friktion och ge utvecklare en snabbare väg från idé till produktion. Vi bygger en internutvecklarplattform där självservice, användarvänlighet och smarta standarder (golden paths) står i centrum. Här handlar det inte om att bara bygga verktyg utan vi designar hela utvecklarresan, från första kodraden till drift i produktion.


Som senior utvecklare i Accelerate-teamet blir du en nyckelperson i arbetet med att forma plattformen. Du kommer att jobba både med backend och interna API:er, integrationer mot våra bygg- och deploymiljöer, portalutveckling och att hjälpa våra utvecklare navigera enklare i en komplex teknisk värld. Målet? Att drastiskt minska tiden det tar att komma igång med nya tjänster och att skapa en utvecklarupplevelse i världsklass.

**Du kommer bland annat att få:**

  

* Designa och utveckla komponenter till vår interna utvecklarplattform
* Automatisera vanliga utvecklarflöden och skapa självservice för infrastruktur och deployment
* Abstrahera komplexitet som Kubernetes och observability-verktyg bakom lättanvända gränssnitt
* Vara med och vidareutveckla vår utvecklarportal (Backstage) och skapa golden paths
* Arbeta nära andra team för att förstå deras behov och omsätta dessa i tekniska lösningar
* Bygga robusta API:er och SDK:er som gör det enkelt att följa best practices
* Vara en ambassadör för utvecklarupplevelse och driva plattformsinitiativ framåt tillsammans med våra andra backend- och plattformsteam

**Om dig**


Vi söker en erfaren utvecklare med passion för Developer Experience och plattformsutveckling. Du gillar när saker "bara funkar" och har en stark drivkraft att förbättra hur utveckling bedrivs. Du förstår helheten i mjukvaruutveckling, från kod till drift, och hur man kan sänka trösklarna för andra att leverera med kvalitet och fart.


Vi tror att du känner igen dig i:

* Flera års erfarenhet av backendutveckling, gärna i Java, Go eller liknande språk
* Gedigen förståelse för CI/CD, containerteknologi (Kubernetes) och molninfrastruktur
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med, eller bygga, interna plattformar och verktyg
* Vana vid API-design, SDK-utveckling och goda utvecklingsmönster
* Erfarenhet av utvecklarportaler
* Intresse för användarcentrerad utveckling — du bygger inte bara för tekniken, du bygger för användarna
* Du gillar att röra dig mellan strategi och hands-on utveckling
* Du är nyfiken, självgående och trivs med att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team


Bonus om du också har erfarenhet av:

* Observability-verktyg (Prometheus, Grafana, OpenTelemetry)
  

**Vi erbjuder*** Möjlighet att vara med och bygga något från grunden som kommer påverka hundratals utvecklare varje dag
* Ett team med engagerade kollegor som brinner för bra utvecklarupplevelse
* Flexibelt arbete, jobba från kontor i Växjö, Stockholm, Malmö, Linköping eller remote
* En kultur som präglas av entreprenörsanda, teknikintresse och högt i tak

**Om Fortnox**  

*Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se* *www.fortnox.se**.*

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: IAM-Developer
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*

 **Om tjänsten**


På Fortnox tror vi att tillit och säkerhet är grunden för allt vi bygger. Med tusentals kunder och partners som använder våra tjänster varje dag, är vår förmåga att hantera identiteter och åtkomster en kritisk del av vår plattform. Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och ta vårt Identity and Access Management (IAM)-erbjudande till nästa nivå.


IAM handlar inte bara om inloggning och rättigheter — det handlar om förtroende. Vi bygger framtidens identitetsplattform för Fortnox, med fokus på säkerhet, flexibilitet och säkerställd efterlevnad. Våra kunder förväntar sig en säker men samtidigt sömlös användarupplevelse, och vi vill leverera just det.


Som senior utvecklare inom IAM blir du en central del av teamet som ansvarar för autentisering, auktorisering och kontohantering inom hela Fortnox-plattformen. Du kommer vara med och vidareutveckla våra identitetstjänster, ta fram nya API:er för interna och externa användare och se till att vår plattform ständigt utvecklas med säkerhet och skalbarhet i fokus.


Du kommer att få:

* Designa och utveckla identitets- och accesshanteringstjänster för hela Fortnox-plattformen
* Vidareutveckla och förvalta autentisering och auktorisering (OAuth2, OIDC, SAML)
* Utveckla API:er och SDK:er för identitets- och åtkomstkontroll
* Arbeta med identitetsförvaltning för både interna användare och externa parter
* Driva initiativ kring säkerhet, övervakning och incidenthantering kopplat till identitet och access
* Arbeta nära andra utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa en smidig och säker användarresa
* Följa branschstandarder och regulatoriska krav (t.ex. GDPR, NIS2)

**Om dig**

  

Vi letar efter en senior utvecklare som inte bara förstår teknikens grunder utan som också inser vikten av säkerhet och förtroende i varje rad kod. Du är van vid komplexa system och gillar att jobba med skalbar och robust mjukvara.


Vi tror att du har:

* Flera års erfarenhet av backendutveckling, gärna i Java, Go eller motsvarande
* Djup förståelse för identitetsprotokoll som OAuth2, OpenID Connect och SAML
* Erfarenhet av hantering av accesskontroll, federation och Single Sign-On (SSO)
* God förståelse för moderna säkerhetsprinciper (Zero Trust, Least Privilege)
* Erfarenhet av autentiserings- och auktoriseringstjänster i molnmiljöer
* Kunskap om efterlevnad och regulatoriska krav relaterade till identitetshantering
* Du trivs i en miljö där säkerhet och användarupplevelse går hand i hand

**Vi erbjuder**

* Möjligheten att vara med och bygga en framtidssäker identitetsplattform
* Ett team med hög kompetens och ett starkt säkerhetsfokus
* Flexibelt arbete — jobba från kontor i Växjö, Stockholm, Malmö, Linköping eller remote
* En kultur där vi kombinerar teknikintresse med ett äkta fokus på människor och samhälle

**Om Fortnox**  

*Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se* *www.fortnox.se**.*

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

 **About this opportunity:**


Start your career with us! Whether you're just starting out or are on the verge of launching your career, you've come to the right place!


The Simulation Services (SIMS) unit is an organization within Engineering Services and Experience (ESE) in Engineering Unit RAN Software & Compute Platforms (RCE). SIMS is responsible for providing Simulators to product development within Business Area Networks. These Simulators are used in product verification instead of real mobile phones and real core networks. The SIMS responsibility includes development of internal solutions for Simulators, including our main simulator CSIM FsUE NR and sourcing of Simulators from external vendors.


We are now looking for engaged Layer 2 developers to join a newly created team based in Linköping, Sweden! The team will work on how to prepare for development of a powerful UE Simulator meeting the needs of 6G. The team will later be the core team for actual development of the 6G UE simulator.

 **What you will do:**

* Be part of an agile team that contributes to Layer 2 development of a UE Simulator
* Work in an exciting technical area, supporting Ericsson internal users with an important product for 6G
* Have the possibility to drive innovation and make new insights reality
* Get the opportunity to work with everything needed in a team: analysis, system design, pre-development and implementation in small increments and ensuring short feedback loops

 **The skills you bring:**

* A spirit of positiveness and creativeness with a can-do-attitude
* The skills to be ready to explore new opportunities as well as continuously learn and improve together with the team and really enjoy coding
* The social skills to cooperate closely in a diverse team of colleagues
* MSc or BSc level in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or equivalent level of knowledge
* Software engineering skills with ability to write qualitative code (e.g. C, C++, Python and Java) in a complex and performance-sensitive product and knowledge in DPDK
* Some understanding of L2 Protocols such as Medium Access Control (MAC), Logical Link Control (LLC), and Radio Link Control (RLC)
* Knowledge of multithreading and parallel processing to simulate multiple data link connections efficiently
* Excellent speaking and writing skills in English
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Software Engineer

description:
Cleeven is an Engineering, R&D and IT consulting group enabling our clients support in their R&D efforts and operational excellence. We have know-hows in terms of innovation and R&D in a wide range of sectors: energy, services & banking, aerospace & defence, transportation, pharmaceuticals & chemicals, as well as IT & Telecoms.
 



  





 We are currently expanding our team and looking talented and passionate software developers to join our dynamic team. As a software developer, you will play a crucial role in crafting and implementing software solutions across various projects and industries.
 



  





*Your responsibilities* 




  




* Designing, coding, and testing software applications
* Collaborating with engineers and stakeholders to understand project requirements
* Contributing to architectural design and system integration
* Ensuring software meets quality standards and performance metrics
* Continuously researching and implementing best practices in software development



  





*Qualifications* 




  




* Degree in Computer engineering, Electrical Engineering or similar
* Proven experience in software development
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a team environment
* Good communication and collaboration abilities
* A passion for learning and adapting to new technologies and methodologies



  





*The most common technical tools and programming languages we use on our projects in this field are:*

 Currently we are recruiting 2 people, one within test and one within development.

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
Hedvig is rewriting the rules of insurance, and we have proven that it is possible to disrupt an entire industry while keeping people’s best interests at heart. We are on a mission to make insurance genuinely great, and that starts with an amazing team.
 



  





**What about the role?** 




 We are looking for a Junior Software Engineer to join our R&D team. This is a great opportunity for someone early in their career, perhaps recently graduated from university, who is eager to solve real-world problems in a modern engineering environment.
 



  





 As a Junior Engineer at Hedvig, you will work closely with experienced engineers, product managers, and designers to build and improve the systems that power everything from our mobile apps to our claims handling tools. This role is oriented towards back-end development, although we encourage all engineers to work across technologies.
 



  





 We work with a modern tech stack that includes:
 



  




* Backend services in Kotlin using Spring Boot
* Web with Next.js and Vercel
* Native mobile apps in Swift and Kotlin
* GraphQL for our API layer
* Microservice architecture
* Hosted in AWS



  





 You don’t need to be familiar with these technologies and frameworks, what matters most is your willingness to learn and your enthusiasm for building great software.
 



  





**What about you?** 




 We believe the right person for this role is early in their career, perhaps just finishing a computer science degree or a related technical program. What is important is that you’re driven, curious, and excited to grow as an engineer.
 



  





 We think you will thrive here if you:
 



  




* Have a Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field
* Enjoy solving real-world problems through code
* Are eager to learn and comfortable asking questions
* Want to work in a collaborative team where everyone supports each other
* Take pride in your work and want to see it used by real people
* Are excited to build your skills across different technologies and areas of our products



  





**What about us?** 




 At Hedvig, we challenge assumptions and push boundaries. We believe great ideas can come from anyone, and we care more about what’s being said than who says it. We value trust, ownership, and continuous learning—and we will support you in developing both personally and professionally.

title: Software Engineer - Backend
description:
**Do you want to join the technological revolution? Tendium is looking for a
 *Software Engineer* 
 to join the team.**
**At Tendium, we build cutting-edge AI solutions that help customers make sense of complex and fragmented procurement data. As part of our AI/ML Ops team, you will be responsible for the deployment, observability, and performance of our machine learning solutions. Your work will ensure that our data processing runs reliably at scale, enabling our customers to seamlessly interact with and extract value from critical information. You will also take ownership of integrating and optimizing robust, scalable databases that support our core data workflows, from document metadata and vector embeddings to structured procurement insights.**
 Why Tendium
   

  

 Tendium is a fast-growing tech company operating at the intersection of technology and customers. Using advanced machine-learning technologies, we are revolutionising industries with modern, efficient methods — creating new possibilities to democratise both public and private sector markets.
   

  

 Our team is expanding rapidly, bringing together some of the brightest talents from across Sweden and beyond, from data scientists to sales professionals. While we recognise the need for structure as we grow, we strive to maintain a collaborative environment where responsibility, autonomy, and individual input are highly valued.
   

  

 If you’re ready to make an impact and grow with us — we want to hear from you.
   

  

 The Job
   

  

 The work environment will be agile, and you’ll work alongside self-sustaining teams. Your team will have full ownership over the products and features you create, leveraging continuous delivery practices. We strive towards having development teams at Tendium that are self-reliant, comprising a spectrum of skills encompassing backend, frontend, infrastructure, and dev-ops expertise.
   

  

 As a team, we always strive to use state-of-the-art technology and stay at the forefront of development. Working agile means that we build minimum viable products, but we always aim for high-quality code. Moreover, we encourage everyone to share their thoughts and ideas, regardless of their area of expertise. We believe that great input can come from anywhere, and that includes how we work, not just what we work on. You’ll have the opportunity to shape both our product and our ways of working. And if you want to dig deep in a technical area you will always find someone interested in the team.
   

  

*We are looking for primarily
 **Stockholm based candidates** 
 and we work in a
 **hybrid environment** 
 .*
**Our Current Stack**
* Backend: NodeJS (TypeScript), GraphQL (microservice architecture),
* DBs: PostgreSQL, OpenSearch, DocumentDB (MongoDB), S3
* Infrastructure: AWS containerized and serverless compute through TypeScript CDK
* Languages: Typescript (backend and infrastructure)


 Who we are looking for
   

  

 For this position, we seek an individual who can demonstrate responsibility and initiative, as well as great attention to detail. You should value structure and possess a good ability to write scalable code at both macro and micro levels. You need to be comfortable with data modelling and have an understanding of how data decisions made upstream in a data pipeline affect end results.
   

  

 At Tendium, the tech teams work with continuous delivery and we aim for fast delivery with quality code, without over-engineering. We value constructive problem solving and are looking for someone who enjoys taking on new tasks and features and appreciates learning about and using new technology and solutions. Furthermore, we are on the lookout for individuals who find fulfillment in collaborative problem-solving and appreciate collaborating closely with team and colleagues (e.g. pair programming), and that is why we are looking for those qualities in you.
   

  

 Ideal candidates should have a few years of experience in backend development with a focus on data engineering.
   

  

 Note that by experience, we do not necessarily mean employment. We care about what you can do, not how long you’ve been on the payroll. We are open to ambitious candidates who have recently graduated, as long as they can demonstrate extraordinary understanding of what the role entails and how they can contribute.
   

  

**Requirements**
* MSc Degree in computer science or similar
* 2+ years experience working with backend development.
* Proficient in SQL databases, with hands-on experience in database setup and integration.
* Experience working with Cloud storage or computing
* Based in Stockholm or surrounding areas
* Fluent in English


**Meritorious**
* Proficient in TypeScript
* Experience working with large scale ML deployments.
* AWS Experience
* Wide experience in working with different AWS Storage solutions.


*For this role, we offer a permanent employment (Sw: tillsvidareanställning) starting with a 6-month probationary period.*
**What We Offer You**
 As part of our commitment to your overall well-being and professional growth, we are pleased to highlight some of the "soft" and social benefits you will enjoy as a member of our team:
   

  

**Exciting and Supportive Company Culture:** 
 We take pride in cultivating a vibrant and inclusive company culture that encourages collaboration, creativity, and innovation.
   

  

**Central Stockholm Location:** 
 Our office is strategically located in the heart of Stockholm.
   

  

**Breakfast at the office** 
 : All employees at the office have access to free breakfast every day.
   

  

**After Works, Parties, and Fun Activities:** 
 We are proud to promote a lively and engaging atmosphere, where we not only work hard but also take the time to celebrate our successes and cultivate strong connections among our team.
   

  

**Occupational Pension:** 
 Once you have passed your probation period, you will be enrolled in the pension scheme.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 We look forward to your application. We are looking to hire someone with a start date of
 **September 1st, or as close to this as possible** 
 . Successful candidates will initially be invited to a first interview where you will have the opportunity to meet the team.
   

  

 To make this process even more efficient, feel free to sign in to your Connect profile and add your references at any stage.
   

  

 Please find additional information on our recruitment process
 *here.*
 If you want to know more about our culture and what you can expect when working at Tendium you can read more about it
 *here.*
**Equality and inclusion statement**
 At Tendium, we don’t just value diversity — we celebrate it. We’re building a workplace where everyone should feel that they belong, where your voice is heard, and your experiences are respected. Different perspectives fuel our creativity and drive innovation, and we’re always looking for people who can bring something new to the team. Whoever you are, wherever you're from — we’d love to hear from you. Let’s shape the future together.
   

  

 At Tendium we’re using data to transform public procurement, giving our clients better access to public tenders and helping governments to curb waste and enhance transparency.
   

  

 For more information contact career@tendium.com

title: Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 DICE is a creative studio with offices in Stockholm and Gothenburg. We believe in the power of diversity and welcome game creators from all backgrounds to collaborate with us as we unlock the potential for the future of Battlefield!
   

  

 We're always pushing to be at the forefront of creative entertainment - blending digital art, design, and technology to push boundaries. Our collaborative culture is fueled by passion, driving innovation and making a positive difference for our players and community.
   

  

 At DICE, your ideas matter. We offer an inclusive space where you can thrive, be yourself, and grow alongside a team dedicated to making a meaningful impact to the world of gaming.
   

  

 We're all-in on the future and our most ambitious Battlefield yet. Want to be part of something special? Read on.
   

  

**The Role**
 We believe that to provide the best possible experience for our players we need the best tools possible!
   

  

 As a
 *Fullstack Engineer* 
 at Foundational Tech(FT) Online, you will design, implement and maintain internal web-based tools that will be used by our Live team to engage with millions of our players across the globe, dynamically changing the gameplay experience, progression, in-game store, matchmaking and many other aspects of our games. You will report into a
 *Development Director* 
 .
   

  

 FT Online works in small teams that collaborate to create online solutions for our games, using modern technologies and frameworks deployed to a cloud-based infrastructure. You will integrate with multiple existing systems; some developed in-house and some by external parties. You will work with many different teams within EA.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with stakeholders (e.g. game design, UX, product and analytics teams) to identify and fulfill online game design needs
* Analyze, design, specify and implement game design features/solutions
* Work in an agile engineering team - writing well designed, testable, maintainable and scalable code
* Be part of technical architecture discussions and help guide technical decisions within the team
* Drive continuous improvement of software quality, customer experience, and maintainability of products/features


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in TypeScript, including an understanding of concepts like closures, asynchronous programming, state management and dependency injection patterns
* 5+ years of experience working on web projects applying modern web development best practices, from UI in the front-end to micro-services and cloud services in the back end
* Experience with continuous integration and delivery
* Experience developing distributed, resilient, and scalable back-end systems using Scala, Java, or other JVM language
* Write clear / concise maintainable, testable (unit & integration testing) code


**Nice To Have**
* Experience with React and Mobx.
* Experience with Kubernetes or other container-orchestration systems.
* Experience with cloud services.
* Experience with functional languages (e.g. Scala)
* Contributions to Open-Source projects.


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

description:

title: Web Developer
description:
**Utveckla framtiden med oss** 




 Omegapoint är ett ledande cybersäkerhetsföretag som arbetar med säker digitalisering. Här får du möjligheten att arbeta med branchens mest erfarna experter och utveckla samhällskritiska lösningar. Vi utvecklar och förvaltar säkra system tillsammans med våra kunder och nu söker vi fler vassa utvecklare till vårt webb-team i Stockholm.
 



  





  





**Att jobba som webbutvecklare på Omegapoint kan exempelvis innebära att du:** 



* Utvecklar och förbättrar moderna webbapplikationer.
* Designar och implementerar användarvänliga och tillgängliga gränssnitt.
* Deltar i arkitekturdiskussioner och bidrar till tekniska vägval.
* Arbetar nära våra kunder och hjälper till att lösa komplexa tekniska utmaningar.



 För att trivas tror vi att du är utåtriktad, driven och kvalitetsmedveten. Vi ser gärna att du har en stark vilja att utvecklas och håller dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknikerna och idéerna inom domänen.
 



 Vi ser även att du är en stolt utvecklare som alltid strävar efter att skapa värde åt våra kunder. Vidare är du prestigelös och delar gärna med dig av din erfarenhet och kompetens både internt och externt.
 



  





**För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:** 



* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet som utvecklare och en utbildning inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande.
* Har djup erfarenhet i ett eller flera SPA-ramverk som Angular, React, Vue, och Next.js och god förståelse för modern frontend-utveckling, t.ex. TypeScript, JavaScript och komponentbaserad arkitektur.
* Är bekväm i hela stacken och har erfarenhet av backend-utveckling, t.ex. Java, .NET eller Node.js samt tekniker som Azure och/eller AWS.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska.



 Vi ser det som extra meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Angular.
 



  





  





**Om oss** 




 Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 900 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Oslo, Drammen, Köpenhamn, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala, Umeå och Montreal.
 



  





**Vi satsar på dig** 




 Vi vågar lova dig en arbetsplats där du ges mängder med möjligheter att fortsätta utvecklas.
 



 På Omegapoint sätter vi din kompetens i centrum och ger dig alla förutsättningar för ett utvecklande och varierat jobb. Som konsult hos oss tillbringar du vardagen i uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, men har alltid en välkomnande hemmahamn på kontoret i centrala Stockholm. Här ordnar vi mängder av aktiviteter under året för att vi ska utvecklas och ligga i framkant. Det är en del i vår kompetenskultur som bygger på samarbete och en vilja att stärka varandra.
 



 Med en stor och varierande kundbas, från små specialistföretag till stora och välkända företag och myndigheter, har vi en möjlighet att erbjuda utmanande och roliga uppdrag.

title: Software Engineer - Engineering Productivity
description:
**Help Shape the Future of Development at Nordnet: Join Our Engineering Productivity Team!**
 Innovation and empowering our developers are at the heart of Nordnet's engineering culture. We operate with a modern, microservices-based architecture featuring highly available and scalable backend applications, alongside advanced CI/CD and data pipelines built on technologies like Java, Spring Boot, PubSub, and Kubernetes. Our commitment to continuous delivery means we release to production over 100 times a day.
   

  

 We're looking for a passionate Software Engineer to join Nordnet's Engineering department and our dedicated
 **Engineering Productivity team** 
 . In this team you'll be improving the developer experience across the Engineering organization. Our team acts as an internal catalyst, focused on making our developers more efficient, informed, and successful.
   

  

**Your daily work will involve**
* Building and supporting our "Know Your Maintenance" framework: Empowering development teams with crucial technical insights for proactive maintenance.
* Developing tools and visualizations for complex migrations: Making large-scale changes smoother and more transparent for everyone involved.
* Creating and maintaining shared tooling, such as custom linters: Simplifying common development tasks and promoting best practices across teams.
* Identifying and addressing pain points in the developer workflow: Proactively seeking opportunities to improve efficiency and reduce friction.
* Collaborating and communicating closely with other development teams: Understanding their needs and building solutions that truly make a difference.
* Maintaining and evolving our internal developer portal based on Backstage: Ensuring it's a valuable and user-friendly hub for developers.


**This is you**
 You are a software engineer who thrives on solving challenges and empowering others. You're driven to learn new technologies and share your knowledge and passion. Your work style is organized, methodical, and adaptable, contributing positively to the team's dynamics and our ability to deliver impactful solutions.
   

  

 You bring previous experience in software engineering in a cloud-based environment. You have a natural curiosity for technology and a knack for selecting the right tools for the job. You also enjoy communicating your ideas clearly and collaborating effectively with others. An MSc degree in Computing/Engineering or equivalent is preferred, and familiarity with agile methodologies is essential. While experience and interest in savings and investments is a plus, it's not a requirement – your passion for developer productivity is what truly matters.
   

  

**As An Engineer On Our Team, You Are**
* A strong communicator, transparent in your work, and an active listener.
* Results-oriented, valuing data and outcomes over ego.
* A continuous learner, always seeking opportunities for growth.
* Passionate about automation and streamlining processes.
* Contributing to a positive and productive developer experience.


**You Have Experience In**
* Designing, building, and maintaining scalable and reliable systems.
* Modern software engineering principles and practices.
* Working with containerization and orchestration technologies.
* Implementing solutions for technical insights and data analysis.


**Concrete Qualifications**
* MSc degree in Computer Science or equivalent with more than 3 years experience working in an agile environment
* Experience in one or more of the following languages: TypeScript, Java, Golang
* Experience in building infrastructure using Terraform and similar technologies
* Experience with at least one of the big cloud providers
* Experience in GCP, BigQuery and VertexAI is meriting but not required.


**Culture At Nordnet Engineering**
* A just-do-it attitude, where everyone feels enabled and valued, regardless of their position or role.
* We live and breathe technology taking pride in our work
* We take a scientific approach by experimenting and learning
* We are curious and respectful, listen and ask questions with the intent to understand, while embracing different perspectives
* We assume positive intent in others and foster a culture where speaking up and challenging ideas is welcomed.
* A commitment to work-life balance, ensuring flexibility and support for our employees’ well-being.


**This is us**
 At Nordnet, technology is at the core of everything we do, driving innovation and maintaining our competitive edge. We’ve made over 30 000 production releases this year, releasing our web every other hour and our app every two days.
   

  

 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus
   

  

 on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and
   

  

 you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of
   

  

 sharp and committed colleagues.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having
   

  

 a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly
   

  

 atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts
   

  

 and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values –
   

  

 passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what
   

  

 you do.
   

  

 29 years ago, Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again with the aim of creating the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology.
   

  

 Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?
   

  

**Application**
 Apply today! – Please note that we only accept applications through our recruitment system. We do not consider email applications.
   

  

 At Nordnet, we value diversity and inclusion, and we are committed to creating an environment where everyone can succeed.
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Fullstack / Frontend Developer - Installation and Customer Care
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Fullstack Developer on our Installations & Customer Care team, you'll help transform how clean energy gets delivered by empowering the field workforce with intuitive, data-driven tools. You’ll work at the intersection of software and real-world impact, building solutions that help us improve our digital and operational processes and that help installers and technicians do their best work every day.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Build intelligent tools that replace manual paperwork and disconnected workflows with scalable digital solutions, bringing structure, traceability, and efficiency to field operations
* Develop services that simplify collaboration and handovers between installers, planners, and support teams, ensuring smooth transitions and fewer dropped balls across the customer journey
* Create platforms that collect and leverage operational data, helping us identify patterns, drive continuous improvement, and make smarter decisions at scale
* Design infrastructure that empowers a traditionally non-digital workforce to adopt and rely on intuitive tools, enabling them to focus on delivering high-quality installations
* Support post-installation care by enabling proactive maintenance, diagnostics, and revisit scheduling, improving long-term outcomes for both customers and the business
* Help us scale into new regions and markets by building flexible systems that adapt to varying local requirements, work practices, and service models


 We’re changing how clean energy is installed and maintained—making it smarter, faster, and better for everyone involved. If you’re a generalist, excited about solving problems and want to build systems that empower people in the field and drive tangible outcomes, this is the role for you.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Solid experience with product-driven software development and agile environments
* Experience with React and TypeScript
* Solid experience with Java, or other object-oriented languages
* Automated testing at different levels (unit tests, integration tests, etc.)


**Nice to have**
* Rapid growth journeys (start-ups, scale-ups, new environments)
* Databases (DynamoDB/PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka)
* Cloud DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, continuous delivery, logging, metrics)
* gRPC and Protobuf
* Terraform
* Kanban, Scrum, and/or a combination of both
* Digitalization and modernisation of manual labour
* Framework experience with Spring Boot


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes' walk away


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Java Developer
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a Java Developer to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Java developer at Qred, you'll join a team responsible for all payments in the company, consisting of other Java developers, one Product Manager, one Tech Lead and an Engineering Manager. This approach enables us to work together efficiently, ensuring full control, ownership, and accountability for the lifecycle of our products.
   

  

 We also believe in the trust in our developer’s capability of implementing, testing, reviewing, deploying daily, and operating their software in production.
   

  

**Requirements**
* A flexible and positive mindset as well as strong team spirit
* Proven knowledge and around 3-5 years of work experience in writing, releasing and maintaining backend applications using the following techs:
+ Java
+ Spring
+ JPA
+ PostgreSQL
+ Amazon Web Services


**Why join us?**
 This is the place to be if you’re looking for a place to grow. Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action. In addition to our great culture, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques offered by AWS, responsibility for the whole development chain, and last but not least a bunch of new competent colleagues to learn from!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based from our office in Stockholm (Drottninggatan 98). While we encourage a hybrid setup, we do expect you to be at least three days per week at the office. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. The start date is flexible, but the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Frontend Developer – Planning
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Frontend Developer on our Planning team, you'll help transform how clean energy gets delivered by empowering our planners with intuitive, data-driven tools. This team is responsible for optimizing the scheduling of Aira’s field force. The domain stretches across the whole customer journey, including tools for booking and coordinating sales visits, heat pump installation, and maintenance. You'll work at the intersection of software and real-world impact, building data products that help planners effectively schedule the field force based on proximity, dates, and other critical factors.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Build modern user interfaces that enable planners to visualize and optimize complex scheduling scenarios—bringing clarity, efficiency, and effectiveness to workforce planning
* Develop interactive map-based tools that help planners make better decisions based on geographical proximity, travel times, and resource availability
* Create intuitive dashboards that collect and visualize operational data, helping planners identify patterns, balance workloads, and make smarter scheduling decisions
* Design user experiences that simplify the planning process and reduce cognitive load, enabling planners to focus on strategic decisions rather than administrative tasks
* Support dynamic rescheduling capabilities with clear interfaces that highlight impacts and alternatives when changes occur
* Help us scale into new regions and markets by building flexible interfaces that adapt to varying local requirements, scheduling constraints, and service models


 We're changing how clean energy visits are planned and scheduled—making it smarter, faster, and better for everyone involved. If you're excited about building modern tooling and UIs that empower planning teams and drive tangible outcomes, this is the role for you.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Solid experience with product-driven software development and agile environments
* Experience with React and TypeScript
* Strong visualization skills, especially with maps and timeline interfaces


 We would also expect you to have experience in at least two of the following areas:
   

  

  

* Rapid growth journeys (start-ups, scale-ups, new environments)
* Kanban, Scrum, and/or a combination of both
* Next.js
* Data visualization libraries (D3.js, Chart.js, etc.)
* Map integration (Mapbox, Google Maps, Leaflet)
* Experience building planning or scheduling interfaces


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes' walk away


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about APIs and ready to shape the future of API management? Join us to work with cutting-edge technology, drive innovation, and take your skills to the next level!
   

  

 Join our dynamic team at Tele2, where Digital Capabilities & Technology (DCT) is the engine behind our products and services. As the essential enabler of our commercial ambitions, DCT brings automation and simplicity to the telecommunications industry, revolutionizing the way we connect and communicate. Within our organization, you’ll find everything from the backbone infrastructure of technology and IT systems, serving both our external & internal customers, to advanced analytics, AI creation, and frontend development. Our team plays a vital role in ensuring reliable and premium services through delivering exceptional experiences to our end customers, both Consumer and Enterprises, all the while supporting our colleagues within Tele2.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be an integral part of the API Team, enabling customers to access Tele2 services via APIs from various frontend channels. Our mission is to deliver an exceptional experience for both consumer and business customers by providing the necessary data they need. We offer services that allow data to be consumed by other applications and systems, managing these services from start to finish. Our team operates within the Microsoft stack, fostering a culture where teamwork and inclusion are paramount.
   

  

 Your tasks and responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):
   

  

* Developing and maintaining APIs built in .Net
* Managing and maintaining Azure API Management
* Overseeing the internal developer portal Backstage
* Communicating and supporting numerous stakeholders as a central component
* Providing specialist support across the organization for API management
* Sharing your expertise with the team and learning new skills from others
* Adhering to patterns that promote robust services and continuously improving the team’s capabilities


**What we look for:**
 We are a collaborative team that works closely with other backend and frontend teams to coordinate our efforts. Maintaining strong relationships with architects and being able to navigate unclear information to create our own requirements is crucial.
   

  

 To be successful in this role and a good fit for our team, you should have a strong ambition to develop new functionalities while managing and maintaining existing solutions.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe that you have:**
* At least some years of experience in API development using .Net
* Experience with Azure or other cloud platforms
* Knowledge of Docker, deploy pipelines, and Kubernetes terminology
* Some experience with JavaScript/React for working with Backstage
* Basic knowledge of security concepts (encryption with keys, SSL/TLS, HTTPS)
* A proactive and curious mindset

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**Paf stands out from other gaming companies in the market – and not just because of what we do, but
 *why* 
 we do it.** 
 Founded by the Red Cross, Save the Children, Public Health on Åland, and the foundation Dagens Barn, our mission from day one has been to generate funds for the benefit of society.
   

  

 We’re proud to be an award-winning industry leader in responsible gaming – raising the bar and setting new standards that put players first. All our profit goes to charity, and we strive for a long-term sustainable business that care about our employees, customers, and society at large.
   

  

 Now, we’re looking for a skilled
 **Senior Frontend Developer** 
 to strengthen our growing frontend team.
   

  

 THE TEAM & ROLE
   

  

 You’ll join a talented and skilled team, known for their collaborative mindset and passion for high-quality code. The team values clean architecture, thoughtful problem-solving, and open knowledge sharing - everyone contributes, and everyone’s voice matters.
   

  

 The team is responsible for the whole stack from Cloudflare, through React applications and API servers (Backend For Frontend), down to the infrastructure in AWS.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll work across the entire development lifecycle - from idea and planning to implementation, deployment, and continuous improvement.
   

  

 YOUR PROFILE
   

  

 You are curious, driven, and love building great user experiences. You take initiative but are also a strong team player who communicates clearly and asks for help when needed.
   

  

**We believe you have:**
* 5+ years of experience working with React
* Professional experience with TypeScript


**Bonus if you also bring:**
* API design skills with GraphQL and REST
* Experience with headless CMS (like Sanity)
* Familiarity with Redis or similar technologies
* Hands-on cloud experience, especially with AWS


 WE OFFER
   

  

* A company with steady, purposeful growth since 1966
* A workplace that values creativity, autonomy, and wellbeing
* Generous remote work options and support for your home setup
* Occupational healthcare and insurance
* A culture that prioritizes long-term success over short-term stress - overtime is something rare at Paf.


 WORK SETUP
   

  

**In Sweden** 
 : Choose your working location - 100% remote, hybrid, or office-based. Offices in Stockholm and Norrköping.
   

  

**In Mariehamn (Åland Islands)** 
 : Hybrid/remote, with 3 days per week in our beautiful, modern HQ. Enjoy weekly breakfasts, seminars, massage, an office gym, and more.
   

  

 PRACTICAL INFO
   

  

**Start** 
 : As soon as possible, depending on notice perio
   

  

**Type** 
 : Full-time, permanent with a 6-month probation period
   

  

**Location** 
 : Sweden or Mariehamn
   

  

**Application** 
 : Via our web form only (GDPR compliance)
   

  

**Recruitment Process** 
 : Includes a programming assignment, followed by tech interviews and a meeting with the hiring manager
   

  

 We review applications continuously and close the process as soon as we’ve found the right person.

title: Application Developer - Research Department
description:
Do you wish to make a difference for cancer patients all around the world? RaySearch develops a suite of cancer care software, and we are now looking for a talented Application Developer to our research department.
   

  

**About The Role**
 RaySearch Laboratories develops several software products focused on cancer care, primarily in radiation therapy. We are now looking for a skilled Application Developer to join our research department and contribute to the development of key functionalities for our latest research projects.
   

  

 In this role, you will support our experts in physics, image analysis, and optimization by integrating their algorithms and work into our products. You will be one of three C# and WPF specialists serving as a bridge between the research and development departments. Your mission will be to ensure the quality of frontend and application-level work, and to uphold the architecture patterns and development processes used across the organization.
   

  

 Your main work will be in our treatment planning system, RayStation. The research department collaborates closely with RayStation development scrum teams, UX, DevOps, Machine Learning, and with cancer clinics and machine vendors around the globe.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You are motivated by increasing cancer patients’ chances of survival and recovery. You take responsibility, communicate clearly, and always strive to write clean, well-structured code that supports long-term development. You enjoy working in a technologically advanced environment alongside other highly skilled developers.
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
* M.Sc or Ph.D in a relevant field.
* 3+ years of experience with C# .Net.
* Experience working on large or advanced systems.
* Experience collaborating with other senior developers in a learning-focused environment.
* English.


**Meriting Qualifications**
* Experience in MedTech.
* Experience with WPF.
* Swedish language skills.


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization
 **,** 
 where everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability to deliver exceptional results, pay close attention to detail, and consistently go the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in their field
 **,** 
 driven by a relentless focus on solving problems
 **-** 
 no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in leading the way in cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative solutions that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply to the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications by e-mail. Selection and interviews will be ongoing.

title: Software Engineer - AI/LLM
description:
Rillion is seeking a skilled Software Engineer to join our innovative and cross-functional AI product team. In this role, you’ll be pivotal in developing AI-powered products within AP (Accounts Payable) automation and enhancing our existing products. Together, we collaborate across the entire product lifecycle—from brainstorming and design to implementation—unlocking AI’s potential in AP automation. If you’re an experienced Software Engineer with AI/LLM experience who thrives in a dynamic environment, we’d love to have you on board!
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 




 You will play a key role in building and integrating AI-powered functionalities into our SaaS products, focusing on backend development and scalable architecture:
 


* Develop and maintain Python backend solutions and APIs for a new product based on a document processing pipeline.
* Integrate external LLM-based AI services (OpenAI, Azure AI) into our products.
* Ensure scalability and reliability with cloud-based architectures, infrastructure as code (IaC), and automation (preferably in Azure).
* Work closely with a cross-functional team to embed AI into our SaaS platform.
* Stay up to date with LLM advancements and help shape how we use AI.



  





**What You'll Bring:** 



* Solid backend development experience (Python) in SaaS or online product environments.
* Hands-on cloud experience (preferably Azure) with containers and IaC.
* Experience working with distributed systems, including APIs, message queues, and worker-based architectures.
* A problem-solving mindset and a collaborative, proactive approach that thrives in working in a team.
* Experience with AI/LLM APIs and external AI services.
* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.



  





**Bonus skills:** 



* Experience with RAG, tooling, observability, and LLM evaluation.
* Experience with front-end development (React) and UI/UX considerations.
* Experience with AI/ML frameworks, e.g. Pytorch, and machine learning.



  





**What we offer:** 



* Opportunity to work in a dynamic growth company
* Join a collaborative and supportive product team that will be responsible for the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to production.
* Talented colleagues ready to support the success in your career path
* Social events with your colleagues (breakfast, candy-time, afterwork etc.)
* A collection of different benefits, including a generous pension and insurance package
* Hybrid working model, 2 days per week in the office
* Come and enjoy our beautiful office in central Stockholm (on the 14th floor, with amazing views)



  





**The recruitment process:** 




 We review applications and invite for interviews continuously. A background check will be conducted on final candidates, pre-employment. If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact recruiter Victoria Stjernström at victoria.stjernstrom@rillion.com
 



  





**About Rillion:** 




*We are a global company founded in Sweden with 30 years’ experience in the AP Automation industry. We help finance professionals transform how they manage invoices by digitalizing and automating the entire process.* 




*By removing the manual steps of invoice handling, we enable finance teams to save time and effort, reducing the possibility of human error. Because* 
 we’re AP professionals ourselves, we understand how to give our customers everything they need, and nothing they don’t.
 



*Together with our owners at Altor, we´re on a journey to expand in our home markets, while entering new territories. To complete our mission, we need more talented people!* 




*Rillion is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.*
