title: Designer/Projektledare till Flygvapnets experimentkontor
description:
**Flygvapnets Utvecklingsenhet Luftstrid (UTV Luft) rekryterar Designer/Projektledare** **till** **Flygvapnets experimentkontor**


Vill du ha möjligheten att vara med och utveckla Flygvapnets förmågor för framtiden? Inom ramen för Flygvapnets innovationssystem driver Luftstridsskolans utvecklingsenhet luftstrid (UTV Luft) Flygvapnets experimentkontor. UTV Luft söker nu en driven och innovativ designer. Som designer kommer du att spela en viktig roll i utvecklingen av Flygvapnets framtida förmågor, du kommer att arbeta i ett team bestående av kvalificerad civil och militär personal där du bidrar som projektledare och stöd till flera projekt.


**Kort** **om enheten** **UTV LUFT:**


För att vidmakthålla Flygvapnets operativa förmåga kräver flygstridskrafternas insatsförband kontinuerlig utveckling både på kort och lång sikt.


UTV LUFT tillhör Luftstridsskolan (LSS) och genomför Flygvapnets förmågeutveckling vad avser teknik, taktik och metod för samtliga Flygvapnets förband och funktioner. Verksamheten spänner över såväl materielutveckling som konceptutveckling till förmågeintroduktion vid insatsförbanden.


**Sökande avdelning:**


LSS UTV LUFT – Flygvapnets experimentkontor


Experimentkontoret är en del av UTV LUFT. Uppgifterna inom experimentkontoret omfattar konceptutveckling, experiment, prototyper, digitalisering samt övrig snabb förmågeutveckling med bl.a. stöd till Flygvapnets förmågeutveckling, erfarenhetshantering samt experiment inom ramen för Flygvapnets innovationssystem. Verksamheten vid Experimentkontoret syftar till att Flygvapnet på ett snabbare och mer effektivt sätt ska kunna analysera och samordna förmågebehov för att därefter genomföra realiserbarhetsprövningar i primärt digital miljö. och praktiskt för att omsätta erfarenheter till nya funktioner, materiel och förmågor.


**Arbetsuppgifter:**


Som projektledare vid Experimentkontoret är du underställd chefen för Experimentkontoret och kommer att arbeta i en grupp om ca 10 medarbetare bestående av både civil och militär fast placerad personal samt konsulter.


Din roll innebär att vara ett stöd med design, både grafisk design och UX kan komma på tal, samtidigt som du leder projekt och stöttar andra projektledare med din expertis.


I rollen ingår bl.a.


* Designstöd, såsom UX och grafisk design


* Rapid prototyping


* Projektledning


* Stöd till andra projektledare

  

  

**Kvalifikationer**


* Designutbildning, minst högskoleingenjör industriell design eller motsvarande konstnärlig examina


* Förmåga att både leda projekt och stötta projekt med förslag på design


* Förmåga att snabbt anpassa sig i en agil miljö


* B-körkort (manuell)

  




**Meriterande**


* Erfarenhet av rapid prototyping och grafisk design är meriterande.


* Erfarenhet av digitalisering


* Erfarenhet av militär verksamhet

  




**Personliga egenskaper**


Vi söker en engagerad medarbetare som är strukturerad, prestigelös och kreativ. Arbetet ställer krav på att du är flexibel och kan arbeta självständigt men även tillsammans med andra.


Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.

  




**Övrigt:**


* Befattningsnivå: Civil


* Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning, provanställning om 6 månader tillämpas


* Arbetsort: Uppsala


* Resor med övernattning nationellt och internationellt förekommer


* Beräknat startdatum/tillträde: Snarast eller efter överenskommelse


* Tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass varvid säkerhetsprövning kommer att genomföras.

  




**Upplysningar om tjänsten** **kan** **lämnas av:**  

Marcus Tynnhammar, chef Experimentkontoret tfn 070-874 11 15

  




**För** **Information** **om** **rekryteringsprocessen kontakta:**  

HR-generalist Olivia Liw, tfn 076-641 42 67

  




**Fackliga företrädare**:


OFR/O Ärna Tim Björklund, tfn 070-649 65 59  

OFR/S & Försvarsförbundet Helena Lemnell tfn 070-836 10 28  

SEKO Åsa Karlsson nås via vx 018-19 60 00  

SACO nås via vx 018-19 60 00

  




Välkommen med din ansökan **senast** 2025-07-30.  

  

Dinansökan bör innehålla CV samt ansökningsbrev där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för rubricerad befattning.
company_description: Försvarsmakten är en svensk statlig förvaltningsmyndighet som ansvarar för landets säkerhet.

title: Senior Product Manager för digital innovation
description:
Om företaget
  
Avaron AB är ett svenskt konsultbolag som hjälper nordiska och internationella organisationer att driva igenom sina mest affärskritiska digitala satsningar. Våra uppdrag sträcker sig från strategisk rådgivning till hands-on leverans, alltid med fokus på värdeskapande, transparens och långsiktiga relationer. Nu söker vi en Senior Product Manager som, som en del av Avarons konsultteam, leder ett tvärfunktionellt produktteam hos en av våra större kunder inom den digitala sektorn.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
Som Senior Product Manager blir du den naturliga samordnaren mellan affär, teknik och design. Du:
  
Leder dagliga stand-ups och skapar rätt förutsättningar för ett 15-tal specialister inom utveckling, dataanalys och UX.
  
Samlar in och analyserar kund- och verksamhetsinsikter och omsätter dem till konkreta förbättringar.
  
Ansvarar för sprintplanering, backlog-prioritering och säkerställer att teamet levererar värde i varje iteration.
  
Tar fram och underhåller produktens roadmap, säkerställer att den följer uppsatta OKR: er och kommunicerar framsteg till intressenter.
  
Arbetar nära utvecklingsteamet för att översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar och ser till att beslut fattas på data-drivna grunder.
  
  

Kvalifikationer (Ska-krav)
  
Flera års erfarenhet som Senior Product Manager eller motsvarande roll.
  
Dokumenterad vana av att leda större, tvärfunktionella produktteam.
  
God förståelse för mjukvaruutveckling och moderna tekniska miljöer.
  
Förmåga att omsätta kund- och affärsinsikter till prioriterade åtgärder och mätbara resultat.
  
Flytande engelska i tal och skrift.
  
  

Meriterande (Bra att ha)
  
Erfarenhet av data-driven produktutveckling och A/B-testning.
  
Djup kunskap om agila ramverk såsom Scrum och Kanban.
  
Tidigare arbete med OKR-styrning på strategisk nivå.
  
Erfarenhet av e-handels- eller plattformsprodukter i snabbväxande miljöer.
  
Bakgrund inom UX-research eller datavisualisering.
  
  

Ansökan
  
Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Skicka därför din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Mejla personligt brev och CV till jobb@avaron.se och märk mejlet med “Senior Product Manager för digital innovation (13643)”. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
**Join Eletive to build workplaces where people thrive!**
---------------------------------------------------------


Did you know that engaged employees feel a stronger sense of meaningfulness in their work and are 3x more likely to stay with their company? At Eletive, we believe engaged employees are the key to thriving organizations. That’s why our vision is simple: **a world where people thrive at work and feel motivated and empowered to perform at their best.**


Eletive is not just our company name—it’s also the name of our intelligent People Success Platform. Our platform helps organizations measure and increase engagement, fostering workplaces where people truly thrive.


We’re on an exciting scale-up journey with ambitious global growth plans—and that’s where you come in!

### **What's the role about?**


As our new Senior UX Designer, you’ll be an essential part of the Product Team, contributing to Eletive’s mission of increasing well-being at work worldwide. You’ll focus on creating seamless, user-centred experiences that help HR teams and employees thrive. Working in a cross-functional team with Product Managers, Developers, and fellow Designers, you’ll turn ideas into valuable, intuitive product features.

**Your key responsibilities will include:**

  

* **Research and analyze** user behaviours, needs, and pain points to create data-driven designs.
* **Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes** for new product features and continuous improvements.
* **Collaborate with the design team, product managers, and developers** to align user needs with business goals.
* **Validate ideas** through user research and feedback, ensuring designs resonate with our users.
* **Contribute to cross-functional team discussions**, helping shape product specifications and future directions.
* **Continuously learn and evolve**, exploring new solutions, tools, and methods to improve efficiency and creativity.

### **To thrive in the role we believe that you …**

* Have a relevant education in UX/UI Design or similar field.
* Have 5+ years of experience designing modern UX/UI for enterprise software products (web or mobile applications).
* Are proficient in Figma (or similar), with experience working in design systems.
* Enjoy both UX and UI design, with a passion for creating user-centered, visually appealing solutions.
* Collaborate closely with developers and can turn technical descriptions and research into wireframes, mockups, and prototypes.
* Are curious about user research and value data-driven design decisions.
* Are structured, detail-oriented, and proactive, always striving for innovative solutions.
* Are fluent in English. Swedish is a plus but not mandatory.
* Are aligned with our Core Values:
	+ We Grow Together: You value teamwork and helping others succeed.
	+ We Lead Ourselves: You take ownership and responsibility for your work.
	+ We Innovate and Iterate: You embrace creativity and continuous improvement.

### **Why Eletive?**


At Eletive, we believe in creating a workplace where everyone can do their best work and enjoy a supportive, dynamic environment. This is what you can expect when joining us:

* Be part of a team with diverse interests and backgrounds, united by a shared mission to make workplaces better. We speak many languages but we all unite in English in our meetings and internal communication.
* Hybrid work setup, flexible hours, and two weeks a year to work fully remote from anywhere in the world.
* Six weeks of vacation, a wellness grant, insurance package, and lots of snacks to keep you energized.
* Our Malmö office is just three minutes from the central station, featuring a rooftop terrace, play area, and even a workout station.
* Enjoy fika, Friday breakfasts, kickoffs, afterworks, and much more.

**We look forward to getting to know you!**

title: Senior Graphic Designer-Yaddly
description:
Location: Hybrid  

Department: Creative  

Reports To: Head of Design  

Experience Required: 5–7 years (agency or in-house)  

Job Overview:  

We are searching for a creative and experienced Senior Graphic Designer to join our expanding team. The successful candidate will deliver outstanding visual design solutions across digital and print channels, supporting both client and internal projects. This role requires a strategic mindset, acute attention to detail, and a portfolio demonstrating a high standard of graphic design for marketing campaigns, branding, content assets, and more.


**Key Responsibilities for Senior Graphic Designer – Design and Creative Projects**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* Conceptualise and execute compelling graphic designs for digital campaigns, print marketing, branding, and presentations.
* Collaborate with marketing, social media, and copywriting teams to create engaging visual content aligned with brand guidelines.
* Lead and participate in design brainstorming sessions, offering creative solutions and feedback to colleagues.
* Oversee multiple design projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and high visual quality across all outputs.
* Present design ideas and rationale clearly to internal stakeholders and clients as required.
* Stay up to date with industry trends, graphic design technologies, and innovative design techniques.
* Support and mentor junior designers, managing feedback and development for team growth.

### **Required Qualifications and Graphic Design Skills**

* 5–7 years proven experience in a graphic or visual design role, ideally in both agency and in-house environments.
* Expert skill level with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and familiarity with Figma or Sketch.
* Strong portfolio showcasing a range of work, including digital ads, web graphics, social media visuals, and print materials.
* Ability to interpret creative briefs, translate concepts into visuals, and deliver design work within deadlines.
* Excellent communication skills and confidence presenting ideas in English.
* Thorough understanding of branding, typography, colour theory, and layout principles.
* Experience preparing print-ready files and working with printers or production teams.
* Organised, self-motivated, and comfortable working both independently and as part of a cross-functional team.

#### **Preferred Experience in Senior Graphic Designer Roles**

* Experience in B2B, SaaS, technology, or professional services sectors.
* Motion graphics experience using After Effects or similar software.
* Familiarity with UX/UI design practices and web asset production.
* Knowledge of accessibility principles in digital design.
* Experience mentoring or supervising junior designers.

##### **What We Offer in Our Creative Team – Senior Graphic Designer Benefits**

* Hybrid working environment with flexible hours.
* Opportunities for professional development and training in creative design.
* Collaborative and supportive team culture.
* Competitive salary package based on experience.
* Varied work with high-profile projects and clients.

###### **How to Apply for the Senior Graphic Designer Role**


To be considered for this role, please submit your CV and a link to your portfolio demonstrating your experience and creativity in graphic design. We value diversity and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds.

title: Product Designer – Build the Brand & UX for a Leading...
description:
**Do you want to shape how people perceive and interact with one of the Nordics’ fastest-growing investment platforms? If so, join us as a Product Designer in Stockholm.**


Lysa’s vision is to set a new standard in savings through automation, efficiency, and an unwavering dedication to our customers’ best interests. We believe that many institutions work against their customers – and we see a significant opportunity to establish a new financial champion.


We’re on a mission to make it simpler for people to save smarter. To succeed, we need to continuously evolve our product, brand, and user experience. We already have an outstanding team, but to further accelerate our growth, we’re looking for a talented Product Designer to join our ARC team – Attract, Retain, Convert.

**About the role**
------------------


As a Product Designer at Lysa, you’ll be embedded in a cross-functional product team that works on growing and shaping the first impression of Lysa. You’ll collaborate closely with a product manager, developers, legal, and fellow designers – all focused on attracting new users and building trust through compelling, high-quality experiences.


This role sits in our ARC team, responsible for the marketing site, brand expression, referral journeys, onboarding flows, and notification handling.

**What you’ll do**
------------------

* Own and drive design initiatives end-to-end – from insight and concept to final delivery
* Design and optimize the user journey across the marketing site, referral flows, notifications, and onboarding features
* Refine and evolve Lysa’s visual identity and ensure consistency across product and marketing
* Collaborate closely with product managers, developers, legal, and other stakeholders
* Create engaging visuals – from user interfaces and motion design to illustrations and brand assets
* Shape how people feel and think about saving and investing – one design decision at a time

**Who you are**
---------------


We’re looking for someone with 2–6 years of experience in digital product design, ideally with exposure to both user experience and brand design. You may have started as a UX designer and developed strong visual skills, or come from a visual/brand background and grown into interaction and product thinking.


You:  

* Have a strong portfolio showcasing user experience, brand, and marketing work
* Create intuitive and delightful experiences for web and/or mobile
* Know how to translate insights, data, and business needs into elegant design solutions
* Communicate clearly and confidently – visually, verbally, and with cross-functional teams
* Enjoy running ideation workshops, giving and receiving feedback, and iterating fast
* Are curious about AI’s role in the design process and keep up with tools like Figma
* Can scope, prioritize, and lead your own initiatives – from idea to measurable impact
**Why Lysa?**
-------------

**Purpose-driven product** – We’re building a transparent, customer-first financial platform for the long term.  

**Design as a strategic function** – You’ll join a growing design team that works closely with product, brand, and marketing.  

**Real user impact** – Your work influences how over 180,000 users interact with €4.5+ billion in assets.  

**Hybrid work** – Work from our Stockholm office, with flexibility to work remotely 2–3 days per week.  

**Inclusive, people-first culture** – We believe diverse teams build better products and welcome applicants of all backgrounds.

**Ready to design for real impact?**
------------------------------------


Apply with your **CV and portfolio** – no cover letter needed. We review applications continuously.

**Don't meet every single requirement?** That’s okay – we value potential and perspective just as much as experience. If you’re excited about the role, we encourage you to apply.


The recruitment process is being managed by our partners at Recommended by. For inquiries, you are welcome to contact our recruitment specialist, Holger Nilsson at holger.nilsson@recommendedby.se

**Location**
------------


Stockholm

**Job type**
------------


Full-time, permanent

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Job Details**

**Hours:** Full Time

**Location:** Fully remote. This opportunity is open to you if you can legally work remotely from Sweden.

**Contract:** Permanent


At Play’n GO we enjoy a flexible freedom to shape our own days. Everyone we hire is unique and every role we fill has certain performance expectations. The day-to-day challenges of work and life will be unique to you but our commitment to helping you find a balance will never vary.

**From the GO**


At Play’n GO our purpose is to entertain. Our pleasure is in working with people ready to make a difference that lasts. We are pioneers. We were the first entertainment supplier to recognise the potential of gaming on the GO and create the innovative mobile games which supercharged our industry and inspired our name. Today, Play’n GO is the leading gaming entertainment supplier to casinos in regulated markets the world over. And we are still growing.


With growth comes opportunity. This could be yours. Are you ready to help us face challenges and find solutions that get us both to the next level of excellence?

**What** **the role entails**


Some of the key responsibilities of our Software Engineer will be:

  

* Analyse, troubleshoot, debug and optimize code
* Analyse and implement integrations within existing internal applications and tools
* Develop web applications and systems in various programming languages, utilizing industry best practices and standards
* Do technical analysis and design based on product requirements
* Contribute to improvements to the automation and continuous delivery process in order to improve quality and stability
* Create technical documentation for reference, knowledge and information sharing
* Provide support and foster a collaborative working environment with other teams and colleagues to ensure successful project outcomes

 **What we ask of you:**


**Essential skills:**

* Proficiency in .NET Core, with strong skills in C#.
* Expertise in Amazon Cloud/ AWS knowledge
* Experience with SQL databases, primarily MSSQL or MySQL.
* Demonstrated ability in both backend and frontend development, including proficiency in TypeScript.
* Familiarity with unit testing principles and practices.
* Competency in version control systems, particularly GIT.
* Knowledge of container technology, specifically ECS and Docker.
* Exposure to continuous integration tools like TeamCity.
* A keen appetite for continuous learning.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.

 **Preferred skills:**

* A solid understanding of systems design principles and practices.
* Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) or equivalent cloud platforms.
* Familiarity with CloudFormation or AWS CDK.
* Proficiency in frontend frameworks such as Angular or React.
* Experience in UX/UI design.

**What’s** in it for you?


If you feel great, you’ll do great. Our employees know that their package of benefits, activities, and initiatives are some of the most generous in the industry. From challenges to chill outs, the fun we share at play helps inspire excellence from the go.


Apply now to find out more. It’s your best move. This opportunity will remain open until we meet the right candidate.


GO for it.

*We believe the way forward relies on well-regulated gaming and player safety. Our commitment* to this sets the standard for our industry.

title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
description:
**Please note: This role is only available to candidates who live in Europe and do not require sponsorship.**

### **Responsibilities**

* Back-end coding of all business logic: UI/UX APls, REST APls, billing, and related systems
* Mentoring of other developers, through code reviews, and one on one sessions.
* Work with product management to gather requirements for implementation.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively on projects.

### **Qualifications**

* 6+ years hands-on development experience in Ruby on Rails
* Extensive experience on billing, asynchronous, and rapid-scaling systems
* Experience working on large distributed systems
* Proven ability to generate specifications from business requirements and execute these on-spec and on-time
* Leadership skills and willingness to support direct manager with team needs
* Experience working in a remote environment and communicating effectively with global team members

title: Product Designer (permanent)
description:
We’re looking for a **Product Designer** to permanently join our in-house team in Stockholm.  

  

We’re building AI-first solutions across our app, and design plays a central role in making these experiences intuitive, useful, and engaging. You’ll work hands-on across mobile and web to shape user journeys, interfaces, and interactions that help millions of people build healthier habits.You’re confident in both UX and UI and enjoy solving real problems through thoughtful, practical design. You’ll work closely with engineers, designers, and other team members to bring ideas from concept to launch.

 **What you’ll do**

* Design seamless user journeys and conversion-optimized interfaces
* Translate insights into user-centered design solutions
* Create high-quality prototypes and interaction models using modern tools
* Contribute to a consistent design system across platforms
  

**What you’ll bring**

* Proven experience in designing digital products (mobile/web), preferably in health tech or SaaS
* Comfort working across the full design process—from concept to delivery
* Ability to move fast while keeping a high bar for craft and clarity

Confident in using modern technologies, including generative AI, in prototyping, production, and as part of the product experience  
* 

##### **Why Lifesum is your next career move**


Lifesum is a pioneering consumer health-tech company on a mission to transform healthy living into an inspiring and accessible journey. Trusted by over 60 million users worldwide, we empower individuals to build healthier, more sustainable habits that improve their lives every day. As part of our commitment to innovation, we are becoming an AI-first company, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to revolutionize our tech stack, feature design, and development. Our AI-driven solutions provide personalized insights and smarter tools, making healthy choices easier, more intuitive, and deeply engaging. Through our forward-thinking platform, we spark motivation and inspire positive change, making healthy eating not just easier but truly enjoyable. Together, we’re shaping a future where living well feels effortless, empowering, and powered by the possibilities of AI.


We are a hybrid global team headquartered in Stockholm, comprised of passionate and entrepreneurial individuals working together to create something meaningful. At Lifesum, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference and positively impact millions of lives by helping our users on their personal journeys to look and feel better every day. Expanding our team with skilled and ambitious individuals is key to enhancing the value we provide to people worldwide.  

  

**We are just getting started**


Lifesum has over 60 million registered users worldwide, and our journey to building the world’s leading advanced wellness platform is just beginning. We have a strong foundation and a drive to achieve even more. As one unified team of talented individuals with a solution-oriented, “can-do” mindset, we are committed to continuously improving the user experience and delivering greater value to our global Lifesum community

##### **What we offer**

* Empowerment and Ownership: Trust and responsibility in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your contributions truly matter.
* Exciting Projects: Collaborate on impactful projects with some of the world’s most successful companies.
* Career Growth: Dedicated space and support to develop and advance your career.
* Professional Development: An individual training and development budget to fuel your growth.
* Wellness Focus: A wellness allowance to support a healthy lifestyle.
* Health and Wellbeing: Private health insurance to prioritize your peace of mind.
* Community Spirit: Engage in fun and meaningful team activities that foster connection and collaboration
* Time Off: Enjoy 30 paid vacation days per year to recharge and explore.
* Parental Benefits: Comprehensive parental leave pay to support your family journey.
* Financial Security: Pension plans designed to help you plan for the future.


If this sounds exciting, we’d love to hear from you and get to know you better. Send us your resumé, your portfolio and let us know why you’re interested in the role and why Lifesum feels like the perfect fit for you. We welcome everyone and look forward to receiving your application!

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.
   

  

 To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.
   

  

 For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
   

  

**A few examples of your responsibilities** 
* Help shape outstanding user experiences and impact the success of our products by creating flawless UI and UX designs, from conceptualization to delivery. You’ll take a human-first approach to designing products, ensuring they delight users by being as effective as they are aesthetically pleasing.
* Make use of prototyping tools to ensure your designs are intuitive and to explore new, innovative ways of designing interactions.
* Work closely with product managers and software engineers to propose new features and improve the quality of both mobile and desktop apps.
* Focus on user testing and research to ensure our customers are always at the core of our product designs.
* Find, together with engineers, the most efficient trade-off between high-value solutions for users and the complexity of implementation.
* Leverage usage data to evaluate the impact of your designs, and apply your learnings to the next iterations.


**What we look for** 
* **Reasoning ability.** 
 Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
* **Drive.** 
 You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
* **Team spirit.** 
 You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
* **Proficiency in English.** 
 You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


**What we offer** 
* **Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams.** 
 You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
* **An exceptional opportunity for growth.** 
 We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
* **Competitive pay and access to equity in the company.** 
 Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £54,545 in the UK and €52,246 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £66,779 and £149,636 in the UK, and €63,965 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
* **All. These. Benefits.** 
 Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


**Commitment & contract**
 Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
* **All. These. Benefits.** 
 Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


**Commitment & contract**
 Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

title: Product Designer (freelance + interim)
description:
We’re looking for a
 **Product Designer** 
 to join our in-house team in Stockholm as a freelancer for a short-term project (max. up to 8-12 weeks).
   

  

 We’re building AI-first solutions across our app, and design plays a central role in making these experiences intuitive, useful, and engaging. You’ll work hands-on across mobile and web to shape user journeys, interfaces, and interactions that help millions of people build healthier habits.You’re confident in both UX and UI and enjoy solving real problems through thoughtful, practical design. You’ll work closely with engineers, designers, and other team members to bring ideas from concept to launch.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design seamless user journeys and conversion-optimized interfaces
* Translate insights into user-centered design solutions
* Create high-quality prototypes and interaction models using modern tools
* Contribute to a consistent design system across platforms


**What You’ll Bring**
* Proven experience in designing digital products (mobile/web), preferably in health tech or SaaS
* Comfort working across the full design process—from concept to delivery
* Ability to move fast while keeping a high bar for craft and clarity
* Confident in using modern technologies, including generative AI, in prototyping, production, and as part of the product experience


 Why Lifesum is your next career move
   

  

 Lifesum is a pioneering consumer health-tech company on a mission to transform healthy living into an inspiring and accessible journey. Trusted by over 60 million users worldwide, we empower individuals to build healthier, more sustainable habits that improve their lives every day. As part of our commitment to innovation, we are becoming an AI-first company, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to revolutionize our tech stack, feature design, and development. Our AI-driven solutions provide personalized insights and smarter tools, making healthy choices easier, more intuitive, and deeply engaging. Through our forward-thinking platform, we spark motivation and inspire positive change, making healthy eating not just easier but truly enjoyable. Together, we’re shaping a future where living well feels effortless, empowering, and powered by the possibilities of AI.
   

  

 We are a hybrid global team headquartered in Stockholm, comprised of passionate and entrepreneurial individuals working together to create something meaningful. At Lifesum, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference and positively impact millions of lives by helping our users on their personal journeys to look and feel better every day. Expanding our team with skilled and ambitious individuals is key to enhancing the value we provide to people worldwide.
   

  

**We are just getting started**
 Lifesum has over 60 million registered users worldwide, and our journey to building the world’s leading advanced wellness platform is just beginning. We have a strong foundation and a drive to achieve even more. As one unified team of talented individuals with a solution-oriented, “can-do” mindset, we are committed to continuously improving the user experience and delivering greater value to our global Lifesum community
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* Empowerment and Ownership: Trust and responsibility in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your contributions truly matter.
* Exciting Projects: Collaborate on impactful projects with some of the world’s most successful companies.
* Career Growth: Dedicated space to develop and advance your career.
* Community Spirit: Engage in fun and meaningful team activities that foster connection and collaboration


 If this sounds exciting, we’d love to hear from you and get to know you better. Send us your resumé, portfolio and let us know why you’re interested in the role and why Lifesum feels like the perfect fit for you. We welcome everyone and look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 Lifesum is one of the fastest-growing global digital health companies. Our product aims to simplify the path to long-term healthy eating, and our technology motivates users to live a more balanced lifestyle with personalized plans for better and healthier eating.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Löpande support och incidenthantering, inklusive vid driftstörningar.
   

  

 Planerad nyutveckling
   

  

 Säker och kontrollerad överlämning från befintlig leverantör.
   

  

 Arbete i lokal DevOps-miljö med automatiserade pipelines.
   

  

**Teknisk miljö:**
 Windows
   

  

 C#
   

  

 SQL Server
   

  

 Intern DevOps-miljö
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Erfarenhet av att designa användargränssnitt i samverkan med användare.
* God kommunikativ förmåga, både gentemot tekniska team och verksamhetsrepresentanter
* Förmåga att dokumentera designlösningar och dess struktur.
* Analytisk förmåga och förståelse för verksamhetsbehov.
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder


**Meriterande**
 Förståelse för offentlig verksamhet och dess processer.
   

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 23-06-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Product Designer
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*
**Om tjänsten**
*Var med och forma framtiden för Fortnox finansiella tjänster med nya lösningar för företagslån, betalningar,* 
 bank och fakturatjänster!
   

  

 Vi går en spännande tid till mötes för våra designers på Fortnox då vår designfunktion framöver kommer att ta en mycket mer central roll i bolagets strategiska utveckling. Vi söker nu produktdesigners som vill vara med på, och bidra till denna omställning och hjälpa oss att skapa en sömlös och engagerande användarupplevelse i toppklass.
   

  

**Mer specifikt kommer du att:**
* Ingå i ett tvärfunktionellt team och ansvara för användarupplevelsen.
* Samarbeta nära produkt-, och utveckling och involvera dem i designarbetet. riva UX-research genom olika tekniker, exempelvis fokusgrupper, intervjuer, observation och A/B-tester.
* Vara en nyckelperson i dialogen med utvecklare för att säkerställa att designbeslut och UI-komponenter implementeras med kvalitet och precision.
* Skapa prototyper och mockups, och utveckla koncept- och interaktionsdesign som inspirerar och engagerar våra användare.
* Kartlägga, utforma och utveckla användarresor som produkten ingår i, och säkerställa att vi har en väl fungerande och sammanhängande upplevelse.
* Skriva och bidra med genomtänkt och användarcentrerad UX-copy.
* Vi söker dig som
* Brinner för produktdesign och har förmågan att bidra genom hela designprocessen.
* Du har några års erfarenhet av att jobba med Design, UI/UX och research. Du rapporterar till och arbetar nära design-områdes chefen men är bekväm med att självständigt ta initiativ, planera och genomföra ditt arbete.
* Har jobbat med agil produktutveckling och tror på snabba iterationer och kontinuerligt lärande.
* Har erfarenhet av datadrivet arbete med både kvalitativ och kvantitativ data.
* Har ett kreativt sinne och en naturlig fallenhet för användbarhet, flöden, färg och form.
* Har förmågan att översätta användarnas behov och designa lösningar som ligger i linje med såväl användarnas önskemål som Fortnox affärsplan.
* Har kunskap i designteori och kan arbeta strukturerat enligt designprinciper, metoder och verktyg.
* Är kommunikativ och känner sig bekväm att dela sina tillvägagångssätt och resultat med kollegor och stakeholders i organisationen.
* Behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


**Vi erbjuder**
 På Fortnox bygger teamen sin egen teamkultur och ramverk. Som produktdesigner hos oss kommer du att ingå i ett autonomt team som själv styr över sina arbetsprocesser och releaser av sina egna tjänster i en stimulerande domän. Du kommer att arbeta i skärpunkten mellan det beprövade, stabila och det nya, spännande. Du kommer därför att ha möjlighet att utvecklas genom att jobba tillsammans med erfarna och kompetenta kollegor, samt ha stor möjlighet att påverka hur vi designar våra produkter framåt.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter flexibilitet och möjligheten att arbeta på distans, samtidigt som vi strävar efter att skapa en inspirerande och kreativ arbetsmiljö för våra medarbetare. Vårt team är fördelat över kontoren i Malmö, Växjö och Stockholm, vilket innebär att din arbetsdag kommer att vara en kombination av digitalt och fysiskt arbete. På våra kontor ses vi 2–3 dagar i veckan, och vi söker dig som trivs med att också vara på plats med jämna mellanrum!
   

  

**Om Fortnox**
*Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se* 
*www.fortnox.se* 
*.*
**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: UX Research Lead
description:
*Vill du vara med och skapa värdefulla tjänster baserade på kundinsikter och data? Vi söker nu en erfaren UX Research Lead som brinner för att stärka vår UX research-kapacitet och bidra till att våra digitala tjänster är attraktiva för våra kunder och stärker vår affär. Välkommen till Länsförsäkringar AB, där vi tar användarupplevelsen på allvar!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som UX Research Lead kommer du att ha en central roll i att utveckla och implementera strategier för UX research inom vår organisation. Du kommer att arbeta nära både UX designers och produktledare för att säkerställa att kundinsikter och data integreras effektivt i vår utvecklingsprocess. Din roll innebär att du kommer att coacha och stötta designers och team, samt inspirera hela organisationen att arbeta datadrivet och insiktsbaserat. Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson i att säkerställa att våra digitala tjänster möter kundernas behov och förväntningar, och att vi kontinuerligt förbättrar våra produkter baserat på data och insikter.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter är följande:
   

  

* Stötta produktledare i product discovery och insiktsdrivna beslut och prioriteringar.
* Inspirera organisationen att arbeta datadrivet för att på djupet förstå våra utmaningar och vår potential för att skapa värde för våra kunder.
* Coacha UX designers i metod och process för att säkerställa hög kvalitet i UX research.
* Coacha designers och team att testa hypoteser och validera lösningar för att optimera tjänsternas framgång.
* Kommunicera och presentera insiktsarbetet i relevanta forum.
* Fungera som användarens röst i organisationen och förmedla kundens perspektiv genom hela utvecklingsprocessen.


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Relevant akademisk examen.
* Behärska relevanta metoder för UX Research, användningsstudier och kundinsiktsarbete.
* Förståelse för hur användarinsikter kan omvandlas till värde för både användare och affär.
* Inlyssnande och övertygande i kommunikation med stakeholders.
* Van att leda, coacha och inspirera designers och team.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av lead-roll eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med digitala tjänster och produkter riktade mot konsument, med många användare.
* Erfarenhet av insiktsdriven design i en lean-agil organisation.
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med kvantitativa data.


 Som person är du övertygande och kan hitta vägar framåt där förståelsen för användarresearch är låg. Du är lyhörd och tar in organisationens önskemål och perspektiv för att förstå hur du bäst skapar värde. Du är coachande och har förmågan att sprida kunskap och vägleda i metod och process, vilket kommer att vara avgörande för din framgång.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Ytterst tillhör du enheten Digital & IT. Du kommer att höra till designteamet, med cirka 40 kollegor inom UX design, UI design, UX writing och tillgänglighet. Stämningen inom både teamet och bolaget är familjär, och det är alltid högt i tak hos oss. Vi värdesätter en hållbar balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Länsförsäkringar ABs kultur präglas av viljan att göra det bästa för våra kunder, som ju äger oss, men också av viljan att prestera och innovera på ett hållbart sätt.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
***Observera att svarstiden för denna rekryteringsprocess kan vara längre än vanligt, detta på grund av semestertider. Vi uppskattar ditt tålamod och kommer att återkomma så snart som möjligt.***
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-07-08**

title: 🚀Arfve is Launching — and We Need You.
description:
Arfve is preparing to launch a groundbreaking product at the intersection of 
 **modular design, intelligent tech, and sustainable innovation** 
 . As we gear up for our crowdfunding campaign, we’re building a small, high-impact creative team to help bring our story to life across digital platforms.
 



 We’re looking for 
 **skilled and passionate creators** 
  who are ready to help shape the future of technology — not just document it.
 



  




 🧠
 
 Here's Who We're Looking for Right Now
 
 🔹 
 **Senior 3D Content Creators** 

 You’ll be at the heart of our visual storytelling — shaping how the world sees Arfve.
 



**We’re looking for:** 



* Proven experience in 3D modeling & animation (Blender, Cinema 4D, Unreal, etc.)
* Ability to craft 
 **high-quality videos and visuals** 
  that explain product features, modularity, and UX
* Strong motion design and product showcase skills
* An eye for detail and futuristic minimalism
* A 
 **portfolio or reel** 
  showing relevant work is required



 This is the 
 **core creative role** 
  that will help Arfve take off visually and emotionally.
 



  




 🔸 We’re Also Looking For:📲 
 **Community & Influencer Outreach Intern** 

 You’ll help us reach the right voices — creators, early adopters, and micro-influencers who share our values.
 



**Your role:** 



* Identify and connect with creators on TikTok, Instagram & LinkedIn
* Manage content publishing: memes, carousels, reels, polls
* Help amplify our brand story and campaign message
* Bonus: experience in user-generated content or community building



 A portfolio or examples of past projects is highly valued.
 



  




 🌍 What You’ll Get:
 * Be part of a 
 **global launch** 
  for a modular AI-powered wearable
* Collaborate with a passionate, async-first creative team
* A strong portfolio piece with real-world impact
* Potential 
 **transition to a paid role after summer**
* Fully remote, async-friendly collaboration
* The chance to shape something meaningful from the ground up



 ⚠️ Note: These are unpaid internship roles to start — we’re looking for creators who already have some experience and are excited to contribute to something bold.
 



  





 📩 
 **Apply Now** 




 Send your portfolio or reel to: 
 **team@arfve.com** 




 Subject: 
 *Arfve Creative Intern – [Your Name]* 




 Let’s build the future of listening — together.

title: Web Content Editor
description:
På Proffsmagasinet strävar vi efter en överlägsen upplevelse för våra kunder, något som också genomsyrar vår arbetsplats och vår kultur. Hos oss blir du en del av något större där vi är övertygande om att tillsammans är bättre än ensam. Gemenskapen hos oss är en av våra framgångsfaktorer och det är vi stolta över. Vill du utvecklas med oss och samtidigt ha den bästa tiden i ditt arbetsliv? Sök till oss idag!
   

  

**Rollbeskrivning**
 Som Web Content Editor arbetar du med berikning av produkter i vår e-handel och bidrar till utveckling av organisationens masterdatahantering. Rollen är huvudsakligen inriktad på arbete med produktinformation och teknisk data men även textproduktion och SEO.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
* Du jobbar på Web Content avdelningen som består av 9 personer och ingår i säljavdelningen som består av ca 25 personer.
* Vi sitter på ett kontor vid Marievik i Liljeholmen.
* Arbetstiderna är kontorstider med flexmöjligheter.


**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**
* Utföra produktberikning och säkerställa att produktdata följer kvalitetsstandarder och riktlinjer.
* Identifiera och åtgärda datafel samt föreslå förbättringar av processer och system.
* Samarbeta med andra avdelningar, såsom SEO, UX och kundupplevelse, för att säkerställa att artikelpresentation uppfyller affärsmålen.
* Delta aktivt i teamets planering och bidra till ett effektivt arbete i agila sprintar.
* Bidra till att utveckla och effektivisera teamets arbetsmetoder samt stödja kollegor.
* Utveckla din tekniska förståelse för system och processer och föreslå strategiska förbättringar.


**Kvalifikationer och erfarenheter** 
 :
   

  

* Kompetens: Stark teknisk förståelse för system, datakvalitet och processer.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i PIM-system och andra relaterade verktyg är meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av administrativa uppgifter, gärna inom e-handel och vår bransch.
* Goda kunskaper i Excel.
* God skriftlig förmåga och erfarenhet av säljande produkttexter.


**Personliga egenskaper:**
* Noggrannhet och strukturerat arbetssätt.
* Initiativtagande och vilja att bidra till teamets utveckling.
* Lösningsorienterad, du ser möjligheter när du ställs inför en utmaning.
* En utvecklingsorienterad inställning och förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* Förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta med andra avdelningar för att uppnå gemensamma mål.


**Om Proffsmagasinet**
 Genom våra engagerade medarbetare, vägledande kunskap och ett brett sortiment hjälper vi dagligen människor att förverkliga sina hemmadrömmar. På Proffsmagasinet strävar vi inte bara efter en överlägsen kundupplevelse utan också efter en överlägsen medarbetarupplevelse. Som en del i Ahlsell-koncernen utvecklas vi konstant - nya relationer byggs, arbetssätt utvecklas och vi har det himla kul på vägen. Vill du vara med på vår resa mot att bli Sveriges bästa e-handel är vi övertygade om att du kommer att ha den bästa tiden i ditt arbetsliv hos oss.

title: Client Success Manager
description:
Readpeak is the fastest-growing programmatic demand platform for native advertising in Northern Europe. We operate across 9 European markets with over 1,500 brands, such as IKEA, BMW, and Bosch. Trusted by agencies like OMD, Dentsu, and Matterkind, our portfolio features more than 1,500 premium news sites, offering a truly premium native advertising experience for our clients.
 




  






 We’re looking for a dynamic Client Success Manager to help support Readpeak’s sales in Sweden. You will join an energetic team specialised in programmatic native advertising that has not only built one of the most advanced native marketing platforms globally, but are also great people to work with. You would report to the Country Manager for Sweden.
 




  






 What You’ll Do:
 




  




* Build, manage, and understand relationships with buyers using the Readpeak platform in Sweden, including agencies and direct advertisers.
* Establish yourself as an expert on the platform, leveraging your insights to craft and execute innovative campaign strategies that align with client goals.
* Offer pro-active advice to clients with a view to delivering successful campaigns and growing advertising investment.
* Deliver outstanding customer support by addressing client needs promptly and gathering feedback to continuously enhance the service experience.
* Adopt a strategic and proactive mindset, anticipating client requirements and playing a key role in uncovering growth opportunities.
* Lead client enablement efforts, from onboarding and ongoing education to strategic planning sessions, to boost platform proficiency and optimise campaign results.
* Work closely with internal teams—sales, product, marketing, and operations—to relay client feedback and advocate for their needs across the organisation.



  






 We’re Looking For Someone With:
 




  




* 5+ years of experience in client-facing roles, ideally in programmatic advertising, digital media, or SaaS.
* Proven ability to grow client accounts by building strong relationships, deeply understanding client goals, and translating them into platform strategies.
* Exceptional communication skills—both written and verbal—with confidence presenting to senior stakeholders and large groups.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities; comfortable working with large datasets to extract insights and build recommendations.
* Adept at navigating cross-functional environments and collaborating with internal teams to drive results.
* Demonstrated ability to manage complex projects, meet deadlines, and adapt to a fast-paced, evolving industry.
* Experience with DSPs, ad tech platforms, or managing omni-channel digital campaigns is strongly preferred.
* Knowledge of Google Analytics, Campaign Manager and SQL is a plus.
* Skills in Excel, Powerpoint/Google Slides & Gmail.
* Ambition, high energy, and the will to succeed.



  





  






 Location: Stockholm Office
 




  






 Who we are
 





 Founded in Helsinki in 2014, we have emerged beyond the Nordics and now collaborate with over 1,500 publishers across 9 markets.
 





 At Readpeak, we are redefining the content-driven advertising landscape to empower brands to connect with their audiences and to create value for premium media and journalism. Our mission is to make premium digital native easily available for brands and agencies. We empower brands to drive engaging content-driven campaigns that deliver outstanding engagement with low risk.
 





 Our programmatic self-service platform (DSP) gives brands full control of their storytelling native campaigns in the cookieless world. Through an intuitive UX, we provide access to our pre-curated programmatic inventory, real-time reporting, and optimization tools that drive superior results.
 





 With us, what you see is what you get. We’re transparent and focused on delivering future-proof, privacy-friendly solutions that benefit everyone: advertisers, publishers, and readers alike.
 





 A 'people for people' approach is one of the things that defines us. We treat everyone as we would like to be treated ourselves. From quick support for our clients to prioritizing our employees' work-life balance, we take a human perspective to business.

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
**About the Job** 




 Join Symcel’s Sales and Marketing team as our new Marketing Specialist and contribute to the rollout of advanced instruments that support the release of life-saving treatments.
 



  
 



 In this role, you'll play a crucial part in our commercial team, enhancing company and technology awareness, generating and maturing leads as well as penetrating new markets and expanding the customer base in close collaboration with Sales, Product Management and Applications.
 



  





 If you're a proactive marketer with a few years of experience and a desire to grow, this is a fantastic opportunity to develop your skills in an international life science company. Are you looking for a dynamic marketing role in a collaborative and positive work environment? Then we’d love to hear from you.
 








**About Symcel** 




 Symcel is a Swedish life science company in an exciting commercial scale-up phase, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, and Copenhagen. Symcel’s latest system delivers a new solution for rapid testing sterility in the growing cell and gene therapy (C&GT) market using the unique properties of the calorimetry-based detection system paired with machine learning and in-depth application knowledge. 
 



  
 



 With over 40 full-time employees from 18 nationalities, we are a diverse and international team of scientists, engineers, and business professionals. We’re united by a mission to accelerate how life is measured, supporting the discovery and manufacturing of life-changing therapies.
 







 Our company language is English.
 



 Discover more about us at: https://symcel.com
 








**Job description** 




 As a Marketing Specialist, you will drive marketing initiatives across digital channels and events —working closely with colleagues from marketing, product, application and sales teams. This role will be based at Symcel’s head office on the premises of the Karolinska Institute, with the option to work remotely 1–2 days per week.
 



  
 



 Your responsibilities will include:
 



  
 


* Developing and managing digital marketing campaigns across channels such as social media, email and Google Ads.
* Coordinating Symcel’s participation in exhibitions and conferences, including booking, logistics, and booth materials (e.g., roll-ups, stand walls, printed materials).
* Overseeing day-to-day website content and updates, ensuring SEO optimization and alignment with brand guidelines.
* Collaborating with web developers and designers to improve website UX and functionality.
* Designing and adapting marketing materials (ads, images, videos, brochures) using tools like Adobe Creative Cloud or Canva.
* Supporting the creation of content including videos, blog articles, application notes, case stories and other marketing materials.








**Qualifications** 



* Academic degree in Marketing, Communication or similar.
* At least 2 years’ relevant work experience in campaign management and digital marketing.
* Hands-on experience managing websites through CMS platforms and understanding of SEO best practices.
* Experience running social media and Google Ads campaigns.
* Proficiency with marketing software and design tools (eg. Adobe creative cloud including InDesign and Photoshop, Canva and CRM systems).
* Experience planning and coordinating conference participation (booking, shipments, and promotional material).
* Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team.
* Excellent written and spoken English.



  
 



 Preferred qualifications (meriting but not required):
 


* Background in marketing for life science, in vitro diagnostics (IVD), or medical devices.
* Experience writing scientific or technical content (e.g., blog posts, case studies, application notes).
* Experience working in international B2B marketing environments.



  
 



**Why join us?** 




 At Symcel, you’ll join a growing life science company with a collaborative and positive work environment. Our technology is helping to improve solutions for medical treatments and patient care—enabling faster, more precise quality control in areas like cell and gene therapy. You’ll be part of an agile, engaged team where your contributions truly matter—and where you’ll have the opportunity to grow, take initiative, and help shape how we bring our innovation to the global market.
 








**Contact & Application** 




 We will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis and are eager to fill this position. We encourage applications from candidates already based in the Stockholm region.
 



 To apply, please send your application to: careers@symcel.com
 



 The final deadline to apply is September 15.
 



 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: First-Line Support
description:
**About The Position**
 We are growing rapidly – transitioning from startup to scaleup – and expanding our footprint across the Nordics and Europe. Our clients range from some of Europe’s largest banks and iGaming companies to smaller, disruptive players.
   

  

 We are now looking for a skilled and service-minded
 **First-Line Support** 
 to join our IT team. This is not a junior role – we’re looking for someone with a solid foundation in support work who thrives in the space between IT and customer care. You’ll be the first line of contact for incoming technical questions, and a key player in helping customers and users – external – to resolve issues effectively and professionally.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As First-Line Support, you will:
   

  

* Respond to customer inquiries and technical issues with professionalism and clarity in accordance with customer SLAs
* Perform basic troubleshooting of software, connectivity, system-related issues, web applications, iframes, JSON APIs, and hardware
* Log, track and document issues, including all steps taken and final resolutions
* Escalate complex issues to the appropriate team members while maintaining ownership of the ticket
* Help build and improve internal documentation and knowledge bases
* Contribute to continuous improvement of support workflows and processes
* Ensure a great user experience, even in high-pressure or sensitive situations


**Who You Are**
 You are a calm, solution-oriented professional with a genuine interest in both tech and people. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where adaptability and communication are key.
   

  

**We Believe You Bring**
* A diploma or degree in IT, Computer Science or similar field
* +2 years of experience in a first-line or technical support role
* Proven ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users
* Strong troubleshooting skills and service mindset
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
* Experience with standard IT tools and environments
* Experience providing technical support for web-based applications, including iframe integrations and JSON-based APIs
* A structured approach and the ability to prioritize when everything feels urgent


**Meritorious Skills**
* Experience in Open Banking/PSD2
* Experience with Jira Service Desk, Linear and Slack (Our support plattforms)


**What Kreditz Can Offer**
* Growth Journey: A unique chance to be part of a rapidly growing scaleup where every team member plays a crucial role in the company's success.
* Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse, fun-loving, and collaborative team that celebrates both big and small milestones together.
* Wellness Perks: 24/7 access to an on-site gym, sauna, and sports center, plus a wellness allowance.
* Medical insurance: Quick access to professional medical advice and care
* Compensation: Fixed salary


**APPOINTMENT OF ROL** 
**E**
 As soon as possible
   

  

**SCOPE**
 Full-time, permanent position (tillsvidareanställning)
   

  

**SALARY**
 Fixed monthly salary
   

  

**REPORTING**
 You will be reporting to the company's IT Manager
   

  

**Workplace**
 Danderyd, Stockholm (on-site)
   

  

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**
 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis (ongoing selection)
   

  

**CONTACT**
 Lorenzo Puccio, COO, lorenzo@kreditz.com

title: Staff Data Scientist
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 420 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**Responsibilities**
**We at The Search team** 
 are responsible for some of the most vital and impactful features of the Truecaller application. These include:
   

  

* Caller Identification: Identifying who is calling and making sure users can take educated decisions to pick up or not
* Spam Protection: Identifying and blocking spam numbers, calculating spam likelihood, and enhancing overall spam detection.
* Name Accuracy: Guaranteeing that users see the most accurate and reliable names associated with numbers.
* Fraud Protection: Developing and maintaining services to protect users from fraudulent calls and scams.


**As a Staff Data Scientist for the Search team** 
 , you will drive critical initiatives focused on spam prevention,name election, and experimentation. This role requires a very strong foundation in advanced statistics, machine learning, and engineering, along with a passion for delivering measurable impact at mega scale.Focused on spam prevention, name election, and experimentation. This role requires a very strong foundation in advanced statistics, machine learning, and engineering, along with a passion for delivering measurable impact at mega scale.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience.
* Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals.
* Lead efforts to detect and prevent spam, ensuring user safety and platform trust.
* Drive the development and optimization of name election algorithms to improve identity accuracy.
* Design and run large-scale experiments to improve user experience and feature performance.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and analytics teams to implement data-driven solutions.
* Translate complex data insights into clear strategies and actions.


**What You Bring In**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or a related field.
* At-least 7 years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
* A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
* Excellent programming skills in Python, SQL
* Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
* Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
* Customer obsession
* Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
* Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
* Experience with data from mobile applications
* Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
* Solid understanding of engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.**
 Job info
   

  

 Location
   

  

**Stockholm, Sverige**
 Category
   

  

**Data Science**
