title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer | Stockholm
description:
**AI + Apotea =**
 Apotea is Sweden’s leading online pharmacy, committed to making healthcare accessible and efficient for everyone. Our Data and AI team is at the heart of innovation, building AI and ML applications that enhance customer experience, streamline operations, and create a foundation for future innovations. we are seeking passionate and driven individuals who are eager to make a significant impact and be part of a small technical team. By following industry best practices, we develop end to end AI applications on top of modern data and AI architectures, making sure our AI products don't end up just being a POC and drive sustainable value in production. The AI organization sits right under CEO Pär Svärdson, ensuring that your work has high visibility and significant influence.
   

  

**Your role as a Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Apotea** 
 :
   

  

* Build, deploy, and own end-to-end ML systems – from prototyping to maintaining production models, ensuring scalability, reliability, and alignment with team strategy.
* Turn models into real-world solutions – integrate ML into products that deliver measurable business value.
* Apply MLOps and DevOps best practices – use CI/CD, IaC, and cloud native solutions to deploy and monitor models.
* Collaborate across teams – work with Data Engineers, Software Engineers, Tech Lead, and Product Owner to align on data, integrations, architecture, and goals.
* Define metrics and evaluation processes - establish performance metrics, evaluation and validation frameworks aligned with business logic and requirements
* Take proactive initiatives - continuously identify and implement improvements to boost team productivity and solution quality
* Mentor junior engineers - provide technical guidance, code reviews, and care for the junior engineers in the team.


**Who you are?**
 We’re seeking Senior Machine Learning Engineers with diverse skills and a passion for solving complex problems and business impact.
   

  

* You’re a SENIOR member who:
* Mentors teams and elevates technical excellence
* Takes ownership of complex systems end-to-end
* Anticipates risks before they become problems
* Measures success by real-world impact, not just accuracy
* Balances innovation with practical constraints
* You’re an ML EXPERT who:
* Ships models to production, not just notebooks
* Speaks the language of both algorithms and business KPIs
* Stays ahead of the curve on AI/ML breakthroughs
* Is proficient in Python and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
* You’re an ENGINEER who:
* Writes code that outlasts the current project
* Thinks in systems, not just scripts
* Tests obsessively (A/B testing solutions, End-to-End testing softwares) and documents proactively
* Knows cloud infra like the back of your hand (AWS preferred)
* Bonus points for experience with:
* Implementing CI/CD pipelines, MLOps practices, and infrastructure-as-code for robust and repeatable deployments
* Feature stores and real-time inference pipelines
* Open data formats like Delta Lake or Iceberg
* Swedish language skills (not required, but a plus)


**What Apotea Offer You**
* The chance to work on cutting-edge AI and ML projects that impact millions of customers.
* Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy
* Drive sustainability through eco-friendly packaging and logistics
* Opportunities for career growth through training, mentorship, and industry conferences.
* Collaborate in a cross-functional, transparent environment
* Own projects from concept to deployment
* A stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission to improve healthcare accessibility.


**About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and nearly 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Lidingö, and Morgongåva.
   

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
* Apply
* Interview: Screening
* Interview: Technical Capabilities
* Interview: Culture Fit
* Background Check: As a pharmacy, we always conduct a background check.
* Offer Presented


****Location** 
 :** 
 Sveavägen 168, Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

****Reports to****
**:** 
 Chief AI Officer
   

  

**Application**
 Do not hesitate to send in your application already today. For more information or questions, visit our career page or contact us at jobb@apotea.se. We do not accept applications via email.
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

***Join Us and Make a Difference -** 
**We hope you want to be a part of our team!**
 Submit your application today—interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled immediately. Start date by agreement.
   

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health and creates magic!**
 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Software Engineer - R&D
description:
Vill du jobba med produktnära utveckling inom industrin?
   

  

 HiQ samarbetar idag med teknikintensiva kunder i framkant som produktbolag inom industrin, försvar och autonoma fordon. Det kan handla om förarlösa tåg eller elektrifierade tunga lastbilar samt sensor och navigationssystem för både båtar och flyg. Vi är involverade i utvecklingen av både komponenterna i fordonen och de som finns vid sidan av dem. En del av projekten har en internationell omfattning med hög säkerhetsklassning.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som gillar att grotta ner dig i komplexa problem. Vi tror att det är bäst för helheten i projektet om du är trygg i din kompetens och har några års erfarenhet med dig in i rollen.
   

  

**Till dessa projekt är vi i behov av personer med kompetens inom:**
* Mjukvaruutveckling inom C++ eller Java
* Testautomatisering
* DevOps
* Arkitekt med kunskap inom inbyggda system


**Vi ser gärna att du utöver ovanstående också har:**
* Universitetsutbildning inom relevant område
* Erfarenhet eller starkt intresse för industribranschen
* Förståelse och möjlighet att göra dig förstådd på svenska
* Svenskt medborgarskap


**Om HiQ**
 HiQ är ett kulturdrivet företag med över 2000 medarbetare i fyra länder. Här hittar du specialister inom allt från utveckling, test och cybersäkerhet till projektledning, design och agil coachning. Vi har en gemensam ambition: att förenkla och förbättra människors liv med hjälp av teknik och kommunikation – samtidigt som vi har roligt på vägen. Hos oss är du välkommen precis som du är, och vårt öppna arbetsklimat uppmuntrar till kreativitet, samarbete och personlig utveckling.
   

  

 Vi ser framemot din ansökan!

title: Lead Developer till Kleer
description:
****💛 It all comes Kleer – PE Accounting byter namn!****
 Kleer (tidigare PE Accounting) grundades för att revolutionera ekonomi- och lönebranschen genom ledande teknik och ekonomiexpertis. Idag erbjuder vi marknadens mest automatiserade system med över 80% automationsgrad, men vi stannar inte där – vi vill mer. Vi blir Kleer!
   

  

**Vill du vara med på resan? Blir en del av vårt team som Lead Developer!**
 👉🏼 Hos oss blir du en del av ett starkt team av engagerade utvecklare vars dagliga arbete & åsikter är avgörande för bolagets fortsatta tillväxt. Som utvecklare på Kleer arbetar du i en helt egenutvecklad produkt, som vi utvecklar och produktionssätter och du får stor kreativ frihet och möjligheter att ständigt växa i rollen som utvecklare på Kleer. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida.
   

  

**Vår Utvecklingsmiljö**
 Vi är ett produktbolag med en modern, agil utvecklingsprocess där teamen själva sätter sina milstolpar och sköter prioriteringen utifrån uppsatta affärsmål. Vi tror starkt på att det är roligare att arbeta om man förstår användarnas behov och ser utmaningar och möjligheter. Därför arbetar varje squad med en del av applikationen, men i hela teknikstacken. Vårt inhouse-utvecklingsteam består idag av utvecklare fördelat på 5 team, där teamen samarbetar nära en dedikerad produktägare.
   

  

 Kodbasen, som till största del är skriven i Java, är välskriven och vi kvalitetssäkrar vår kod genom automatiserade tester. Vi uppgraderar löpande till senaste versionen av våra verktyg och tredjepartskomponenter. Hela miljön är containerbaserad och releaser görs veckovis.
   

  

 Vi har ett helt nytt, fräscht och påkostat kontor i centrala Stockholm (Fleminggatan 14) där vi möts, tar en pingismatch, utbyter idéer och samlas runt en whiteboard eller för ett retrospective. Vi vet att även flexibilitet i vardagen är viktigt, därför finns det även möjligheten att arbeta remote!
   

  

**Rollen Som Lead Developer På Kleer**
 Vi tror att du trivs i ett modernt produktbolag och i en roll där du får chans att verkligen vara med och påverka produkten och utvecklingen av den. Då teamet är relativt litet kommer du ha ett stort ansvar och vi söker därför dig som är van vid att äga tekniska produkter och driva dem framåt. Kunskapsdelning och informellt ledar-/mentorskap för teamet ser vi som en naturlig del av rollen.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden i rollen 👇🏼**
* Stöttar och coacha utvecklare i teamet, exempelvis genom feedback vid pull request
* Ansvarig för att utveckla helheten för produkten tillsammans med övriga Lead Developers
* Ansvarar för att teamet lyckas i leveransen tillsammans med Engineering Manager
* Delta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från kravspecifikation till implementering
* Samarbeta nära Product Owner, Engineering Manager och teammedlemmar för att säkerställa att produktens vision och tekniska mål uppnås
* Ett tekniskt ansvar för en del av applikationen när det kommer till datamodell, arkitektur, prestanda, säkerhet m.m.
* Bidra med din tekniska expertis och erfarenhet för att kontinuerligt förbättra våra utvecklingsprocesser


**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du har flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av Java samt SQL och du är inte rädd för att komma med egna tankar och idéer som vi tillsammans förverkligar! Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med lön, bokföring, pensioner, deklarationer eller skatter är det mycket meriterande.
   

  

 Vidare tror vi att du behöver ha en djup förståelse för hur programmeringsspråk fungerar samt en relevant utbildning.
   

  

 Du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat och som person är du nyfiken och motiveras av att testa och lära dig nya saker inom ditt område.
   

  

**Mer Om Kleer Som Bolag**
 Vi grundades 2011 och är ett modernt & värderingsstyrt produktbolag. I över 12 år har vi skapat innovation och hjälpt små & medelstora bolag att automatisera sin ekonomi. Vi har en väldigt stabil affärsmodell som bolag och växer organiskt, med sunda finanser - vilket bland annat har gjort oss till sexfaldiga DI Gaseller. I skrivande stund närmar vi oss 200 kollegor och finns med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg & Malmö.
   

  

*Vi ser verkligen fram emot att höra ifrån dig!*
 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

**Sökord: Java 19, Spring, Docker, REST, Linux, MySQL, Microservices, IntelliJ, Jenkins, Git, Remix. Fullstack, Backend, Produktbolag.**
 Vi på Kleer ändrar sättet världen ser på ekonomi- och lönehantering!
   

  

 Vårt automatiserade system, i kombination med vår tjänsteleverans bildar tillsammans en helhetslösning som ger våra kunder möjligheten att outsourca sin ekonomifunktion, och samtidigt behålla 100% kontroll - i realtid.
   

  

 Vi har en stabil affärsmodell, där över 90% av intäkterna är prenumerationsbaserade. Tillväxten har skett organiskt och med sunda finanser. Vi har fått utmärkelsen DI Gasell sex år i rad och är ett värderingsstyrt bolag med stort fokus på glädje, ansvar, prestigelöshet och nyfikenhet!

title: Marknadskoordinator
description:
### **Är du vår nya lagspelare till vårt försäljnings- och marknadsteam?**

  

Vi på **ELME Spreader** **AB** letar efter dig som vill vara med och stärka vår marknadskommunikation – så att våra produkter och vårt varumärke syns där de ska, på rätt sätt och i rätt sammanhang. Tillsammans ser vi till att ELME fortsätter vara ett starkt och tydligt namn inom branschen.


Vi är ett team som jobbar tätt ihop, både inom marknad och med andra delar av företaget. Nu behöver vi en ny kollega som har koll på hur man sprider information via branschmedier, LinkedIn och andra sociala plattformar. Du är med och planerar, driver och genomför våra marknadsaktiviteter – alltid med stöd och samarbete från oss andra.


Vi hjälps åt med allt från PR och press till kundevent och mässor, där du ofta har en ledande roll i planeringen. Du har även kontakt med våra externa samarbetspartners som fotografer, reklambyråer, webbyråer och tryckerier.

### 

### **VAD VI TROR DU HAR MED DIG:**

  

Vi hoppas att du har en utbildning inom marknadsföring, kommunikation eller liknande. Har du jobbat i en liknande roll tidigare är det toppen – men du kan också vara ny i karriären. Eftersom vi är ett verkstadsindustriellt företag, är det ett extra plus om du har erfarenhet från tillverkande verksamhet.


Vi ser gärna att du har med dig kunskap inom:

* Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop)
* Sociala medier, särskilt LinkedIn, med fokus på B2B
* CMS för webbsidor
* Microsoft Office, framför allt PowerPoint, Word och Outlook
* Svenska och engelska – i både tal och skrift

  

Har du även koll på Account Based Marketing och sökmotoroptimering? Då blir vi extra glada.

### 

### **SÅ HÄR ÄR VI -OCH SÅ HOPPAS VI ATT DU ÄR:**

  

Hos oss är det viktigt med gemenskap, ansvarstagande och nyfikenhet. Vi tror att du är en kreativ person som gillar att testa nytt, har ett öga för form och färg och uppskattar struktur och tydlighet i vardagen. Du har lätt för att ta initiativ och ser helheten – men missar inte detaljerna.


Vi kommunicerar mycket både internt och externt, så det är viktigt att du känner dig trygg med att uttrycka dig i både tal och skrift. Framför allt söker vi en positiv kraft som trivs med att jobba tillsammans med andra.


Hos ELME får du en varierad vardag, frihet att forma din roll och många kontaktytor. Vi är ett engagerat team som stöttar varandra, har kul ihop och är stolta över det vi gör.

 **START:** Efter överenskommelse

**PLATS:** Älmhult

**OMFATTNING:** Heltid

**LÖN:** Fast lön

*Låter det som något för dig? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag.*


I denna rekryteringen samarbetar Elme Spreader med FSK . Ansvariga rekryterare är Theresia Andersson.


Ansök på www.fskpeople.se



Tjänst
Marknadskoordinator
Omfattning
Ort
Älmhult
Sista ansökningsdag
2025-07-04

title: Senior Account Executive
description:
There are NO limits to your career: come shape the future and be part of a truly unique global culture at OutSystems!
The Senior Account Executive at OutSystems will add new logos, manage the entire sales process from discovery to close, and will leverage his or her network to gain access to selling opportunities.
The ideal candidate will have over 10 years of experience in a direct sales role and will have the ability to partner with System Integrators, Channel, and Alliance partners. He/She will have excellent communication and problem-solving skills along with the ability to be self-driven and to work independently.
What You Will Lead/Do or Key Responsibilities* Uncover and manage new selling opportunities in a geographic territory
* Call on and develop relationships with C-level executives across business and IT units for named accounts
* Execute a sales process that validates and qualifies the technical and business requirements of the customer in order to close the business
* Articulate the value proposition and be familiar with ROI and TCO tools at a business level to provide to Business Stakeholders
* Negotiate contracts, up-sell and cross-sell, build customer rapport
* Achieve sales quotas in a territory on a quarterly and annual basis by developing a sales strategy in the allocated territory with a target prospect list, and a regional sales plan to include selling with and through partners.
* Prospect, effectively qualify, and develop new sales opportunities and ongoing revenue streams from new and existing accounts.
* Work with Global and local SIs and Channel partners to promote OutSystems solutions


Qualifications / What You Need To Succeed* Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent experience)
* 10+ years of direct and indirect selling experience within the enterprise software space and 3+ years within the application & application development space, SaaS.PaaS and Cloud offerings.
* Strong technical sales background with the ability to explain the business value to executives, experienced managing complex sales processes.
* Experience/ Success with named account selling model
* Proven track record of partnering with Global and Local System Integrators and Channel Partners.


The Longer Story:
OutSystems is a global leader transforming how companies innovate through software, empowering IT leaders with a better way to build the software that matters most.We are looking for talented and motivated people to join us in helping companies solve some of their most strategic business challenges, from modernizing their workplace processes to transforming their employee and customer experiences. As a member of the OutSystems global team, you will help build, deliver, manage, and evolve the software that is a low-code market leader and preferred by professional developers around the world.  

OutSystems is a truly global company, with more than 800,000 developer community members, 1,700 employees, more than 500 partners, and thousands of active customers in over 75 countries and across 21 industries. Founded in 2001, OutSystems has offices in the United States, United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Portugal, Germany, the UAE, Japan, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Australia, India, and Singapore, and of course has a thriving, worldwide community of remote employees.
Working at OutSystems
Our goal is to ensure that OutSystems is a place for bright, happy, and motivated people who share a common purpose and take pride in excellent work towards our vision. Our culture is focused on building agility at scale, which allows us to operate with a high drive in a competitive market. At OutSystems, we operate like a startup at scale, where teams act as coordinated "startups" - a true Federation of Teams Culture. Our attributes define the core behaviors that fuel our innovation and foster agility at scale. We encourage our team members to collaborate, focus on results, act quickly, understand our business and reinvent themselves.
What do we have to offer you?* A company that continues to grow, change and innovate, and gives our teams the space to be proactive and creative.
* Real career opportunities. We care about growth and development. Vertical career progression is an obvious possibility, but we also offer the possibility for lateral moves, joining different teams, and mastering specific skills.
* Work colleagues that are as smart, hardworking and driven as you – and a team that is global.
* Disrupting the status quo is in our DNA. In fact, it’s why our company exists.
* We “Ask Why” a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture and sometimes even uncover a better way.


Are you ready for the next step in your career? Then we’d love to hear from you!
OutSystems nurtures an inclusive culture of diversity, where everyone feels empowered to be their authentic self and perform at their best. A company that embraces the creativity and innovation that comes through diverse perspectives. We are committed to creating a team that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants receive equal consideration regardless of race, place of origin, color, age, marital status, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, protected veteran status, disability status or any other status protected by law
Join us in disrupting the status quo of the low-code market, we give you the power to "Ask Why", you give our customers the power to innovate through software!
company_description: OutSystems was born because we questioned how apps were developed, and then we created a new way.

title: Lead Modern Workplace Solutionist (Team Lead)
description:
**About Signode**


Signode, the Transit Packaging division of Crown Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: CCK), is a global leader in transit packaging with over 80 manufacturing facilities across six continents and more than 7,000 employees worldwide. Headquartered in Tampa, Florida, we are committed to innovation, operational excellence, and delivering high-performance packaging solutions.

**Your Role**


As a **Lead Modern Workplace Solutionist**, you will guide a cross-country team of IT professionals, driving the implementation and support of modern workplace technologies. You’ll play a key role in shaping a secure, efficient, and user-centric digital environment, leveraging Microsoft Cloud solutions and endpoint management tools to empower our global workforce.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead and mentor a team of Modern Workplace Technicians across multiple countries
* Conduct performance reviews, set goals, and align team efforts with business objectives
* Manage local business applications and collaborate with vendors for stability and performance
* Drive the adoption of modern workplace technologies and digital collaboration tools
* Administer client management infrastructure and ensure seamless device operations
* Implement and expand the Modern Workspace Portfolio services
* Collaborate with departments like HR, Finance, and Sales to deliver impactful IT services
* Troubleshoot complex issues and ensure business continuity through proactive support

**What You Bring**

* Master’s/Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
* 10–15 years in IT, including leadership in a modern workplace support environment
* Certifications in ITIL, Microsoft 365, Intune, Power Platform, or Dynamics 365 (preferred)
* Expertise in Microsoft 365, Azure AD, endpoint management, and ITSM tools
* Strong troubleshooting, documentation, and remote support capabilities
* Experience with low/no-code tools like Power Automate or RPA (a plus)
* Fluent in English and Swedish (any other language is a plus)
* Proven leadership, communication, and cross-functional collaboration skills
company_description: Signode is a leading global manufacturer of transit packaging and automation solutions with over $2B in revenue, 80+ manufacturing facilities across 6 continents, and over 7000 employees worldwide.

title: Hotel Skeppsholmen söker receptionist
description:
Vill du vara en del av Hotel Skeppsholmen?



Hotel Skeppsholmen har 77 hotellrum, restaurang och bar samt möteslokaler och enastående festvåningar för stora och små kalas. Vi är även ett Svanenmärkt hotell, medlem i Design Hotels samt stolt samarbetspartner till vår granne Moderna Museet, Operakällaren Foundation/UNICEF och Project Playground.



Hos oss på Hotel Skeppsholmen är receptionen en levande avdelning där vi skapar en härlig och avslappnad atmosfär för våra gäster. Vi söker därför dig som kan leverera naturlig toppservice på ett ödmjukt och avspänt sätt då du kommer att vara den första och sista som gästen möter på hotellet.



Våra gäster är oftast väldigt pålästa och trendmedvetna därför behöver du vara en person som är intresserad av att vara uppdaterad på det senaste som händer i Stockholm, allt från nyöppnade restauranger och barer till butiker och museer.



Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer i synnerhet vara gästservice samt in-och utcheckning, samtidigt som det kan vara att ta emot våra konferensgäster eller att ge conciergeservice. Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av arbete i hotellreception och det är en fördel om du har använt PMS-systemet OPERA Cloud. Meriterande om du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom hotell-och restaurang.



Tjänsten innefattar heltid vilket innebär variation av dag-och kvällstid samt varannan helg med start så snart som möjligt.

  



Urval och intervjuer görs löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan ansökningstiden har gått ut.



Skicka personligt brev och CV till jobb@hotelskeppsholmen.se

title: Utvecklingsledare Digitala arbetssätt – Stockholm, Malmö, Göteborg
description:
Digitala arbetssätt på Skanska driver vår digitala transformation framåt genom att integrera innovativa lösningar och verktyg i hela organisationen. Vår verksamhet fokuserar på att förbättra arbetsprocesser, säkerställa utbildning och kunskap inom digitalisering samt upprätthålla stabila tekniska plattformar. Vi ansvarar för viktiga digitala system och strävar efter att göra digitalisering till en naturlig del av vårt dagliga arbete*.*

Vi behöver nu förstärka vårt team inom digitala arbetssätt med en hungrig utvecklingsledare inom Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC). Vår enhet ansvarar för insamling av behov och kravställningar i gränslandet mellan tekniska lösningar och arbetssätt. Vi utforskar, initierar och driver utvecklings- och förbättringsarbete med ett gemensamt fokus.


Vårt team är en strategisk partner till prioriterade leverantörer ur ett verksamhetsperspektiv, och vi samarbetar nära med vår IT-enhet för att säkerställa ett bra samarbete med våra leverantörer. Gruppen har flera användarnätverk, bidrar med användarsupport och bevakar branschutvecklingen för våra verksamhetsgrenar.


**Tycker du att det är intressant att djupdyka i ACC och dess tillhörande arbetssätt?**



Nu söker vi dig som kan arbeta med förbättringsarbete, nya arbetssätt och stöd till projekten. I detta jobb kommer du att driva egna utredningar, jobba med utbildningsmaterial, handledningar och delta i förbättringsarbete inom ACC Teamet. Du kommer att arbeta nära olika interna verksamheter för att stötta och bidra till ytterligare utväxling.



Tjänsten innefattar bland annat:


* Verksamhetssupport
* Ta fram utbildningsmaterial och hålla i utbildningar
* Skapa användarguider
* Utforskande arbete i form av analyser och kartläggning
* Verksamhetskontakt för behovsinsamling
* Möjliggöra implementering

  
**Är du personen vi söker?**  

  

Vi söker dig som arbetar inom byggbranschen och har intresse av digitalisering. Du tycker det är kul att förbättra arbetssätt och stötta våra kollegor i deras arbete och har en civilingenjörsexamen med inriktning mot bygg, industriell ekonomi eller likvärdigt. Du har även tidigare erfarenhet av kvalitetsarbete i entreprenadverksamhet. Ett stort och genuint intresse för att bidra till ökad effektivitet är viktigt för oss.


Du har drivit projekt eller utredningar, din drivkraft, liksom vår, är att ständigt förbättras och leda utvecklingen framåt genom att utnyttja digitaliseringens möjligheter. Tillsammans med kollegor med olika kompetenser skapar du de bästa förutsättningarna för att utveckla arbetssätt inom våra projekt och produktionsverksamhet.


Vi ser det som extra meriterande om du har kunskap i ACC, teknisk kunskap inom AI, informationshantering, dokument eller modellhantering.



Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska är avgörande med tanke på våra interna och externa samarbeten. Resor i tjänsten förekommer inom Sverige.

  

**Skicka in din ansökan senast den 2 juli 2025!**  

Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så ansök med ditt CV och dina handlingar så snart du kan!  

  

Om du har några frågor om tjänsten får du gärna kontakta rekryterande chef Linn Areno på 010-449 29 43.



Våra medarbetare är vår främsta styrka och det är viktigt att du känner dig trygg hos oss. Vi vill att du ska trivas på jobbet och ha kul med dina kollegor. Vi lovar dig som medarbetare en ständig kompetensutveckling och tillhandahåller en rad internutbildningar, befattningsspecifika program och internationella utvecklingsmöjligheter. För oss är hälsa och säkerhet extra viktigt och det ligger även som grund för våra förmåner till dig som anställd på Skanska.


  
**Om företaget**
----------------

Skanska använder sin kunskap och framtidsinsikt för att bidra till hur människor lever, arbetar och samverkar. Vi är ett av världens största projektutvecklings- och byggföretag med en omsättning på 157 miljarder kronor under 2023. Skanska är verksamma på utvalda marknader i Norden, Europa och USA. Tillsammans med våra kunder och en samlad expertis hos cirka 27 000 medarbetare skapar vi innovativa, hållbara lösningar som främjar hälsa och välbefinnande bortom vår livstid.  



  

Hos oss är du med och skapar förutsättningar till trygga områden och bättre levnadsvillkor för människor i samhället
Ditt arbete bidrar i omställningen och utvecklingen för en hållbar framtid
Du är en del av ett öppet företagsklimat där alla vågar diskutera, reagera och agera.
Du tillsammans med dina kollegor arbetar på ett säkert sätt för att främja en mer hälsosam och trivsam vardag.
Här bygger vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö där du och olika människors kompetens och erfarenhet får plats.
company_description: Skanska is one of the world's leading construction and project development companies, focused on selected home markets in the Nordic region, Europe and USA.

title: Business Coordinator - Sales Support
description:
**Company Description**  

Meet Unit4. We’re a fast-paced growth cloud company, changing the game in ERP for mid-market people-centric organizations. We’re on a mission to turn 40 years of conventional legacy ERP software on its head and re-write the industry.


We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.


Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.

 **Job Description**  

Are you looking to gain hands-on exposure to business operations and strategy in a fast-paced global SaaS company? Are you looking for an international role where you will be supporting our executive sales leadership on our transformational journey? We're seeking a driven, and business-minded individual to join our sales team in a support capacity that goes beyond traditional admin roles. This person will play a key part in powering our commercial success — analyzing data, suggesting improvements, driving project planning and follow-ups, preparing impactful presentations, and supporting the sales processes. You’ll be working closely with executive sales leadership and cross-functional teams, gaining hands-on exposure to core business operations and strategy.

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist in organizing and tracking business development initiatives and sales projects and initiatives.
* Support the sales team with data-driven insights, collecting, processing, interpreting, and presenting business data and information.
* Create PowerPoint presentations, sales decks, templates, and business proposals tailored to prospects and clients.
* Conduct follow-ups with internal stakeholders
* Prepare and follow up on reports, summaries, and meeting notes to keep the sales process moving
* Proactively identify areas where the sales team needs support and offer solutions
* Act as a bridge between the sales team and other internal departments (e.g. marketing, operations, finance, support, legal).
* Continuously learn and understand the company’s products, clients, and market trends to add strategic value

 **Qualifications**  

* Business Degree or other relevant degree in higher Education.
* Strong analytical skills with interest in understanding the business goals, objectives, strategies, processes, and policies.
* Strong Project Management Skills
* 1–3 years of relevant experience (e.g., in business support, sales coordination, assistant roles, or high-paced internships).
* Strong proficiency in CRM systems, Microsoft, AI driven sales systems, PowerPoint, Excel, and data visualization tools
* Fast learner with a proactive attitude and entrepreneurial mindset
* Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
* High proficiency in English
* Highly organized and detail-oriented
* Problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities under tight deadlines
* Commercially curious and business-savvy—able to “connect the dots” beyond tasks

  

**Additional Information**  

Join Unit4 and you’ll be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the ERP cloud software space today.

* A culture built on trust. That’s why we offer our people an uncapped time off policy and remote working opportunities. We focus on results, not how many days you work or where that work takes place
* One of the most lucrative commission plans in the industry and a range of market-leading benefits
* World-class sales tools and a pipeline development engine in the form of a global BDR team.
* On-going monthly learning & development opportunities
* Work, learn & be inspired by some of the best talent in the software space
* Talent program for high performers. Each year we provide a platform for high potential talent to accelerate their careers!
* Committed to corporate social responsibility with our Act4Good initiative, our global movement to do good, and a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society
* Diversity4U. Helping our people thrive starts with a safe and inclusive work environment. We launched our Diversity4U program that builds on our “be genuine” value
company_description: We're in business for people. Our enterprise solutions help service organizations empower their people to make an impact on the world.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**What you will do**
--------------------


As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of data to help inform business decisions. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify key trends, provide actionable insights, and support data-driven decision-making processes. You will contribute to business visioning and scoping information management activities and strategies. The focus is to get the right information to the right people at the right time to enable business decisions and the use of information as a competitive advantage while ensuring the security of the information.

**Your future team**  

You will report directly to the Manager, Data Quality and Products, Europe within VFS D&IT and will be assigned to a stable, global cross-functional team. Digital and IT is the engine of the VFS business, and we continue our strategic journey to further improve performance and to deliver the best customer experience in the industry. In this exciting environment, we are focused on Digital Innovation to meet the demands of our customers in an increasingly digitalized world.


In many of our markets, VFS has won the Great Place to Work award, where Great Work is done. By interacting with each other as an on-site business, we build relationships, which allow us to work together more efficiently and form stronger bonds with our colleagues and customers. The preferred location is Wroclaw, Poland or Gothenburg, Sweden.

**Who are you?**
----------------


Do you dream big? We do too, and we are excited to grow together. In this role, we believe it is the right mindset that will make a difference at VFS. If you, besides your genuine interest in working with people in Transforming Together, also have a positive, service-oriented, and collaborative mindset, and take a proactive approach to handling all responsibilities, idea generation, and recommendations for productivity and efficiency - then we would welcome you to apply for this role.


We believe the successful candidate has the passion and excitement to take on this challenge.

**Qualifications likely required to be successful in this role include:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role.
* Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Python, R, or similar.
* Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
* Familiarity with business intelligence tools and reporting systems and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI or similar).
* Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to communicate data insights in an understandable and actionable way.
* Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently.
* Solid understanding of statistical techniques and data modeling is a plus
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


If you want to make a real impact in your career, Volvo Financial Services is where you want to be.


We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

  

At **Volvo Financial Services**, we are working together to shape the world we want to live in. As the captive finance arm of the Volvo Group, VFS provides financial services and solutions that meet the needs of our customers’ evolving business. Through our dedication to innovation, we support society in its adoption of sustainable transport and equipment solutions. VFS is headquartered inGothenburg, Sweden, and serves Volvo Group customers and dealers in more than 50 markets.

**What’s in it for you?**


We offer a solid and competitive package of compensation and benefits, plus you will enjoy a diverse working environment with a culture of care and inclusion. As an investment, we support your personal development and growth to achieve your career aspirations. Volvo Financial Services is an on-site business and we understand that you might need occasional or temporary flexibility, which your leader is equipped to manage and fits well to our culture, as being together enables us to build upon our innovative and collaborative culture, as well as develop you for continued success.

title: Controller (Temporary - End of 2026)
description:
**Controller (Temporary - End of 2026)**



Discover how you can reach your potential at BSH Home Appliances Group! As a leading manufacturer of home appliances and solutions with global brands like Bosch, Siemens, Neff, and Gaggenau, we foster commitment and open-mindedness in our employees. Our focus on innovation extends beyond our products and services, shaping the way we collaborate, exchange ideas, and organize our teams. We invite you to contribute to our collective success. Join us now and give your career a home.



We are seeking an experienced Controller to join our Nordic Sales organization on a temporary basis, with the role lasting until the end of 2026.


**Your Tasks:**



As Controller, you will support our Logistics team in various controlling topics:


* Preparing, executing, and steering the month-end closure.
* Analyzing and visualizing monthly reporting data.
* Supporting business planning and forecasting processes.
* Identifying improvement potentials by analyzing KPIs and creating transparency (e.g., analyzing logistics KPIs to identify opportunities for a 5% cost reduction).
* Enabling business steering and decision-making through the development of reports and analyses.
* Reporting directly to the Head of Controlling, Northern Europe.


**Your Profile:**


* A degree in business administration.
* Proven experience in Controlling (minimum 3 years).
* Specific knowledge of SAP and Microsoft Office.
* Fluency in English.
* Experience with SAP Analytics Cloud and Power BI is an advantage.
* Strong analytical, supportive, solution-minded, communicative, and reliable personality.


Welcome to join a successful company within Home Appliances!


**CURIOUS?** We look forward to receiving your application. We will be reviewing applications and conducting interviews on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to apply early. Please submit your application in English as soon as possible.



If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Denitsa Johansson (Head of Controlling Northern Europe), tel 0739-878652.


**If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact**

title: Named Account Executive - Sweden
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*

Job Category


Sales
Job Details


**About Salesforce**

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.


**We’re Salesforce** , the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
  

Our Enterprise Business team focuses on working with our most strategic customers and organizations of 10,000+ employees. You will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced team with various customers and receive personalized training and career opportunities.
  

**About the role:**  

This is a unique opportunity to join a highly successful team of seasoned Enterprise Account Executives working with the company's Top Retail Accounts. Salesforce is looking for very hardworking, high EQ and passionate individuals who can effectively articulate how & why our solutions can help transform Customers’ business and exceed their goals.
  

Salesforce aspires to deliver business transformation enabled by technology to its customers and therefore requires individuals able to develop deep insight into the business dynamics of large sophisticated enterprises and help shape customers' change agenda.
**Your Day-to-Day:*** Our Enterprize Account Executives engage with existing customers and new leads to sell the entire Salesforce Customer 360 platform. They build positive, trusted relationships with both key team members and c-suite decision makers within their patch, and become naturals at helping customers realize value from their Salesforce investments.
* You will use your skills to develop opportunities, through both warm leads and whitespace prospecting.
* Develop key customer stakeholder relationships and drive customer satisfaction at assigned accounts
* Develop and drive the overall long-term strategy for the account, aligned to customer business objectives
* Coordinate internal Salesforce resources to meet customer business needs
* Perform account planning at assigned accounts, coordinating with Prime and Cloud sales resources to ensure strategic alignment
* Share Salesforce value proposition for existing and/or new customers
* Drive growth within an existing assigned account
* Preferred Qualifications:
* 10 years of full-cycle sales experience in the Swedish market
* Ability to strategise with a large extended team
* Experience with working within the Retail Sector

**What we look for in you:*** Effective communicator & quick learner: Ability to articulate how & why our solutions can help transform Customers’ business and exceed their goals.
* Successfully run complex SaaS sales deals: Ability to develop sophisticated deal structures and commercial proposals for large deals.
* Strong analytical & problem-solving skills are essential
* Strong influencing capabilities; must be a self-starter, high-energy
* Strong appetite to work in a strategic selling environment.
* Fluent in English and Swedish + Right to work in Sweden

**Working at Salesforce**  

Working at Salesforce isn’t all about selling. It’s also about learning, and we heavily invest in you with a month-long immersion and onboarding, including a week-long product boot camp, mentorship program, weekly coaching and development programs.
  

**Benefits**  

We are pioneers of the Pledge 1% model, providing products, grants and community service to those in need. We are proud to be#1 in PEOPLE’s Top 50 Companies that Care, and are on Fortune’s Change the World list.
  

We provide every employee with 7 paid volunteer days off a year, and donation matching for all approved charitable donations. We provide other world-leading benefits to all our employees, including;
* Health, life insurance, retirement saving plan
* Monthly wellness allowance
* Flexible time off & leave policies
* Parental benefits
* Perks and discounts

Accommodations


If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .


Posting Statement


Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Presales Lead Technical Architect (Swedish Speaker)
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*

Job Category


Sales
Job Details


**About Salesforce**

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.


The **Northern Europe Technical Architect Team** is a vibrant and dynamic part of our organization. Our mission is to help Salesforce customers and prospects understand and showcase how Salesforce’s solutions can drive real business value. We thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where each team member's unique contributions are key to our success.
  

  

Architects are at the forefront of Salesforce's customer's success with Data and AI. We are the biggest technology evangelists and enablers, both internally and externally. We go the extra mile to understand the underlying technologies and competitive differentiators. Our team enables digital transformation through specialized domain expertise in Enterprise Architecture, Industry expertise, Business & Technical Architecture, Integration, AppDev, Security & Compliance, combined with deep technology insights, product skills, and IT stakeholder management. We lead with pride and integrity to deliver stakeholder success.
  

  

As a premier Solution Engineering (pre-sales) team, we operate across Northern Europe, serving Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, Belgium, Luxembourg, and The Netherlands.  



### 
**Role Description**

The Northern Europe Technical Architect is a customer-facing specialist position within the Solutions Engineering organization. With a blend of business, technical, and sales skills, the Technical Architect acts as a domain expert who utilizes a consultative approach to understand business and technical requirements. Technical Architects help the sales teams develop and refine a customer-centric technical sales strategy and Salesforce-solution fit.
  

  

As a Technical Architect, you’ll act as a trusted advisor to our customers, guiding them through Agentforce, Data Cloud, CRM, and Platform solutions, ensuring they realize the full value of the platform. You’ll combine deep technical domain expertise in Data/AI/ML, data infrastructure, and CRM with strong presentation and solutioning skills. Working side by side with our Account Executives and Solutions Engineers, you will:
  

  

Provide technical leadership during pre-sales engagements by assessing customer use cases, recommending optimal solutions, and shaping the overall technical vision.


* Champion best practices around Data/AI/ML, data integrations, security, and the Salesforce platform to drive innovation and customer adoption.
* Create and deliver relevant content—demos, videos, white-papers, enablement sessions—to both internal and external audiences, establishing yourself as a leader with vision.
* Build and present Proof of Concepts within sandbox environments to highlight the value of agents and unified customer data with real-world use cases.
* Understand a customer’s risk, security, or compliance concerns and communicate how Salesforce’s infrastructure, architecture, and application features can address these concerns.
* Understand current and emerging cybersecurity risks and innovative risk management methods and eloquently communicate them to customers.
* Partner with sales teams to remove security and compliance as a blocker by speaking to CISOs, CIOs, and other key decision-makers.

### 
**Your Impact**

* **Tackle Complex Problems:** Research customer challenges, architect innovative solutions, and drive key technical decisions.
* **Drive Adoption & Value:** Promote platform adoption by driving additional business use cases with the customer.
* **Showcase Real-World Solutions:** Partner with Sales and Solutions Engineering to build compelling demos and prototypes that illustrate immediate ROI and practical use.
* **Facilitate Workshops:** Orchestrate targeted workshops that drive technical approaches and best practices aligned with the customer's defined business objectives and priorities.
* **Develop Cross-Platform Solutions:** Integrate Data Cloud, CRM, analytics tools, and cloud services (REST APIs, SDKs, data pipelines) into scalable, cohesive architectures.
* **Lead Technical Thought Leadership:** Produce best-practice documentation, architectural diagrams, and enablement materials that highlight emerging AI trends and Agentforce innovations.
* **Learn & Tinker:** Continually participate in product, sales, and training/certifications to acquire and maintain the knowledge necessary to be effective in the position.
* **Security:** Be a field expert for the Salesforce trust story covering security, architecture, reliability, performance, privacy, and compliance.
* **Travel:** Willing and able to travel to customers or Salesforce offices.

### 
**Qualifications & Experience**

* A deep passion for working with the latest, cutting-edge technologies.
* Experience with cloud, SaaS, PaaS, aPaaS, and IaaS concepts and technologies.
* Familiarity with integration, security, and architecture patterns and expertise in designing and implementing data integrations across various systems.
* Proven experience presenting and demonstrating to senior business and technical stakeholders.
* Experience in facilitating and leading customer-focused workshops.
* Hands-on work with Generative AI, Large Language Models (LLMs), agent-based frameworks, and prompt engineering is a strong plus.
* Consultancy, development, and/or implementation experience is a strong plus.
* Solid experience with the Salesforce Platform (Platform Application Development experience would be a plus).
* Familiarity with one or more security and regulatory frameworks and trainings: NIST 800-53, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, PCI-DSS, ISO 27001, ISO 27017, ISO 27018, CCSP or CISSP is a plus

Accommodations


If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .


Posting Statement


Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Hotel Skeppsholmen söker receptionist
description:
Vill du vara en del av Hotel Skeppsholmen?
  
Hotel Skeppsholmen har 77 hotellrum, restaurang och bar samt möteslokaler och enastående festvåningar för stora och små kalas. Vi är även ett Svanenmärkt hotell, medlem i Design Hotels samt stolt samarbetspartner till vår granne Moderna Museet, Operakällaren Foundation/UNICEF och Project Playground.
  
Hos oss på Hotel Skeppsholmen är receptionen en levande avdelning där vi skapar en härlig och avslappnad atmosfär för våra gäster. Vi söker därför dig som kan leverera naturlig toppservice på ett ödmjukt och avspänt sätt då du kommer att vara den första och sista som gästen möter på hotellet.
  
Våra gäster är oftast väldigt pålästa och trendmedvetna därför behöver du vara en person som är intresserad av att vara uppdaterad på det senaste som händer i Stockholm, allt från nyöppnade restauranger och barer till butiker och museer.
  
Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer i synnerhet vara gästservice samt in-och utcheckning, samtidigt som det kan vara att ta emot våra konferensgäster eller att ge conciergeservice. Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av arbete i hotellreception och det är en fördel om du har använt PMS-systemet OPERA Cloud. Meriterande om du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom hotell-och restaurang.
  
  

Tjänsten innefattar heltid vilket innebär variation av dag-och kvällstid samt varannan helg med start så snart som möjligt.
  
  

Urval och intervjuer görs löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan ansökningstiden har gått ut.
  
Skicka personligt brev och CV till jobb@hotelskeppsholmen.se

title: Systems Engineer - göteborg
description:
**Assignment Overview – Systems Engineer ADAS**


A skilled systems engineer is sought for an assignment focused on advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS), with a specific emphasis on cloud-connected map functionalities and related solutions. The role includes leading activities tied to cloud integration and mapping technologies within vehicle programs currently in development.


You will be part of a systems engineering team, contributing both individually and collaboratively to ensure successful delivery of components tied to REM data and navigation systems such as Google Maps.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Coordinate and deliver REM functionality for designated vehicle programs
* Ensure successful integration of Google Maps into platform solutions
* Lead technical efforts related to cloud connectivity and mapping within the ADAS context
* Support ongoing system engineering tasks within the development program

**Required Competence:**  

️ Experience from the automotive industry  

️ Solid understanding of systems engineering in a product development context  

️ Proven background in working with cloud-based solutions  

️ Familiarity with standard and high-definition mapping technologies

**Additional Requirements:**

* Strong self-leadership and a proactive mindset
* Ability to drive both supplier collaborations and in-house deliveries
* Excellent communication and teamwork abilities

**Location:**  

Gothenburg (Arendal area)

**Note:** Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. Early submission is recommended.


This opportunity is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and brings a mix of technical expertise, structured systems thinking, and initiative to drive forward key components in modern automotive development.

 **About** **Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Workday Advanced Compensation Lead
description:
**INTRODUCTION**


Do you get excited when guiding organizations on the transformation of their HR processes based on the next generation of technology? Put your expertise to work as part of the world’s largest independent technology services provider and own the way as a trendsetter in Workday. We’re ready if you are.

**DEPARTMENT INTRODUCTION**


The Accenture Workday Business Group is a leading partner to Workday worldwide and has a track record of implementing many of the most significant Workday projects. In addition, we take pride in advising and collaborating closely with our clients from early strategy discussions, through technology implementations and transformation programs, to support and operations. Learn more about our practice at www.accenture.com/workday.

**ARE YOU INTERESTED?**


Do you want to work with global talent at the forefront of technological services and seek meaningful projects for top international businesses? At Accenture you have access to specifics trainings for your functional lead role. You will start with training -together with colleagues - and you will join seminars at various international locations. You will be primed, equipped and well-networked to tackle exciting projects.


We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity.


“Across the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.” – **Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO**

**What We Offer:**

* Innovative large scale Workday projects
* A global network of talented and passionate colleagues
* Challenging work for some of the world's largest companies
* Extensive education programs and development opportunities
* Volunteering and career opportunities around the world
* A diverse and socially active workforce
* Flexible working hours and opportunity to work from home
* Friendly and social work environment
* Ability to craft your career based on your own aspirations.

**As a Workday Advanced Compensation Lead:**

**You'll be part of a team of advisory professionals who deliver more than just technology. From rapid deployments to complete transformations, you'll provide integrated, cloud-based HR solutions that put organizations on the fast track to a better way to work.**

**In this role, you will help our clients get the most out of their Workday investment by:**

* Collaborate with clients on industry standards and leading practices in both HCM and Advanced Compensation domains, contributing to functional solutions that meet client needs and objective and applying Workday and Accenture methodologies.
* Hosting workshops and leading discussions on topics in line with your area(s) of expertise, covering both HCM and Advanced Compensation functionalities.
* Independently leading your workstream and reporting on progress
* Ability to lead diverse and disparate teams and lead them through the implementation. Liaising closely with client counterparts, Accenture colleagues, and Workday to exceed client expectations
* Actively supporting innovation through the creation of new industry-leading

  

**We are looking for experience in the following skills:**

* Prior experience implementing Workday HCM / Compensation / Advanced Compensation or relevant on-premises or cloud-based platforms
* Ability to meet client travel requirements as needed and efficiently manage a team(s) and client interactions
* Thrive in a diverse, dynamic environment, meet deadlines despite conflicting demands, analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, and can clearly articulate complex messages and requirements
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent, Fluency in English

**Set yourself apart:**

* Strong HR background with experience working in the Workday platform, either as a consultant or in a client role owning and driving the Workday HCM and Advanced Compensation workstreams.
* Experience with Workdays Data Migration tools and Security framework
* Up to date Workday, HCM / Advanced Compensation certifications
* Demonstrable professional Workday experience
* Additional Workday certifications
* Fluency in another language Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish a.o, German, French, Spanish, Dutch a.o..

**As a Workday Advanced Compensation Lead:**

**You'll be part of a team of advisory professionals who deliver more than just technology. From rapid deployments to complete transformations, you'll provide integrated, cloud-based HR solutions that put organizations on the fast track to a better way to work.**

**In this role, you will help our clients get the most out of their Workday investment by:**

* Collaborate with clients on industry standards and leading practices in both HCM and Advanced Compensation domains, contributing to functional solutions that meet client needs and objective and applying Workday and Accenture methodologies.
* Hosting workshops and leading discussions on topics in line with your area(s) of expertise, covering both HCM and Advanced Compensation functionalities.
* Independently leading your workstream and reporting on progress
* Ability to lead diverse and disparate teams and lead them through the implementation. Liaising closely with client counterparts, Accenture colleagues, and Workday to exceed client expectations
* Actively supporting innovation through the creation of new industry-leading

  

**We are looking for experience in the following skills:**

* Prior experience implementing Workday HCM / Compensation / Advanced Compensation or relevant on-premises or cloud-based platforms
* Ability to meet client travel requirements as needed and efficiently manage a team(s) and client interactions
* Thrive in a diverse, dynamic environment, meet deadlines despite conflicting demands, analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, and can clearly articulate complex messages and requirements
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent, Fluency in English

**Set yourself apart:**

* Strong HR background with experience working in the Workday platform, either as a consultant or in a client role owning and driving the Workday HCM and Advanced Compensation workstreams.
* Experience with Workdays Data Migration tools and Security framework
* Up to date Workday, HCM / Advanced Compensation certifications
* Demonstrable professional Workday experience
* Additional Workday certifications

title: Senior DevSecOps Engineer
description:
**ABOUT THE POSITION**


At Kreditz, we believe financial data should empower people and businesses — not limit them. Our platform turns raw financial information into actionable insights for credit, risk, and identity. As we scale across Europe, we’re looking for a Senior DevSecOps Engineer who’s excited about building secure, reliable systems and wants to play a key role in how we grow securely.


You’ll join a product-driven team where security is seen as an enabler of innovation — not a blocker. If you care about impact, autonomy, and working with kind and driven people, you’ll fit right in.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**


As a DevSecOps Engineer you will:

* Champion security across our AWS infrastructure, implement resilient architecture and systems that scale safely.
* Build and continuously improve our CI/CD pipelines in GitHub Actions — ensuring they’re not only fast and efficient, but robust and secure from end to end.
* Design guardrails and tools that help developers write secure code, from IDE to production.
* Integrate and manage SCA, SAST, and DAST tooling across the software development lifecycle, working closely with engineering teams.
* Implement smart, scalable security monitoring and alerting that helps us catch issues early and learn fast.
* Collaborate across teams to guide decisions on secure design, coding practices, and threat modeling.
* Contribute to shaping a security-first culture that supports both compliance and innovation.

**CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS**

* **Experience:** +3 years documented experience from working in security-focused infrastructure, platform engineering or DevSecOps roles and you are comfortable navigating both code and cloud.
* **AWS expertise:** You understand AWS deeply, particularly in areas like IAM, networking, encryption, and monitoring.
* **CI/CD skills:** You’ve built and secured pipelines, ideally with GitHub Actions.
* **Coding experience and skills:** You’ve worked as a developer preferably fullstack and have active skills in coding.
* **Hands-on with tooling:** You’ve worked with SCA/SAST/DAST tools and can evaluate, configure, and tune them across environments.
* **Security Certifications:** Certifications like OSCP, GPEN, or CEH are valuable to us because they demonstrate practical security acumen.

**WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

* **Pragmatism**: You know how to strike a balance between security and speed — and when to advocate for one or the other.
* **Team orientation:** You enjoy collaborating with engineers, product managers, and compliance leads alike — bringing security into the conversation early.
* **Growth mindset:** You believe good security is always evolving and are excited to keep learning.

**APPOINTMENT OF ROLE**


As soon as possible

**SCOPE**


Full-time, permanent employment (tillsvidareanställning)

**SALARY**


Fixed monthly salary

**REPORTING**


You will report to the company's CISO

**WORKPLACE**


Our office is in Danderyd, Stockholm, where we work together five days a week

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**


We interview candidates on an ongoing basis (ongoing selection)

**CONTACT**


Lorenzo Puccio, COO, lorenzo@kreditz.com

title: Integrations support - Maternity cover
description:
**We’re not just another consultancy firm — we’re on a mission to redefine what a data consultancy can be.**  

At Epical, trust is the foundation of everything we do. We see our role not just as consultants, but as partners — helping our clients steer, shape, and create a world that’s fairer for all. Through our expertise in integration, data and analytics and digital trust, we deliver real impact.

**If you’re a service-minded person with an interest in IT and looking for a new challenge, keep reading — this might be the opportunity for you.**

#### **What’s this all about?**


We're looking for a new employee to join us as **Integrations support** in our Message Management team in Gothenburg, a tight-knit group of 7 people, including 3 part-time students. In this maternity cover role starting in October, you'll act as the single point of contact between our clients and our integration systems.


You’ll work with platforms like IBM MQ, IBM ACE, Microsoft Azure, and Axway, handling client integrations focused on message management. It’s a coordinating role where you’ll collaborate closely with our internal Service Delivery Managers and technicians, primarily via email, Teams, Jira, ServiceNow, and phone.


Epical is currently on an exciting growth journey, delivering cutting-edge integration solutions on various cloud platforms. With large-scale projects ahead, this is a unique opportunity to be part of something meaningful, and to shape a role that mirrors your interests and strengths.


Our Gothenburg office is located in the beautiful and centrally located Platinan building at Mårten Krakowgatan 2.

#### **What you’ll bring to the table**

* A relevant IT education or background in an IT-related role.
* Experience in first or second-line support, service coordination, or working with case management systems.
* Bonus points if you’ve worked with system integration, coding, or log files.
* Strong communication skills - you enjoy helping others and thrive in a structured, collaborative environment.
* A sense of accountability, the ability to prioritize tasks effectively, and a detail-oriented mindset.


This role requires fluency in both Swedish and English, and due to client requirements, you must be a Swedish citizen and able to pass a security clearance. Occasional on-call duties are part of the role, scheduled in advance.

#### **Epical, who and why?**


We believe that trust is at the heart of everything we do. We are dedicated to making a difference in the world by helping organizations build trust through data and technology. We are here to create a future we can all trust.


In addition, we offer you:

* The opportunity to join a team of Sweden’s leading experts in Integration.
* Stimulating and interesting assignments, working with large customers in complex environments and a team of talented integration professionals backing you up and helping you excel.
* An organization that puts people first, supports work-life balance and offers flexible remote working possibilities.
* Comprehensive compensation & benefits package.
* Continuous education – technical training and support for certifications.

#### **Do you want to become a part of something epic?**


Hey, that’s an awesome idea! Please, submit your application today. The selection process is ongoing, and to qualify for the position, due to client requirements, you must be a Swedish citizen and able to pass a security clearance.


Please note that our team will be on summer vacation during parts of July, which might delay our response time. We will review applications continuously, but some feedback may be given after the holidays.

 **Join us in shaping the future of data consultancy and making the world a fairer place for all.**

 *Epical is a Nordic data consultancy set on making a world we can all trust. Taking expertise in integration, data and analytics, applications, and digital trust, beyond the expected, Epical is adept in both building and running IT solutions on cloud. It’s through the responsible use of their knowledge that Epical’s roughly 400 experts strive daily to make and create things that help provide a fairer world for the many.*
