title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Job Description** 




  





**Engineering Manager focused on SAP and SaaS products in the Enterprise Apps space** 




 As an Engineering Manager, you will have formal staff responsibility for 15-25 engineers (employees and consultants) working on various products focused on SAP and SaaS products in the Enterprise Apps space. Your responsibilities will span from building a strong engineering culture to ensuring organizational health and efficiency in delivery and competence development.
 



 You will oversee recruiting, staffing, and talent retention, ensuring a balanced mix of consultants and employees across tech locations. Additionally, you will manage stakeholder expectations, address conflicting priorities, and translate long-term objectives into actionable strategies, maintaining a balance between tactical and strategic perspectives
 



  





**People Development** 




 Provide strategic direction and mentoring to Engineers, SAP and SaaS Application Experts.
 



 Lead recruitment and onboarding efforts aligned with organizational objectives.
 



 Organize training programs to ensure engineers possess the skills needed for success.
 



  





**Budget Management** 




 Plan and manage the overall budget for the product area.
 



 Ensure efficient allocation of resources across teams.
 



  





**Cross-functional Coordination** 




 Collaborate with Product Managers and Engineering Managers to maintain cross-functional alignment.
 



 Ensure team efforts align with business goals and strategic initiatives.
 



  





**Staffing** 




 Manage team composition and workloads, addressing staffing needs holistically.
 



 Maintain an optimal ratio of consultants and employees to balance expertise and cost.
 



 Develop location strategies for onshore, nearshore, and offshore staffing models.
 



**10-15 years of tech related experience, combining technical expertise with strong functional knowledge to deliver end-to-end solutions** 




**3–5 years of managerial experience in similar roles.** 




**Demonstrated expertise in the SAP areas and potentially SaaS applications, with experience leading teams in this domain.** 




**Solid understanding and management of initiatives and teams in complex Product and Tech organization with focus on large scale an distributed systems and teams (Product and Value Stream focused teams, preferably some exposure to SAFe methodology)** 




 Proven ability to manage resource allocation budgets in large enterprises with complex backend systems.
 



  





**Skills** 




 Strong leadership and mentoring abilities to foster professional growth.
 



 Capacity to balance stakeholder priorities and deliver practical solutions.
 



 Excellent collaboration and communication skills to align cross-functional teams.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
Trintech is a multi-award winning cloud-based Fintech provider and we're seeking a Customer Success Manager to join our dynamic EMEA team! As a CSM you will be responsible for driving adoption, satisfaction, and retention across a portfolio of customers using our Adra solutions. You will leverage both high-touch and digital engagement strategies to manage a broad book of business efficiently, while partnering cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Support, and Professional Services to deliver value at scale.
   

  

 This is a hybrid role, requiring 3 days per week in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Own the customer relationship for a large portfolio of Adra users across Norway and the Nordics.
* Serve as the primary point of contact throughout the post-sale customer lifecycle, ensuring successful onboarding, adoption, renewal, and expansion. Develop and execute Digital Touch engagement strategies for scalable support and value delivery.
* Act as a trusted advisor by understanding each customer’s business goals, challenges, and how Adra solutions support their financial operations.
* Monitor customer health metrics and proactively mitigate risk while identifying upsell or cross-sell opportunities.
* Collaborate with Product, Support, Sales, and Professional Services teams to improve the customer experience and advocate for customer needs internally. Deliver virtual or in-person training, product walk-throughs, and success planning sessions.
* Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, feedback, and activity in CRM systems.
* Contribute to customer education content and playbooks to support the broader customer base.


**Who You Are**
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
* 2 years of experience as a Customer Success Manager or similar customer-facing role in a SaaS business.
* Experience managing a large volume of customers using Digital Touch or tech-touch success strategies.
* Strong communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
* Proven ability to work cross-functionally in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
* Tech-savvy and quick to learn new software platforms; experience with CRM and CS tools a plus (e.g. Salesforce or Gainsight).


**Bonus points for:**
* Experience supporting or working with accounting and finance professionals; ideally with a background in accounting (degree or practical experience as an accountant)


 At our core, Trintechers stand committed to fostering a culture rooted in our core values – Humble, Empowered, Reliable, and Open. Together, these values guide our actions, define our identity, and inspire us to continuously strive for excellence in everything we do.
   

  

*Should you require (or need) accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please provide your requirements to recruiting@trintech.com and we will work with you to accommodate your needs.*
*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.*

title: Senior Infrastructure Cloud Architect, Professional Services
description:
**Description**
 As a Senior Cloud Infrastructure Architect, you will contribute with presales and led complex projects as a Delivery Technical Leader, often involving multiple Amazon and customer teams. You will lead and enable them by applying Amazon Day 1 culture and developing technical expertise to deliver solutions tailored to their business needs.
   

  

 You will work with customers and partners supporting them through planning, prioritization and delivery of complex transformation initiatives, while collaborating with relevant Sales and Service Teams. You will help create and apply frameworks, methods, best practices and artifacts that deliver prescriptive guidance to customers, and publish and present them in large forums and across various media platforms. You will provide guidance regarding customers’ technical architecture and investments, maximizing alignment with the AWS platform, and ease of adoption as new services and products become available. You will work towards customer business outcomes, ensuring there is a strong connection between delivery activities and business objectives.
   

  

 Do you have experience leading and delivering large IT solutions in agile environment - plan, organize, and manage all phases of a project lifecycle to ensure successful delivery on a scale?
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Multiple years of IT implementation experience in customer-facing roles
* Track record as technical leader driving engagements and guiding customer investment decisions
* Experience driving discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation
* Experience driving presales with senior customer stakeholders in collaboration with internal teams
* Hands-on programming/scripting experience to drive the design, development and deployment of business software infrastructure at scale


**Preferred Qualifications**
* BS level technical degree with Computer Science or Math background
* Proven track record of implementing AWS services in large scale cloud migrations and highly available and fault-tolerant enterprise software deployments
* Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (e.g., security, privacy, SOX, ISO, HIPAA etc.)
* AWS Certifications, e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2806530

title: Senior Lösningsarkitekt
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 9 års erfarenhet av att arbeta som lösningsarkitekt
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av Dynamics 365 Finance & Operation
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med D365 Finance & Operation och ISV-lösningar
* Erfarenhet av att skapa roadmaps för ERP och generellt för både IT-organisationen och verksamheten
* Flera års erfarenhet av att leda team och driva förändring i en stor organisation, där intressenthantering är en naturlig del av det dagliga arbetet
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med integration till andra system med D365 Finance &Operation
* Har arbetat med olika nivåer, från CxO till praktiska affärsanvändare och IT-personal
* Praktisk erfarenhet av hur D365 F&O underhålls
* Erfarenhet av företagsarkitekturramverk som TOGAF, särskilt i ett agilt sammanhang
* Goda kunskaper i svenska tal och skrift.


**Meriterande**
* Förståelse för integrationstekniker
* Förståelse för fullstackutveckling
* Erfarenhet inom ekonomi, inköp och lagerhantering
* Erfarenhet av hur uppgraderingar hanteras i Dynamics 365
* Konsulten bör ha erfarenhet av att ha arbetat inom säkerhetsklassad verksamhet.
* Konsulten bör ha erfarenhet av arbete inom den offentliga sektorn.
* Erfarenhet av stora IT transformationsprojekt


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 20-06-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Marknadsföring
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden
description:

 ✨ Erfarenhet av att skapa nyhetsbrev – extra plus om du kan Marketing Cloud
 



 🎨 Ett gott öga för grafisk form och känsla för detaljer
 



 ⚡️ Förmågan att jobba snabbt, men ändå noggrant
 



 💻 Vana vid att jobba i olika CMS
 



 🧠 En nyfiken inställning och viljan att lära dig nya saker
 



 🏢 Och sist men inte minst – vilja att jobba
 **på plats** 
 tillsammans med oss andra (vi är faktiskt rätt trevliga!)
 



  





 Låter det som något för dig? Håll utkik – mer information kommer snart! Vi - ditt team har roligt på jobbet varje dag.

title: Experienced data solution professional – in Stockholm or Gothenburg
description:
Do you want to be a part of shaping Valcon as a premium technology consulting firm in Sweden? Do you have 8 years of experience in consulting and/or other relevant roles? And are you passionate about creating lasting results for clients? Then you could be our new colleague.
   

  

 Valcon is a leading European management consulting firm with Scandinavian roots and an informal, inclusive culture. With offices in the Netherlands, Denmark, the UK, Sweden, Germany, Croatia and Serbia, we strive to connect strategy with operations through innovative technology and data. We are looking for an experienced and curious individual who values collaboration and thrives in dynamic, diverse environments.
   

  

**Experience**
* 8 years of experience in data consulting or other relevant roles
* Hands-on expertise
* Data Bricks, Microsoft Fabric
* A relevant Master degree


**Keywords**
* Creating lasting results
* Commercial mindset


**Location** 
 : Sweden
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As a experienced data solution professional at Valcon, you will:
   

  

* Be part of the digital advisory team in one of the fastest-growing consultancies in Europe
* Contribute to our exciting growth journey while contributing to our expanding presence in the Swedish market
* Work side by side with skilled and experienced colleagues in diverse and international teams, tackling challenges from digital strategies to IT implementations
* Solve complex problems for Swedish and international companies across industries, guiding them to unlock the full potential of their data
* Help clients become more data-driven, comply with laws and regulations regarding their data and help them get the most value out of their data


**What We Are Looking For**
 To thrive in this role, you should be able to say yes to some or all of the following:
   

  

* 8 years of experience in data consulting or other relevant roles
* A relevant Master’s degree
* A strong understanding of industry standards, best practices and emerging trends in data, such as data governance, engineering, AI, and machine learning
* Hands-on expertise in designing scalable, secure and high-performing data/technical solutions aligned with client needs
* Proficiency in leading-edge tools and platforms such as Databricks, Celonis, Microsoft Fabric and the broader Azure ecosystem specialising in data and AI solutions
* Experience in data architecture, including data modelling and warehousing
* A commercial mindset with a proven track record in uncovering growth opportunities, building strong client relationships and selling complex technical assignments
* A thoughtful approach to leadership with the ability to guide and mentor project teams effectively
* Relevant certifications in IT management, project management (e.g., PMP) and digital transformation (e.g., CDT). ITIL, Microsoft and Cloud are a plus
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in both Swedish and English with the ability to translate technical concepts for a variety of stakeholders


**We offer you**
 At Valcon, we believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels valued and respected. We offer:
   

  

* A diverse and international workplace with an informal culture and a flat hierarchy
* The opportunity to collaborate across business areas and levels and work closely with some of the most talented and experienced consultants in the industry
* A focus on professional and personal growth, supported by our value-driven culture, which is grounded in Integrity, Together, Joy, Curious, and Can Do
* Enhanced benefits and support throughout all life stages, including maternity, paternity and adoption leave, health and well-being initiatives and resources for navigating significant life transitions
* A welcoming office environment in either Stockholm (Kungsgatan 9) or Gothenburg (Kungsportsavenyen 21)


 We care deeply about results, but we care even more about people. At Valcon, you’ll find a workplace that values excellence and ingenuity while keeping grounded in the reality of delivering lasting results for our clients.
   

  

**Application**
 Does this sound like the right opportunity for you? If so, we encourage you to apply below. For any questions or additional information, feel free to reach out to [email protected].
   

  

 We are reviewing applications and conducting interviews on an ongoing basis, so please send us your application as soon as possible.

title: Lead Salesforce Architect - Stockholm
description:
**Lead Salesforce Architect – Shape the Future of Salesforce at Sofigate**
 Would you like to join the leading business technology company in the Nordics? Do you speak both business and technology fluently? If yes, keep reading!
   

  

 We’re looking for a top-tier
 **Lead Salesforce Architect** 
 —a person who doesn’t just understand the platform but defines what great looks like in the Swedish Salesforce ecosystem. You’re not just technically sharp—you're already active in the market. You influence deals, guide strategic customers, and set the tone for what scalable, forward-looking Salesforce architecture should be. This role is not about joining a team. It’s about lifting an entire Salesforce department—technically, culturally, and commercially.
   

  

 You’ll work side by side with Sofigate’s leadership, key clients, Salesforce themselves, and our most senior consultants to ensure our Salesforce business stays ahead—technically innovative, commercially relevant, and architecturally world-class.
   

  

**Your Impact:**
* Drive Technical Excellence: Lead architecture decisions across multiple programs and industries. Set standards, enforce best practices, and ensure long-term scalability.
* Act as a Technical Force Multiplier: Mentor senior consultants, coach architects, and continuously raise the bar across our Salesforce delivery teams.
* Win Strategic Deals: Be at the center of our most important bids. Shape solutions that win large-scale clients and anchor long-term relationships.
* Represent Sofigate in the Ecosystem: You’re active in the Swedish Salesforce scene—this role gives you a platform to go even further.
* Accelerate Innovation: Help us explore and implement cutting-edge capabilities in AI, automation, and platform extensions (Agentforce, MuleSoft, etc.).
* Partner at the Top: Work directly with Salesforce, C-level clients, and internal executives on vision, value realization, and roadmaps.


**What we expect?**
* Deep technical and architectural knowledge across the Salesforce platform (core clouds and beyond)
* A strong presence in the Swedish Salesforce community
* Proven experience leading complex Salesforce transformations and large enterprise programs
* The ability to simplify complexity and explain architecture to both C-levels and developers
* Experience in strategic sales dialogues, from early ideation to final closure
* A mindset that balances governance, scalability, and fast delivery


**What’s in it for you?**
 As a Sofigator, you get the opportunity to work with knowledgeable and driven colleagues, develop and challenge yourself and create sustainable value for our customers. We have an international, vibrant and fun culture with great openness and flexibility. We value every Sofigator and strive to build a diverse, equal, and inclusive workplace where everyone’s voice is heard, and where everyone can become the best versions of themselves. We value a healthy work life balance and support you in maintaining it.
   

  

 Growth is not just a corporate thing for us – it is personal. There is so much to explore and learn within our community, and together with our customers, that having a bit of fun is unavoidable. We do not leave the future up to chance. We take ownership of it. You can, too.
   

  

**We would like to hear from you**
 Ready to drive transformation with Salesforce? Please, tell us more about your background, competences and your motivation to be part of our growth story by June 20, 2025. Join Sofigate and be part of something bigger!
   

  

 If you have any questions, don't hesitate to contact Business Executive Johan Neumann (johan.neumann@sofigate.com)
   

  

**About Sofigate**
*We are The Business Technology Company with the fastest time-to-value in the gen AI era. We achieve that by combining our transformation expertise with low/no-code platforms and generative AI. That’s how we create sustainable customer value. In practice, that means helping our customers to develop the interplay between business and technology: to design, build and implement transformations and business-friendly technology solutions, like Salesforce, ServiceNow and SAP.*
*As leaders of Business Technology management, we are the founder of the Business Technology Forum, the developer of the* 
 Business Technology Standard
 *. Our team of 800+ professionals based in 8 offices across 5 countries – Finland, Sweden, Denmark, Hungary and Poland – are always ready to help, both our colleagues and our customers. At the very core of our being are our values: dare, care and grow. We dare to challenge the market, foster a community that cares about our people and drive growth with a customer centric business vision.*

title: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer – Embedded & Cloud Systems
description:
**About**
 Echandia Marine is a leading innovator in sustainable marine battery systems, providing cutting-edge technology to enable cleaner, more efficient marine transport. Our mission is to revolutionize the maritime industry through advanced battery technology, improving efficiency and reducing environmental impact.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Senior Fullstack Software Engineer to join our growing software team. In this role, you will design and build scalable, high-performance applications that connect embedded systems, cloud infrastructure, and user interfaces. Your work will directly support the monitoring, diagnostics, and control of our marine battery systems and at the same time support our developing efforts in cloud with both frontend and backend work.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Design and implement software for battery management system based on maritime standards
* Build robust APIs and backend services to interface with embedded systems and cloud platforms in a Linux environment.
* Develop intuitive and responsive front-end interfaces for internal tools and customer-facing dashboards.
* Collaborate with embedded, test, and systems engineers to ensure seamless integration across the stack.
* Implement secure, scalable, and maintainable software architectures.
* Contribute to DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and automated testing.
* Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and technical mentoring.


**Required Skills:**
* Strong experience in fullstack development using modern frameworks, preferably Angular, Typescript and C#.
* Proficiency in designing RESTful APIs and working with IoT Solutions.
* Strong experience in developing hardware-near applications
* Solid understanding of software architecture, security, and performance optimization.
* Familiarity with data visualization, telemetry, and system monitoring tools.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


**Bonus Points:**
* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Experience with Agile development methodologies.
* Experience in developing embedded applications using C.
* Experience with Linux systems administration.
* Experience with CI/CD and build automation with GitHub Actions
* Familiarity with databases (SQL and NoSQL) and message brokers (e.g., MQTT, Kafka).
* Knowledge of maritime compliance standards

title: Business Coordinator - Sales Support
description:
**Company Description**
 Meet Unit4. We’re a fast-paced growth cloud company, changing the game in ERP for mid-market people-centric organizations. We’re on a mission to turn 40 years of conventional legacy ERP software on its head and re-write the industry.
   

  

 We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   

  

 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you looking to gain hands-on exposure to business operations and strategy in a fast-paced global SaaS company? Are you looking for an international role where you will be supporting our executive sales leadership on our transformational journey? We're seeking a driven, and business-minded individual to join our sales team in a support capacity that goes beyond traditional admin roles. This person will play a key part in powering our commercial success — analyzing data, suggesting improvements, driving project planning and follow-ups, preparing impactful presentations, and supporting the sales processes. You’ll be working closely with executive sales leadership and cross-functional teams, gaining hands-on exposure to core business operations and strategy.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Assist in organizing and tracking business development initiatives and sales projects and initiatives.
* Support the sales team with data-driven insights, collecting, processing, interpreting, and presenting business data and information.
* Create PowerPoint presentations, sales decks, templates, and business proposals tailored to prospects and clients.
* Conduct follow-ups with internal stakeholders
* Prepare and follow up on reports, summaries, and meeting notes to keep the sales process moving
* Proactively identify areas where the sales team needs support and offer solutions
* Act as a bridge between the sales team and other internal departments (e.g. marketing, operations, finance, support, legal).
* Continuously learn and understand the company’s products, clients, and market trends to add strategic value


**Qualifications**
* Business Degree or other relevant degree in higher Education.
* Strong analytical skills with interest in understanding the business goals, objectives, strategies, processes, and policies.
* Strong Project Management Skills
* 1–3 years of relevant experience (e.g., in business support, sales coordination, assistant roles, or high-paced internships).
* Strong proficiency in CRM systems, Microsoft, AI driven sales systems, PowerPoint, Excel, and data visualization tools
* Fast learner with a proactive attitude and entrepreneurial mindset
* Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
* High proficiency in English
* Highly organized and detail-oriented
* Problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities under tight deadlines
* Commercially curious and business-savvy—able to “connect the dots” beyond tasks


 Additional Information
   

  

 Join Unit4 and you’ll be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the ERP cloud software space today.
   

  

* A culture built on trust. That’s why we offer our people an uncapped time off policy and remote working opportunities. We focus on results, not how many days you work or where that work takes place
* One of the most lucrative commission plans in the industry and a range of market-leading benefits
* World-class sales tools and a pipeline development engine in the form of a global BDR team.
* On-going monthly learning & development opportunities
* Work, learn & be inspired by some of the best talent in the software space
* Talent program for high performers. Each year we provide a platform for high potential talent to accelerate their careers!
* Committed to corporate social responsibility with our Act4Good initiative, our global movement to do good, and a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society
* Diversity4U. Helping our people thrive starts with a safe and inclusive work environment. We launched our Diversity4U program that builds on our “be genuine” value


 Videos To Watch

title: Senior Sales Executive
description:
**Senior Sales Executive — Sweden (Stockholm-based | Hybrid)** 




  





**What’s in it for you?** 




 Join MediaCatch during a phase of exciting growth and be part of shaping the future of AI-powered media intelligence in the Nordics. This is a unique opportunity to play a central role in expanding a high-impact SaaS platform (TRNDSET) that’s redefining how brands understand and activate creator, influencer, and media content.
 



  





 At MediaCatch, we value
 **freedom with responsibility** 
 — we trust you to own your role and drive progress, while also fostering a collaborative environment where help and inspiration are always close at hand. You’ll be part of a bold, high-integrity team with a clear mission and strong momentum. 
 



  





**You’ll get:** 




  




* A key commercial role in a fast-growing AI scale-up



  




* A chance to help shape go-to-market strategy and customer engagement in Sweden and the Nordics



  




* Competitive salary and performance-based commission model



  




* A hybrid and flexible workplace (Stockholm-based)



  




* A team that believes in speed, integrity, and building category-defining technology



  




* Collaboration across Ahead Group agencies and brands when it brings value to the client



  





**About the role** 




 As
 **Senior Sales Executive** 
 , you’ll take the lead in building strong relationships with modern marketers, media companies, and agencies in Sweden. Your focus will be to drive adoption of our flagship product, TRNDSET, and work closely with clients to understand their needs, challenges, and ambitions — providing solutions that help them unlock performance through real-time media intelligence.
 



 This role combines strategic selling, consultative relationship-building, and entrepreneurial thinking. You’ll be central in executing outbound efforts and go-to-market activities, while working cross-functionally with SDRs, product teams, and commercial leaders across the Ahead Group network.
 



  





**Who you are** 




 You’re a commercially savvy, self-starting salesperson with a deep understanding of the digital media landscape. You're passionate about AI, digital transformation, and product-led growth, and you thrive in fast-moving environments where you’re empowered to take initiative and drive results.
 



  





**You bring:** 




  




* Proven success in B2B sales within SaaS, media, MarTech, or similar verticals



  




* Established expertise in outbound sales — skilled at building and closing your own pipeline while collaborating with SDRs on strategic outreach



  




* Ability to navigate complex deals with multiple stakeholders



  




* Native or fluent Swedish speaker with strong English skills



  




* Experience with HubSpot or similar CRM tools is a plus



  




* Passion for helping clients unlock performance with data and technology



  





**About MediaCatch & TRNDSET** 




 MediaCatch is an AI agency specializing in
 **advanced media intelligence, analysis, and custom AI solutions** 
 for elite brands like Red Bull, Arla, Aftonbladet and Danske Spil. We help clients optimize their marketing strategies using real-time insights drawn from content across video, images, text, and audio. We are fully independent, GDPR-compliant, and built on proprietary AI and infrastructure — no reliance on big tech.
 



  





**TRNDSET** 
 is our flagship SaaS platform, built to analyze influencer and creator content. It helps brands adapt to fast-changing trends, reduce research time, and create content that resonates — all while staying ahead of the curve in an increasingly creator-driven economy.
 



 As part of the Ahead Group and Aller A/S family, you’ll have the backing of a leading Scandinavian agency network while working in an entrepreneurial environment.
 



  





**Ready to join?** 




 If you’re ready to make an impact in a fast-scaling AI company and help shape the way leading brands in the Nordics leverage creator intelligence, then let's build something great together.
 



  





 If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you — feel free to send your cover letter directly to me at therese@mediacatch.io or reach out to me with any questions!
 



  





**Contact information:** 




 Therése Hategan
 



 CCO
 



 therese@mediacatch.io
 



 +45 53 77 07 80

title: Cloud Account Executive - Tableau Sweden
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

 Are you a sales professional with a passion for selling complex software solutions?
   

  

 At Tableau, a Salesforce company, we help people see, understand and action on their data.
   

  

 We have just released the first Agentic Analytics platform in the market: Tableau Next.We're looking for an Account Executive in Sweden to help Enterprise business organizations unlock the full potential of data-driven decision-making with Tableau Next's unique Agentic capabilities.
   

  

**About Us**
 Tableau’s mission is to make data accessible and actionable for everyone. As part of Salesforce, we combine cutting-edge technology with a commitment to customer success, creating real impact for businesses and communities alike. Our inclusive culture celebrates diverse perspectives and encourages innovation at every level.
   

  

**Your Role**
* Develop and Execute Sales Plans: Identify opportunities to expand within existing accounts and target new prospects.
* Build Relationships: Engage with key stakeholders, including C-level executives, to understand their needs and demonstrate the value of Tableau.
* Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with internal resources and Salesforce counterparts to align efforts and deliver exceptional customer outcomes.
* Drive Sales Cycles: Manage complex deals from prospecting to close, ensuring a strong pipeline and accurate forecasting.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Experience: 5+ years in software or technology sales, with a proven track record of meeting or exceeding quotas.
* Market Knowledge: Familiarity with SaaS solutions and the ability to navigate complex sales environments.
* Strong Communicator: Ability to engage at all organizational levels and clearly convey the benefits of our platform.
* Team Player: Comfortable working in a collaborative, matrixed environment to achieve common goals.
* Language Skills: Fluent in Swedish and English.


**Preferred Experience**
* Background in selling analytics, data, or business intelligence solutions.
* Experience in cloud or SaaS sales is a plus.
* Being passioned about Data, AI and Analytics / Tableau.


**Why Join Tableau?**
* Competitive Compensation: Uncapped commission potential with excellent benefits.
* Growth Opportunities: Access to the global Salesforce ecosystem for career development.
* Inclusive Environment: Be part of a culture that values diversity and fosters personal and professional growth.
* Impactful Work: Help businesses harness the power of data to make better decisions


 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Data Center Electrical Engineer
description:
At Eaton we are continuously striving to make our world safer, sustainable and efficient in power management. We believe in our employees and we can achieve our goals together. We make what matters work! Join us and help us provide energy-efficient solutions that make a real impact. Find out more about Eaton!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As Data Center Electrical Engineer you will drive pre-sales efforts in promoting, architecting and approving Eaton technology content in target accounts, assisting Sales Engineers for Data Centers segments. You will lead customer facing technical interventions and establish a trusted advisor relationship with decision makers and internal stakeholders towards meeting Eaton revenue goals in Benelux / Nordics.
   

  

* Participate in pre-sales process to understand customer business, technical objectives and project requirements.
* Assist Sales Engineers in promoting and approving Data Centers Solutions
* Understands the customer pain points and actively engages them for technical needs.
* Collaborates with internal, product management/support , commercial sales teams and partners to engage strategic customer in applying Eaton solutions and writes content for technical and commercial proposals.
* Evaluates project/opportunity risk and constraints and proposes relevant solution which meets performance requirements.
* Analyzes technology environment and assesses customer project needs.
* Present technical papers and create technical content for social media and marketing needs in the form of case studies or technical notes.
* Participate in technical and/or standards commitees.
* Supports Marketing function in developing functional requirements as per evolving regional markets needs.
* Serves as liaison between marketing and product managers.
* Provide competitors capability analysis.
* Provide trainings for technology partners and value-added resellers
* Develop prototype solutions and demonstrate Eaton solutions on premises or through virtual sessions.


**Qualifications**
* Electrical Engineering Bachelor´s, Master´s degree would be a plus.
* Extensive experience and solid technical knowledge of Data Center Solutions & designs.
* Self-driven personality and team player.
* Eager to learn and develop technical competences.
* Strong communications skills: professional level of English, local and other language is advantage.
* Proposals writing and other content creation.
* Ability to translate deep technical discussions for non-technical stakeholders.
* Structured approach to problem solving and performance monitoring.
* Able to work and travel within EU region without any restriction.


**What We Offer You**
* Competitive compensation and benefits package (annual bonus, pension contribution and many more).
* Company car.
* Flexible working and EMEA wide traveling.
* Great promotional opportunities – We encourage internal promotion, whenever possible.
* Excellent working environment – safety and ethic are really important for us.
* Learning & Development - We invest in our employees for the long term – not just with salary and benefits, but with ongoing learning and development opportunities made available through Eaton University.


 We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for job applicants and employees. Our recruitment processes use balanced selection criteria and avoid unlawful discrimination against applicants on the basis of their age, colour, disability, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity, genetic information, race or racial origin, religion, sexual orientation or any other status protected or required by law.

title: Principal  Enterprise Account Manager, Europe North Enterprise Greenfield, Europe North Enterprise Greenfield
description:
***This job is with Amazon, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Description**
 Would you like to be part of a talented team of experienced technical sales professionals focused on winning and growing new business with some of Sweden's largest Enterprises as they transform their business? As an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Principal Enterprise Account Manager in our Enterprise Growth team, you will have the exciting opportunity of driving digital transformation across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology and support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an AWS Principal Enterprise Account Manager in our Enterprise Greenfield (new business) team, you are driving digital transformations through effective engagement with C-level executives, business development executives, IT leaders, architects, developers, and various lines of businesses. You are establishing AWS as the key cloud technology provider across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio to Enterprise Customers.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 On a daily basis you empower your customers to solve challenges while attaining both their operational and innovation goals. You deliver business outcomes while guiding them to become more agile, innovative, and efficient. With AWS, our customers benefit from the fastest pace of innovation, the broadest and deepest functionality, the most secure computing environment, and the most proven operational expertise.
   

  

 Do you look around corners for ways to engage and service customers? Are you passionate about using technology to solve business problems that have big customer impact?
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience as a quota carrying technology enterprise field sales or business development account manager, including complex account management and greenfield/new business experience.
* The ideal candidate will have experience developing relationships across industry verticals, including: Financial Services Industry (FSI), Manufacturing, Media & Entertainment and/or Retail/CPG.
* Experience increasing technology adoption and creating long term transformational account strategies, and demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise Customers, including working with and presenting to C-level executives, IT, and other lines of business.
* Swedish language: native or fluent business speaker.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* 10 years+ of technology field sales or business development experience, ideally selling cloud solutions
* Experience developing long term customer relationships, with multiple lines of business, including senior CxO stakeholders
* Active listener and effective communicator with demonstrated success in effective deal closing skills on large, complex deals
* Extensive working knowledge with CRMs (e.g. Salesforce), forecasting, account plan creation and ownership
* Demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise customers
* A passionate, self-starter, ready to take AWS Sweden Enterprise customer experience to the next level


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you're applying in isn't listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

description:
**Description**
 Would you like to be part of a talented team of experienced technical sales professionals focused on winning and growing new business with some of Sweden's largest Enterprises as they transform their business? As an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Principal Enterprise Account Manager in our Enterprise Growth team, you will have the exciting opportunity of driving digital transformation across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology and support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an AWS Principal Enterprise Account Manager in our Enterprise Greenfield (new business) team, you are driving digital transformations through effective engagement with C-level executives, business development executives, IT leaders, architects, developers, and various lines of businesses. You are establishing AWS as the key cloud technology provider across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio to Enterprise Customers.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 On a daily basis you empower your customers to solve challenges while attaining both their operational and innovation goals. You deliver business outcomes while guiding them to become more agile, innovative, and efficient. With AWS, our customers benefit from the fastest pace of innovation, the broadest and deepest functionality, the most secure computing environment, and the most proven operational expertise.
   

  

 Do you look around corners for ways to engage and service customers? Are you passionate about using technology to solve business problems that have big customer impact?
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience as a quota carrying technology enterprise field sales or business development account manager, including complex account management and greenfield/new business experience.
* The ideal candidate will have experience developing relationships across industry verticals, including: Financial Services Industry (FSI), Manufacturing, Media & Entertainment and/or Retail/CPG.
* Experience increasing technology adoption and creating long term transformational account strategies, and demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise Customers, including working with and presenting to C-level executives, IT, and other lines of business.
* Swedish language: native or fluent business speaker.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* 10 years+ of technology field sales or business development experience, ideally selling cloud solutions
* Experience developing long term customer relationships, with multiple lines of business, including senior CxO stakeholders
* Active listener and effective communicator with demonstrated success in effective deal closing skills on large, complex deals
* Extensive working knowledge with CRMs (e.g. Salesforce), forecasting, account plan creation and ownership
* Demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise customers
* A passionate, self-starter, ready to take AWS Sweden Enterprise customer experience to the next level


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)

description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

**We’re Salesforce** 
 , the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

 Our Enterprise Business team focuses on working with our most strategic customers and organizations of 10,000+ employees. You will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced team with various customers and receive personalized training and career opportunities.
   

  

**About The Role**
 This is a unique opportunity to join a highly successful team of seasoned Enterprise Account Executives working with the company's Top Retail Accounts. Salesforce is looking for very hardworking, high EQ and passionate individuals who can effectively articulate how & why our solutions can help transform Customers’ business and exceed their goals.
   

  

 Salesforce aspires to deliver business transformation enabled by technology to its customers and therefore requires individuals able to develop deep insight into the business dynamics of large sophisticated enterprises and help shape customers' change agenda.
   

  

**Your Day-to-Day**
* Our Enterprize Account Executives engage with existing customers and new leads to sell the entire Salesforce Customer 360 platform. They build positive, trusted relationships with both key team members and c-suite decision makers within their patch, and become naturals at helping customers realize value from their Salesforce investments.
* You will use your skills to develop opportunities, through both warm leads and whitespace prospecting.
* Develop key customer stakeholder relationships and drive customer satisfaction at assigned accounts
* Develop and drive the overall long-term strategy for the account, aligned to customer business objectives
* Coordinate internal Salesforce resources to meet customer business needs
* Perform account planning at assigned accounts, coordinating with Prime and Cloud sales resources to ensure strategic alignment
* Share Salesforce value proposition for existing and/or new customers
* Drive growth within an existing assigned account
* Preferred Qualifications:
* 10 years of full-cycle sales experience in the Swedish market
* Ability to strategise with a large extended team
* Experience with working within the Retail Sector


**What We Look For In You**
* Effective communicator & quick learner: Ability to articulate how & why our solutions can help transform Customers’ business and exceed their goals.
* Successfully run complex SaaS sales deals: Ability to develop sophisticated deal structures and commercial proposals for large deals.
* Strong analytical & problem-solving skills are essential
* Strong influencing capabilities; must be a self-starter, high-energy
* Strong appetite to work in a strategic selling environment.
* Fluent in English and Swedish + Right to work in Sweden


**Working at Salesforce**
 Working at Salesforce isn’t all about selling. It’s also about learning, and we heavily invest in you with a month-long immersion and onboarding, including a week-long product boot camp, mentorship program, weekly coaching and development programs.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We are pioneers of the Pledge 1% model, providing products, grants and community service to those in need. We are proud to be#1 in PEOPLE’s Top 50 Companies that Care, and are on Fortune’s Change the World list.
   

  

 We provide every employee with 7 paid volunteer days off a year, and donation matching for all approved charitable donations. We provide other world-leading benefits to all our employees, including;
   

  

* Health, life insurance, retirement saving plan
* Monthly wellness allowance
* Flexible time off & leave policies
* Parental benefits
* Perks and discounts


 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Security Strategist (EMEA North)
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Security Specialist (EMEA North)**
*Open to locations in Sweden, Norway, Denmark or Finland*
 Splunk is here to build a safer and more resilient digital world. The world's leading enterprises use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable. While customers love our technology, it's our people that make Splunk stand out as an amazing career destination and why we've won so many awards as a best place to work. If you become a Splunker, we want your whole, authentic self, what we call your "million data points". So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you vary. We look at talent, values and character when hiring.
   

  

 Role summary
   

  

 Your primary focus as a Security Strategist is on what's new and what’s next to stay ahead of customer, market and technology trends. You will be part of a small team of technical and domain security subject matter experts that will identify and incubate emerging and strategic Security use cases and solutions that will unify, advance and expand the value of Splunk products for our EMEA North customers with an increased focus on the Nordics region. You will work closely with theater partners, but report up through the Global organization. You will be responsible for driving adoption and success metrics for emerging and incubation-stage security use cases and solutions for your assigned theater and region, while also fulfilling global responsibilities to help evangelize and advance the Splunk Security brand, product and GTM strategy.
   

  

 Your role will require you to interface cross-functionally at both theater and global levels with teams across sales, technical sales, customer success, partners, product marketing and product management.
   

  

 What you'll get to do!
   

  

* Develop and refine emerging security use cases for Splunk products that reflect priority customer challenges, market trends, the evolving threat landscape and unique business opportunities.
* Develop and test new maturity models, white papers, programs, workshops, demos, POVs, enablement content, and thought leadership content to showcase and accelerate adoption of emerging information security use cases and solutions.
* Represent Splunk Security internally as a security GTM stakeholder in product roadmap, launch planning, customer initiative development in strategic growth areas for our customers and our business in security.
* Evangelize Splunk Security vision, strategy and roadmap at industry events and with global customers and partners.
* Mentor security talent both within our team and across the SE and Solution Architect community at Splunk as we look to continue to increase and expand the profile of security.
* Partner with regional teams to localize global content and strategy to region-specific sales plays, enablement content, account targeting strategies and channel strategies for incubation-stage use cases and solutions with the in-theater technical sales and sales teams.


**Qualifications**
* 7+ years of technical sales, product or practitioner experience in the security industry.
* Experience with modern security technologies and their place in an organization's architecture, e.g., SIEM, SOAR, and UEBA.
* Clear and concise communicator being comfortable presenting publicly to large audiences or one on one with senior executives.
* Experience in driving complex security sales cycles across EMEA.
* Demonstrated knowledge of current threats, high-visibility security events, and trends in the marketplace.
* Familiarity with current security data sources spanning on-premises, hybrid, & multi-cloud (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) including the security detection methodologies they offer.
* Familiarity with common industry frameworks and concepts like MITRE ATT&CK, CSC CIS, LMKC, OTel, DORA, etc.
* Willingness and ability to work cross-functionally across a globally-dispersed remote organization with minimal supervision.
* Willingness to travel for industry and marketing events, customer and functional meetings.
* Based in Sweden, Denmark or Norway.


 Splunk is an Equal Opportunity Employer
   

  

 Splunk, a Cisco company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

title: Director of Predictive Analytics & Financial Forecasting to Husqvarna Group
company_industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Manufacturing, and Machinery Manufacturing
description:
Join Husqvarna Group and Shape the Future with Data-Driven Insights!
 



  





**About Husqvarna Group** 




  





 Husqvarna Group is a global leader in innovative solutions for managing forests, parks, and gardens, as well as cutting equipment and diamond tools for the light construction and stone industries. With an innovative mindset, we are dedicated to deliver high-quality solutions ranging from robotic mowers to chainsaws, watering systems and power cutters, with a strong focus on our customers and future generations.
 



  





 Founded in the Swedish town Huskvarna in 1689, we have been pioneers in our business for more than three centuries. Today, we are mainly operating under the Husqvarna and Gardena brands, serving consumers and professionals in over 100 countries through direct sales, dealers, and retailers. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, Husqvarna Group employs approximately 13,300 people in 40 countries and reported net sales of SEK 48,4 billion in 2024. Husqvarna Group is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.
 



  





**Welcome to Group Finance at Husqvarna Group!** 




  





 We are now looking for a Director of Predictive Analytics and Financial Forecasting to take the lead in financial planning and forecasting processes at the highest level. This role is central to enhancing forecast accuracy, developing cutting-edge financial models, and enabling data-driven decisions across our global organization. You will report to VP Business Control & Strategic Planning.
 



  





 As a strategic leader in this space, you will collaborate with senior executives and business leaders across functions, ensuring that Husqvarna remains ahead of the curve in financial analytics and planning.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Lead financial planning processes, including monthly forecasts and annual budgets
* Develop advanced financial models to support strategic initiatives
* Collaborate cross-functionally and present insights to senior management and the board
* Identify financial trends, risks, and opportunities
* Drive continuous improvement in forecasting and analytics processes



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 




  




* Extensive experience in financial planning & analysis
* Deep knowledge of SAP Analytic Cloud (SAC)
* A strategic mindset with strong leadership capabilities
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* A degree in Finance, Economics or related field (CFA/CPA or Master’s preferred)
* Fluency in English is required; additional languages are a plus



  





**Husqvarna Group offers you:** 




  




* A high-impact role in a global company with strong focus on innovation and digitalization
* Freedom with responsibility in a collaborative, international environment
* A chance to lead strategic financial initiatives and influence top-level decisions
* Great colleagues, modern offices, and a culture where your voice and ideas matter
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth in a company with a proud history and bold future



  





**Winning Through Culture** 




  





 We believe that business is ultimately about people, as a team, we win and grow together. Our culture is built on bold ideas, strong commitment, and a shared purpose, creating an environment where innovation thrives, people grow, and every contribution matters.
 



  





**Our culture is built on three core themes:** 




  




* **Bold:** 
 We push boundaries, embrace challenges, and explore new possibilities.
* **Dedicated:** 
 We put in the hard work, bring passion and resilience to every challenge we take on.
* **Care:** 
 We support each other, consider the impact of our actions, and strive to make a lasting difference.



  





 Whether you’re starting your career or looking for the next big step, we offer a place where passion and purpose come together. Join us in shaping the future! Learn more about our culture here: Our Culture | Husqvarna Group
 



  





**Ready to shape the future of financial forecasting at a leading global company? Apply today and be part of our journey! Could this be your next challenge?** 




  





 Husqvarna Group is conducting this recruitment process in collaboration with Clarify. The interview process is ongoing, and you are welcome to submit your application through our website as soon as possible. If you have any questions, please contact Clarify, Sara Paulsson 070-792 75 99, sara@clarify.se or Victor Edin 070-743 13 44, victor@clarify.se.

title: Konsultchef Embedded, SW-utveckling, Mekatronik och AI
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**Sigma Industry Evolution** är ett bolag i Sigma Group med fokus inom områdena Mekatronik, Elektronik Inbyggda System och AI-tjänsteutveckling åt våra kunder.



Nu behöver vi förstärka med ytterligare en avdelningschef i Lund, Som Avdelnings- och konsultchef ansvarar du för att driva en enhet med ett starkt kontaktnät av kunder och samarbetspartners i regionen. Till din hjälp har du kollegor med lång erfarenhet, etablerade ramavtal med de stora utvecklingsbolagen och en väl fungerande organisation.



Som avdelningschef kommer du att fortsätta utveckla och forma vårt företag och verksamhet, samtidigt som du bidrar till affärsutveckling och tar ansvar för både kundrelationer och rekrytering.



Vårt fokus ligger på löpande konsulttjänster kompletterade med satelliter och projekt från våra kontor. Ditt mål är att bygga en avdelning med cirka 25 anställda konsulter samt partners. Tjänsten innebär stor frihet och många möjligheter att påverka vår fortsatta expansion inom våra fokusområden. Vi vill att du ska vara med och driva vår tillväxt, utveckla långsiktiga samarbeten och befästa Sigma Industry Evolution som en ledande aktör inom branschen.



Vi intervjuar löpande och tjänsten kan stängas innan slutdatum, så vänta inte med att söka!



Bakgrundskontroll kommer utföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.



### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.
* Ingenjörsutbildning eller annan relevant utbildning och flera års arbetslivserfarenhet inom något av områdena mekatronik, elektronik, mjukvara eller AI.
* Ett väl upparbetat kontaktnät i branschen.
* Erfarenhet av tjänsteförsäljning och rekrytering.
* Tidigare erfarenhet från konsultbranschen är meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta mot offentlig sektor är meriterande.
### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**


* Du drivs av att göra affärer och att bygga långsiktiga relationer, både med kunder och medarbetare.
* Du är social, nyfiken och trivs med att jobba resultatinriktat i en miljö med högt tempo.
* Du har ett entreprenöriellt driv och stark initiativförmåga som gör att du ser möjligheter, hittar kreativa lösningar och vill fortsätta utveckla vår elkraftsverksamhet.
* Du motiveras av att leda, forma och expandera ett högpresterande team.
### **WE OFFER**



Rollen är direkt underställd bolagets VD. Du får stora möjligheter att påverka och utveckla våra affärer och bygga företaget tillsammans. Som avdelningschef ansvarar du för din personal, dina kundrelationer och avdelningens resultatutveckling. Du blir del av en kultur präglad av entreprenörskap, korta beslutsvägar och ett starkt gemenskapstänkande, där engagemang och glädje är centrala inslag.



Vi lägger stor vikt vid att våra medarbetare ska få utrymme att växa i sina yrkesroller. Genom vårt etablerade nätverk av kunder och samarbeten finns goda möjligheter att snabbt komma in i rollen och fortsätta utveckla området i den riktning du brinner för.



Är du redo att ta nästa steg och skapa framtidens konsultlösningar tillsammans med oss? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan – vi anställer löpande!



Du når rekryterande chef direkt på:



+46 706 70 61 77  

Dick.Stenebo@sigma.se



*Sigma Industry Evolution AB är ett företag som arbetar inom med utveckling i flera branschen och områden. Vi är ett personalutvecklingsbolag, det är här vårt fulla fokus ligger, gå med i ett företag som är helt fokuserat på dig och det du behöver.*



*Kombinationen av lång branscherfarenhet, stort engagemang, interna och externa uppdrag samt nära samarbete mellan Sigmas olika verksamheter i regionen skapar ett unikt branschöverskridande växthus för ingenjörer. Med mångfald, delaktighet och entreprenörskap stärker och utvecklar vi vår verksamhet och våra medarbetare. Skulle du vilja utvecklas i den här miljön?*



### **MORE INFORMATION**

  



Dick Stenebo,  

+46 706706177  

dick.stenebo@sigma.se

Konsultchef Embedded, SW-utveckling, Mekatronik och AI

Sigma Industry Evolution

Lund, Sweden

Calculation & Simulation, Mechanical Engineering, Electricity & Automation, Energy & Power Engineering, Hardware Electronics, Testing and Verification, Project Management & Management, Audio/Acoustics, Project Management, Software development embedded systems, RF And Microwave, Function development, System design, Business Intelligence, Business Systems, System development, Operation, support and infrastructure, Test & Quality, Business Analysis, Digital Communication, Requirement Management & Business Development, Project Management, Software development, Digitalisation, Digitalisation, Automation, Management, Sales and Marketing

Dick Stenebo, dick.stenebo@sigma.se, +46706706177
