title: System Verification Engineer - [F/M/X]
description:
Who are we?
  
Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.
  
  

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
  
  

**Brief Call:** Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
  
  

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
  
  

**Case study:** Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
  
  

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
  
We look forward to meeting you!
  
  

Job description
  
  

About the Role
  
  

Join our team in Braås to lead verification and validation of dump truck electrical systems (25–100-ton machines). You’ll define test environments, validate hardware/software integration, and ensure compliance for our new, development-intensive machine. This role blends hands-on testing, problem-solving, and mentorship within an international Scrum team of 17–19 engineers.
  
  

Key Responsibilities
  
  

**Testing & Validation:**  

Design and execute system verification tests (hardware/software) using CANalyzer, TechTool, and Enterprise Architect.
  
  

Validate electrical systems against interface requirements and real-world performance metrics (load data, functionality).
  
  

Resolve complex issues from tests and support compliance documentation (self-certified).
  
  

**Leadership & Collaboration:**  

Mentor junior testers and collaborate with 8 Scrum teams (SW/HW focus).
  
  

Drive continuous improvement in testing methodologies and tools.
  
  

Act as a go-to expert for cross-functional projects (SW developers, supply chain, compliance).
  
  

**Operational Ownership:**  

Ensure quality readiness before product releases.
  
  

Lead onboard testing (dump truck operation required; C-class license is a merit).
  
  

Qualifications & Profile
  
  

**Must-Have:**  

10+ years in system verification/testing (automotive, heavy machinery, or related).
  
  

Swedish proficiency (or strong willingness to learn; daily use required).
  
  

Driver’s license (ability to operate dump trucks; C-class license is a plus).
  
  

Expertise in CANalyzer, TechTool, or similar (training provided for gaps).
  
  

Experience with Requirements Model tools (e.g., Enterprise Architect).
  
  

**Ideal Candidate:**  

Senior, flexible problem-solver with a T-shaped skillset (deep technical + broad collaboration).
  
  

Communicative team player who thrives in fast-paced, iterative environments (Scrum/Agile).
  
  

Women encouraged to apply (3 women currently in the team; diversity valued).
  
  

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.
company_description: Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. It gathers more than 7,500 people across 5 continents and more than 60 countries.

title: Director of Engineering - Music
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**

  

We're looking for an Engineering Director to lead our Sound Platform and Digital Rights Management (DRM) areas. This pivotal role involves driving technical vision and strategic execution across five engineering teams, ensuring our technology evolves seamlessly with our product ambitions.


At Epidemic Sound, our engineering is at the heart of soundtracking the world. As an Engineering Director, you'll be instrumental in shaping our core sound platform and managing critical digital rights, guaranteeing our solutions are robust, scalable, and enable future product innovation. This is a platform and tech-heavy role where your strategic technical leadership will be key.

##### **Responsibilities**


As Engineering Director, you'll provide strategic technical leadership and oversight for five engineering teams, including Engineering Managers and Staff Engineers, connecting product vision to technical reality. Your responsibilities include:

* **Strategic Technical Leadership**: Provide clear technical direction and architectural guidance, ensuring our platform supports long term product needs and identifying where specialized expertise is required.
* **Organizational Strategy & Manager Enablement**: Oversee and empower engineering teams, fostering an environment where they excel. This includes managing and developing Engineering Managers and Staff Engineers under your leadership.
* **Driving Technical Excellence**: Foster a culture of top-tier engineering, championing best practices, and pushing for continuous improvement across your domains.
* **Product-to-Tech Translation**: Bridge ambitious product ideas with their technical implementation, ensuring engineering strategy directly supports business goals.
* **Building a high functioning organization**. The Sound domain is core to everything we do at Epidemic and the DRM space is rapidly evolving. This will require you to shape the organization to manage both complex ongoing product needs and large scale strategic movements.

##### **Requirements**


To succeed in this impactful role, we believe you should have:

* Proven experience as a Software Engineer and in technical leadership roles, specifically managing other managers.
* A strong strategic understanding of platform-level challenges and a deep appreciation for complex technical systems in a tech-heavy environment.
* Demonstrated ability to translate product vision into actionable technical strategy and scalable solutions.
* Experience in organizational strategy for engineering teams, fostering growth and enabling high performance.
* A change-driven mindset and a passion for evolving technical landscapes.
* A track record of promoting excellent engineering practices and a commitment to quality.
  


This is a chance to shape the core of Epidemic Sound, directly impacting our ability to scale and innovate in a rapidly evolving digital landscape. You'll guide critical technical and organizational developments, empowering our engineering teams to build the foundational technology that powers our global soundtracking mission and ensures our long-term success.

 **Equal opportunity employer**


We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.

 **Application**


Ready to make the world feel your work? Apply now by clicking the link below! We embrace a hybrid model but love collaborating in person, so we spend the majority of our time in the office.

title: System Verification Engineer - [F/M/X]
description:
**Who are we?**
---------------

**Amaris Consulting** is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.  

  

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
  

  

**Brief Call**: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
  

  

**Interviews** (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
  

  

**Case study**: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
  

  

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
  

We look forward to meeting you!
**Job description**
-------------------

### **About the Role**



Join our team in **Braås** to lead verification and validation of **dump truck electrical systems** (25–100-ton machines). You’ll define test environments, validate hardware/software integration, and ensure compliance for our **new, development-intensive machine**. This role blends hands-on testing, problem-solving, and mentorship within an **international Scrum team** of 17–19 engineers.


**Key Responsibilities**
* **Testing & Validation:**


	+ Design and execute **system verification tests** (hardware/software) using CANalyzer, TechTool, and Enterprise Architect.
	+ Validate electrical systems against interface requirements and **real-world performance metrics** (load data, functionality).
	+ Resolve complex issues from tests and support **compliance documentation** (self-certified).
* **Leadership & Collaboration:**


	+ Mentor junior testers and collaborate with **8 Scrum teams** (SW/HW focus).
	+ Drive **continuous improvement** in testing methodologies and tools.
	+ Act as a **go-to expert** for cross-functional projects (SW developers, supply chain, compliance).
* **Operational Ownership:**


	+ Ensure **quality readiness** before product releases.
	+ Lead **onboard testing** (dump truck operation required; C-class license is a merit).

### **Qualifications & Profile**


**Must-Have:**
* **10+ years in system verification/testing** (automotive, heavy machinery, or related).
* **Swedish proficiency** (or strong willingness to learn; daily use required).
* **Driver’s license** (ability to operate dump trucks; **C-class license is a plus**).
* Expertise in **CANalyzer, TechTool, or similar** (training provided for gaps).
* Experience with **Requirements Model tools** (e.g., Enterprise Architect).

**Ideal Candidate:**
* **Senior, flexible problem-solver** with a **T-shaped skillset** (deep technical + broad collaboration).
* **Communicative team player** who thrives in fast-paced, iterative environments (Scrum/Agile).
* **Women encouraged to apply** (3 women currently in the team; diversity valued).

  




*Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.*

title: System Verification Engineer
description:
*Are you the system verification engineer who excels in what you do? Do you realize it is more exciting to enable other developers to perform, using test rigs to make sure that our software is as bug free and secure as possible? Then joining our Verification Framework & Integration team would be the next logical step in your career!*

 *Working in this team you will be appreciated and challenged by colleagues from different development teams you are supporting. If you have seen and experienced the frustration of poor test rigs and build environment, now is your chance to prove you can do better.*

**What you will do**
--------------------


At Verification Framework & Integration our mission is to establish a design, build and test environment, which enables continuous deployment within manual and automated testing. Our goals are to reduce the lead time-to-market and increase product quality. Our great and experienced team is responsible for building test hardware, testing all internally developed software and supporting the tool chain at Connectivity in Volvo Group Trucks Technology.

 *Responsibilites:*

* Keep track of needs from the agile release train.
* Identify the Topologies and ECUs needed for testing.
* Work with Product Owners to get timelines for sourcing prototype ECUs.
* Work with Product Owners to get information about changes, RMS and more.
* Assemble rig prototypes.
* Load base software in rigs and test functionality.
* Design new rig types (3D drawing and printing)
* Write and maintain Python programs for simulations.
**Who are you?**
----------------


We believe that you are a passionate engineer with an agile approach and have a big interest in hardware and electronics. To be successful in this position, we believe that you have some years of experience with design, development and assembly. You have been working with vendors and partners to coordinate deliveries.

 *Requirements:*

* M.Sc. Or B.Sc. degree in Electrical Engineering, mechanical engineering or  

similar.
* 3D modeling experience.
* Experience from drawing blueprints.
* Automotive industry experience and knowledge.
* Truck driver's license C.
* Certificate for “Hot work” .
* Experience of working with Electrical safety for battery-electric vehicle.
**What’s in it for you?**
-------------------------

*We offer a solid package of compensation and benefits, plus you will enjoy:*

* A workplace where the growth of our employees is in focus.
* A good atmosphere where trust and passion are two of our core values.
* A chance to make a difference in our path toward test rigs and continuous development.
* A great supportive team that would make you feel valued.
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------

**Location:** Gothenburg, Sweden.

 **Last application date:** June 29th, 2025.

 *The hiring manager for this position is Michael Brolin, Group Manager Verification Framework & Integration.*

 **But for more information about the recruitment process, please contact** Elif Saglik, Talent Acquisition Partner, at elif.saglik@volvo.com.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

Job Description – Production Engineer (English)
  
**Position:** Production Engineer
  
  

**Location:** [City, Country]
  
**Employment Type:** Full-time

About the Role
  
  

As a Production Engineer, you will play a key role in optimizing manufacturing processes, improving efficiency, and supporting continuous improvement initiatives. You will work independently and collaboratively to analyze production methods, implement lean principles, and drive projects that enhance productivity and quality.
  
  

Key Responsibilities
  
  

Develop and optimize production processes, including fabrication, modification, and repair of products.
  
  

Lead continuous improvement projects, such as capacity expansion and workflow optimization.
  
  

Analyze production data, identify inefficiencies, and implement corrective actions.

Review deviation reports and implement improvements in production and cross-functional areas.
  
  

Participate in new product introductions (NPI) and design revisions.
  
  

Use computer-aided tools (e.g., SAP, CAD, simulation software) for reporting and process analysis.
  
  

Ensure compliance with engineering standards, safety regulations, and business requirements.
  
  

Qualifications & Experience
  
  

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering + 6+ years of relevant experience, OR
  
  

Technical degree + 15+ years of experience in production/manufacturing engineering.
  
  

Strong knowledge of production systems, quality control, and Lean methodologies.
  
  

Experience with ERP systems (preferably SAP) is a plus.
  
  

Fluent in English (written and spoken).
  
  

Profile Requirements
  
  

Driven, analytical, and results-oriented with strong problem-solving skills.
  
  

Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
  
  

Stress-resistant, deadline-focused, and proactive in finding solutions.
  
  

Strong communication skills in Swedish and English (preferred for local operations).

title: AR/VR Engineer - Apple Vision Pro
description:
Apple is where individual imaginations gather together, committing to the values that lead to great work. Every new product we build is the result of us making each other’s ideas stronger. That happens because every one of us shares a belief that we can make something wonderful and share it with the world, changing lives for the better. Apple Vision Pro is a revolutionary spatial computer that seamlessly blends digital content with your physical space. It will allow us to do the things we love in ways never before possible - all while staying connected to the people around us. The Vision Products Group (VPG) introduced Apple Vision Pro and visionOS to the world, setting a new standard for AR/VR platforms, and is now looking for a creative Software Engineer to help build our tooling and content authoring story to enable us to deliver world class content.
  

  

**Description**  

  

Apple makes innovative technologies accessible for the creation of amazing user experiences. You will have the opportunity to work in a team developing tooling and frameworks enabling these experiences, in close collaboration with other innovative teams across Apple and VPG. The candidate for this role will be comfortable working in a dynamic and creative environment with an ambition to improve, innovate and explore these technologies to enable creators to surprise and delight our users. Engineers are expected to work quickly and smartly to help determine the viability of ideas and technologies. You will need a keen understanding of 3D engines, DCC tools and content authoring workflows for real-time experiences.
  

  

**Minimum Qualifications**  

* Programming skills and knowledge of C or Swift
* Experience developing high-performance systems for 3D apps and games
* Familiarity with Entity Component Systems (ECS)
* Proficient in mathematics for 3D realtime graphics (linear algebra)

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

* MS in Computer Science, Computer Graphics, or a related field, or equivalent work experience
* Familiar with explicit 3D graphics API (Metal, DirectX, Vulkan)
* Experience using, building and maintaining game engines
* Understanding of CPU/GPU hardware architecture and how that aﬀects solutions
* Experience building tools for real-time engines
* Experience in writing tools and/or scripting for DCCs (Maya, Houdini, Blender)
* Experience working closely with all disciplines in modern game development (e.g. technical
* artists, artists, VFX artists, animators, audio designers, gameplay programmers and game
* designers)
* Proven track record of innovation in 3D development or related fields.
Passion to help define and create real-time content authoring workflows for the future.  
*

title: Senior Digital Design and Verification Engineer
description:
About Xenergic
  
Xenergic is a high-tech semiconductor company providing cutting edge high-speed, low-power embedded memory IP solutions in advanced technology nodes. These memories are targeted for market segment ranging from IoT and mobile applications to high-end servers and AI accelerators.
  
We are looking for a very passionate Senior Digital Design and Verification Engineer to join our team.
  
  

**Job Description:**  

As a Senior Digital Design and Verification Engineer, you will be responsible for the planning, design, integration, and verification of memory and digital blocks into test chips for tape-out. This role demands a strong background in RTL design, verification, and digital implementation—including scripting for automation, SystemVerilog, synthesis, and DFT—while optimizing for power, performance, and area (PPA).
  
You are expected to take initiative to ensure the test chip is both functionally correct and measurable, by addressing all relevant design and verification aspects such as power integrity, timing closure, and design-for-test (DFT). You will also contribute to the development of test patterns, testbenches, and BIST (Built-In Self-Test) to facilitate post-silicon validation.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Design and develop efficient digital blocks from specification to tape-out.
  
Perform RTL coding, synthesis, and PPA optimization.
  
Conduct functional verification including testbench creation, test case development, and debugging.
  
Collaborate with analog, software, and system teams to define and integrate system requirements.
  
Develop and implement robust verification strategies using SystemVerilog/UVM or similar methodologies.
  
Participate in design reviews and provide insights into architecture, verification, and design improvements.
  
**Support the digital backend flow:** floorplanning, physical synthesis, timing closure, and DFT integration.
  
Deliver test patterns and support post-silicon validation and measurement efforts.
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
  
Minimum 5 years of experience in digital ASIC design and verification
  
Strong expertise in RTL design using Verilog or VHDL.
  
Proficiency in EDA tools such as Xcelium, ModelSim, VCS, and Genus.
  
Solid understanding of verification methodologies including SystemVerilog and UVM.
  
Experience with scripting languages (TCL, Python, or Perl) for design automation.
  
Familiarity with backend tools such as Cadence Innovus for place & route and optimization.
  
Knowledge of timing analysis, low-power design techniques, and DFT architecture.
  
**Hands-on experience with physical implementation:** floorplanning, PnR, STA, timing closure, and sign-off.
  
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively in a collaborative, cross-functional environment.
  
Good understanding of silicon bring-up and post-silicon validation workflows.
  
  

If you have any questions, or would like to send in your application (CV and cover letter), contact us by e-mail to career@xenergic.com.
  
We look forward to receiving your application.

title: Service Engineer
description:
At Climeon, we strive to make the world a better place by improving the climate and environment with our Heat Power modules that convert low temperature heat into electricity, delivering renewable and green electricity for ships, industrial processes and local communities.


Our Customer Support team is at the very front of our mission as they are responsible for commissioning, maintaining, and testing our power plants at customer sites, ensuring our machines are running at peak performance. We are now looking for a Service Engineer to join the team!


Being a Service Engineer at Climeon is a versatile role where you will gain widespread knowledge on the technology surrounding our Heat Power modules. You’ll be working hands-on with electrical and mechanical equipment and PLC control system, making sure our machines are up and running at all times. Part of the job will be carried out in Climeon HQ in Kista where you will be based, but you will be working around the globe installing, commissioning, and servicing existing ORC systems within the industrial, geothermal and marine industries, as well as future, predominantly marine products where the work is carried out both at shipyards and onboard vessels in traffic. The work is both physical and part analytical.


**The role also includes:**


* Report field issues and deviations in applicable administrative systems; drive and follow up on remedies
* Connect and configure hardware and software during system setup and commissioning
* Replace parts and perform field upgrades
* Execute FAT and SAT
* Coordinate and ensure modules are shipped as planned
* Handle customer support cases and perform troubleshooting
* Write procedures and methods

**Who are you?**


This role would suit an applicant motivated by hands-on work in an international environment. The role requires a high degree of self-motivativation and to solve tasks independently as well as in small groups and teams. Perhaps your previous job has been as maintenance engineer, refrigeration technician, power plant technician, industrial or marine electrician or similar.


We believe that the right candidate has at least 2 years of relevant work experience and has knowledge and hands-on experience within several of the following areas:


* Electrical power, up to 3~/400VAC including electrical schematics
* Frequency drives, electrical motors and generators
* Extra low voltage DC, signals, sensors and schematics
* PLC, automation and control. PID basic tuning
* Reading and understanding P&IDs
* Basic thermodynamics
* Piping and pressure vessels
* Write and understand technical reports
* Good mechanical understanding

Since our modules are spread across the globe, this role includes a lot of traveling, both planned and with short notice. Therefore, you must be able to travel for short and longer periods of time, approximately up to 120 days/year, as well as holding a class B driver’s license.


As a person we seek someone who enjoys working as a team, helping and supporting others when needed with a strong customer focus. We also believe that the right candidate is responsible, driven, curious, flexible and has good communicative skills.


**Why Climeon?**


You will become a valuable and appreciated member in a workplace where everybody is passionate about contributing to make a difference towards a more sustainable world. You will have the opportunity to be a part of an exciting journey with difficult challenges along incredible opportunities to learn and develop.

title: Teknisk skribent
description:
PrimeComp är ett teknikkonsultbolag med uppdrag inom energi, industri och infrastruktur. Genom vår kombinerade erfarenhet och unika utbud av teknikområden erbjuder vi tjänster för att skapa lönsamma, innovativa och hållbara lösningar.

### **Vi söker en teknisk skribent med erfarenhet av mjukvara och fordonsrelaterade projekt**


Vi söker nu en **teknisk skribent** till vårt team som ansvarar för dokumentation i projekt kopplade till fordons-IT och ombordlösningar. Du kommer att spela en viktig roll i att ta fram och strukturera teknisk dokumentation som krävs för att installera och underhålla mjukvara ombord på tåg.


Teamet du blir en del av arbetar med applikationer för bland annat dynamisk trafikinformation, WiFi ombord och insamling av data från tåg (exempelvis via TCMS och sensorer). Vi jobbar nära fordonsingenjörer och andra teknikteam för att säkerställa att våra lösningar är robusta, säkra och användarvänliga.

### **Om rollen**


Som teknisk skribent ansvarar du för att ta fram, strukturera och kvalitetssäkra dokumentation som följer relevanta standarder, bland annat EN-50657. Du kommer att arbeta både självständigt och i samarbete med utvecklare, ingenjörer och säkerhetsspecialister. En viktig del av rollen är att skapa tydliga processer och mallar för dokumentationsarbetet.

### **Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**

* Skriva och uppdatera teknisk dokumentation enligt EN-50657
* Stötta teamet med dokumentation i pågående fordonsprojekt och vid nya releaser
* Leda dokumentationsarbete tillsammans med andra avdelningar, t.ex. Fordon och IT-säkerhet
* Sätta upp struktur, rutiner och processer för teknisk dokumentation

### **Vi söker dig som:**

* Har erfarenhet av att skriva teknisk dokumentation i komplexa och tekniska projekt
* Har god förståelse för mjukvaruutveckling och tekniska miljöer
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med dokumentationskrav enligt EU-direktiv eller liknande
* Är strukturerad, noggrann och bra på att samarbeta med olika roller
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Trivs i en agil arbetsmiljö
* Har en teknisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet

### **Meriterande:**

* Kännedom om EN-50657 (Software on Board Rolling Stock)
* Erfarenhet av dokumentationsarbete inom fordons- eller tågindustrin
* Van att arbeta i projekt där dokumentationen granskas av externa parter


Tjänsten är placerad på SJs huvudkontor på Vasagatan i Stockholm


Vill du vara med och säkerställa kvaliteten i framtidens tågprojekt? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!  

Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta oss.

description:
