Assure responsive telephone support and diagnostic as well as on-site Services to exceed the customers’ expectation and making them successful by using TMO instruments.


Actively promote our contract products.  

Always maintain a professional relationship with our customer base to foster customer dedication and address blocking issues to resolve critical tasks promptly.


Follow our ethical business conduct guidance.


Responsibility for managing the company’s assets provided, such as Car Stock/Inventory of Parts, Computer, Telephone, general Tools, Software, Company Car, Manuals etc.  

Optimise their own work schedule by coordinating with all partners for service planning and the wider team.  

Is responsible to report accurate and timely activities such as Field Service Reports, Expense Reports, etc.  

Assures alignment of all activities at the customer site with the rest of TMO and advising other part of TMO of important information with respect to our customers (e.g. information about new purchases to sales/lead generation).

 **Technical Team Leader (20-30%)**

  

Responsible for the daily technical coordination of the field service team.  

This includes customer visits, critical issue management, and coordination of team activities, support Field Service Manager (FSM) in organising, planning, controlling and coordinating of service activities for the related products in your area of responsibility.  

Close daily interaction with the Service Management team, Customer Care Center team, commercial sales teams and the factory product support teams to ensure targets are met and new opportunities are communicated and managed.  

Liaise and work with factory product management when required to ensure smooth product introductions and the expansion of the Unity Lab Services brand and value.  

Actively participate in team meetings and local and / or regional meetings as applicable to ensure alignment, information and technical skills maintenance.  

Have direct relationship with key customer contact points. Own and take care of all our customers.  

* Achieve a personal high level of CAS and support managers to ensure high team CAS scores.
* Support FSM by driving the team to meet and exceed Key performance indicators and financial targets
* Act as key “go to” person in your team and region
* Customer complaint and hot account management
* Ensure stong team productivity.
* Assist with the onboarding process for new team members
* Support FSM in the organization of team annual leave.
**Requirements:**

* Professional background in Electronics/Chemistry/Engineering or related subjects
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to work across all levels, functions and regions
* Excellent PC skills
* Excellent inter-personal, self-motivational and negotiating skills
* Driving License
* A keenly developed sense of drive, intellectual curiosity, technical proficiency and problem solving
* Take personal responsibility for tasks with a "get it done" mentality, including hands-on service activities and customer interaction
* A Willingness to travel within Europe/EMEA territory. For meetings and training travel to wider EMEA may be required
* Experience in a technical service function
* Demonstrate organizational skills with the ability to balance multiple tasks with different priorities and to coordinate the work of others
 **Preferred:**  

* Good Product Knowledge of the Thermo Fisher Scientific Products of Instrument and Enterprise Services
* Excellent English communication skills.

This job description does not describe all the duties, tasks and responsibilities which need to be performed in the function. Therefore, the job holder may be asked to undertake other job related instructions, duties, tasks or responsibilities as requested by the FSM or Senior FSM.
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Software Engineers to Zalando
description:
**About The Company And The Role**
 We are looking for two Software Engineers to join Zalando, an international e-commerce company that is shaping the future of retail. This company provides a platform that serves millions of customers worldwide and is now expanding its engineering team to continue delivering innovative solutions. Here, you’ll have the chance to work with technologies such as Java, Kotlin, AWS, PostgreSQL, and Elasticsearch, all while collaborating with passionate teams focused on driving innovation.
   

  

 In the role of Software Engineer, you’ll develop and operate large-scale systems that ensure timely and accurate order fulfillment. Your primary focus will be to build backend applications that handle high volumes of data and deliver seamless experiences for customers and partners.
   

  

 At Zalando, you’ll be part of a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning. This role offers you the chance to contribute to an innovative, customer-centric organization that is reshaping the future of online retail.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Developing and maintaining high-performance, low-latency systems for data streaming and processing.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and scale solutions for fulfillment and customer experience.
* Taking ownership of applications, managing them from development through deployment and monitoring.
* Innovating and finding solutions to scale the platform in an increasingly complex ecosystem.
* Actively contributing to the development of new features and improvements.


 You’ll contribute to Zalando’s success by ensuring the systems you build directly enhance the customer experience. As a Software Engineer, you’ll be challenged by the complexity of building distributed systems at scale and will have the opportunity to collaborate across teams and countries.
   

  

**We Believe You Have**
* A relevant degree in Computer Science or a related field.
* 3-6 years of professional experience in software engineering.
* Solid experience with Java or Kotlin and building APIs.
* Familiarity with databases (e.g., PostgreSQL) and event-driven architectures.
* Some experience or interest in AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch.
* A passion for problem-solving and building scalable solutions.
* Strong communication skills in English (written and spoken).


**It’s a Bonus If You Have**
* Experience with cloud technologies (AWS, Kubernetes) and distributed systems.
* Knowledge of Kafka or similar messaging systems.
* Experience working with large-scale, high-availability systems.


 We are looking for candidates who are proactive, innovative, and motivated to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
   

  

 Other information
   

  

 Start date: As soon as possible
   

  

 Scope: Full-time position (100%)
   

  

 Location: Stockholm.
   

  

 Selection process: We apply continuous selection, which means the position may be filled before the application deadline.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, feel free to contact the responsible recruiter Ronja Bergman on ronja.bergman@techtalents.se
   

  

 Does this sound like the position for you? We look forward to hearing from you – warmly welcome with your application!
   

  

 In this recruitment, Zalando is collaborating with Tech Talents, and we direct applications to Tech Talents.

title: Python Backend Engineer (Document automation)
description:
**Join Quartr as a Python Backend Engineer specializing in web data extraction to help us drive real-time, reliable data solutions for the finance industry.**
**About The Documents Team**
 Quartr’s Documents Team builds and maintains the systems responsible for ingesting and classifying financial documents from a wide range of third-party sources. This includes robust integration with external APIs, intelligent document classification, and automated extraction of relevant data from web-based sources. By joining this team, you’ll work on high-impact solutions at the intersection of data engineering and financial intelligence – powering reliable, scalable access to critical document-based insights.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain scalable data collection pipelines to power Quartr’s data-driven products
* Implement and enhance automated web data extraction solutions to efficiently gather large volumes of real-time financial data
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align technical decisions with business goals
* Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to ensure smooth operation and timely data delivery
* Work closely with non-technical stakeholders to ensure technical solutions are understandable and aligned with business needs


**Required Technical Skills**
* 2+ years of professional experience as a backend engineer, with a focus on Python
* Ability to independently write maintainable code
* Ability to explain code and technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Ability to propose durable, simple solutions to complex problems
* Experience merging data from different sources
* Experience in automated web data extraction, with tools such as Selenium, BeautifulSoup, or Scrapy


**Preferred Technical Skills**
* Hands-on experience with AWS services like Lambda, EC2, ECS, and S3
* Knowledge of ETL processes, large-scale data pipeline management, and workflow tools like Apache Airflow; experience handling streaming or batch data ingestion
* Experience with Docker for deploying and managing backend services and web data extraction scripts
* Experience working with proxy services


**Desired qualities**
* An understanding of equity market mechanics
* Be self-driven, proactive, and take full ownership of your projects
* Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills and work independently on technical challenges
* Communicate clearly and effectively, thriving in a high-paced, collaborative environment
* Be passionate about Quartr’s mission and dedicated to delivering high-quality, valuable data


**What We Offer**
* Competitive salary
* Company option plan
* Top-notch equipment of your choice
* Wellness allowance
* Flexible work arrangements (remote or on-site in Stockholm/Gothenburg) – must be based in Sweden with a valid work permit
* Employee pension (Tjänstepension)


**Note:** 
 We are not seeking assistance from consultants or recruitment agencies.
   

  

**About Quartr**
 Every day, leading companies and financial institutions worldwide rely on Quartr to make better decisions faster. The product suite includes: Quartr API, enabling third parties to build custom solutions powered by Quartr's unique live earnings calls and transcription technology, and its extensive global database of IR material – including public company filings, archived earnings call transcripts, and slide deck presentations. Quartr Pro, a desktop research platform that increases efficiency and precision in qualitative public market research for top hedge funds, asset managers, equity research departments, and IR professionals. A free mobile app allowing users to always stay informed and conduct research anytime, anywhere.

title: Software Developer
description:
**Utveckla framtiden med oss** 




 Omegapoint är ett konsultföretag som skapar framtidens digitala tjänster. Vi fortsätter att växa och letar nu efter dig som har några års erfarenhet av systemutveckling.
 



  





**Brinner du för säkerhet inom systemutveckling?** 




 I denna roll blir du en viktig spelare i vårt team och vi tror därför att du är en teamplayer med högt ansvarstagande och kvalitétstänk. Du trivs i kundrelationerna där du är en både strukturerad och engagerad rådgivare och har förmåga att omsätta dina kunskaper i konkreta lösningar. Du är van att agera självständigt och inte rädd för att ta egna initiativ. Som person tror vi vidare att du är öppen, positiv och trivs i en organisation präglad av kompetensutveckling där vi är vassa och snälla mot varandra.
 



 Att du vill dela med dig av din kompetens till dina kollegor genom exempelvis mentorskap eller att delta på våra interna kompetensdagar tycker vi är en självklarhet. Vi bygger och stärker vår fina kompetenskultur tillsammans!
 



  





**För den här tjänsten tror vi även att du:** 



* har minst tre års erfarenhet av programmering i Java, C#/.NET eller liknande
* arbetar kvalitetsinriktat och känner dig bekväm med såväl testdriven utveckling som automatiserade tester
* har kunskap kring IaC, pipelines och traditionell DevOps/DevSecOps
* eventuellt har erfarenhet av domändriven design
* har arbetat med agila utvecklingsmetoder
* har en akademisk examen eller motsvarande
* behärskar svenska i tal och skrift



  





**Om oss** 




 Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 900 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Oslo, Drammen, Köpenhamn, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala och Umeå.
 



  





**Vi satsar på dig** 




 På Omegapoint sätter vi din kompetens i centrum och ger dig alla förutsättningar för ett utvecklande och varierat jobb. Som konsult hos oss tillbringar du vardagen i uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, men har alltid en välkomnande hemmahamn på kontoret i centrala Stockholm. Här ordnar vi mängder av aktiviteter under året för att vi ska utvecklas och ligga i framkant. Det är en del i vår kompetenskultur som bygger på samarbete och en vilja att stärka varandra.
 



  





 Med en stor och varierande kundbas, från små specialistföretag till stora och välkända företag och myndigheter, har vi en möjlighet att erbjuda utmanande och roliga uppdrag.
 



  





 Givetvis erbjuder vi även allt det andra som är viktigt, som marknadsmässiga löner, förstärkt föräldralön, anpassade förmånspaket, friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring och möjlighet till delägarskap.
 



  





 Vi vågar lova dig en arbetsplats där du kommer att trivas, utvecklas och ges alla möjligheter till en ljus framtid.

title: Engineer, Field Applications, New College Grad Program
description:
Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare.
   

  

 ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future.
   

  

**About Analog Devices**
 Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: ADI ) is a global semiconductor leader that bridges the physical and digital worlds to enable breakthroughs at the Intelligent Edge. ADI combines analog, digital, and software technologies into solutions that help drive advancements in digitized factories, mobility, and digital healthcare, combat climate change, and reliably connect humans and the world. With revenue of more than $9 billion in FY24 and approximately 24,000 people globally, ADI ensures today's innovators stay Ahead of What's Possible™. Learn more at www.analog.com and on LinkedIn and Twitter (X).
   

  

 Are you an engineer who enjoys working with others to solve challenging problems? Who likes working with customers and their engineering teams? Would you like to work with an industry-leading, growing company that offers cutting edge technology? If so, then Analog Devices’ Graduate Program is a great fit for you!
   

  

 In this program, you’ll be working with engineers both internally to Analog Devices and externally at customer accounts, along with mentors in Sales Engineer and Applications Engineer roles, to solve some of the most complex engineering problems facing customers today.
   

  

 You’ll learn through a structured development program that includes technical training, projects, job shadowing and coaching. The Graduate Program prepares you for a career in Analog Device’s Sales organization, either as a Field Sales Engineer or a Field Applications Engineer.
   

  

**Skills you will develop include, but are not limited to:**
* Educating customers on Analog Devices' solutions and products
* Developing and maintaining professional business relationships with customers
* Understanding and disseminating customers' system needs verses wants
* Proposing system solutions to customers
* Assist in the definition, design and development of new products and tools
* Developing new accounts and/or expanding existing customer accounts
* Best practices for customer support to resolve customer issues or difficulties


**Qualifications and required skills include:**
* Electronic Engineering degree
* Strong communication, interpersonal and organizational skills
* Team and customer oriented; strong ability to collaborate and work with others
* Strong problem solving and logical thinking skills
* Good lab measurement and debug skills
* Ability to operate with:
* An Ahead of What’s Possible mindset,
* High energy,
* Entrepreneurial thinking
* A nd hands-on approach
* Able to demonstrate leadership characteristics
* Ability to travel 25-40% of time


**Other Desired Interests:**
* Electronics engineer, Telecommunication, RF or similar related degree
* Able to relocate and have a right-to-work in Europe


**Interested?**
 Then apply online
   

  

*For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process.*
*Analog Devices is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a culture where everyone has an opportunity to succeed regardless of their race, color, religion, age, ancestry, national origin, social or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, union membership, and political affiliation, or any other legally protected group.*
 Job Req Type: Graduate Job
   

  

 Required Travel: Yes, 25% of the time

title: Director of Engineering - Music
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
 We're looking for an Engineering Director to lead our Sound Platform and Digital Rights Management (DRM) areas. This pivotal role involves driving technical vision and strategic execution across five engineering teams, ensuring our technology evolves seamlessly with our product ambitions.
   

  

 At Epidemic Sound, our engineering is at the heart of soundtracking the world. As an Engineering Director, you'll be instrumental in shaping our core sound platform and managing critical digital rights, guaranteeing our solutions are robust, scalable, and enable future product innovation. This is a platform and tech-heavy role where your strategic technical leadership will be key.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As Engineering Director, you'll provide strategic technical leadership and oversight for five engineering teams, including Engineering Managers and Staff Engineers, connecting product vision to technical reality. Your responsibilities include:
   

  

* Strategic Technical Leadership: Provide clear technical direction and architectural guidance, ensuring our platform supports long term product needs and identifying where specialized expertise is required.
* Organizational Strategy & Manager Enablement: Oversee and empower engineering teams, fostering an environment where they excel. This includes managing and developing Engineering Managers and Staff Engineers under your leadership.
* Driving Technical Excellence: Foster a culture of top-tier engineering, championing best practices, and pushing for continuous improvement across your domains.
* Product-to-Tech Translation: Bridge ambitious product ideas with their technical implementation, ensuring engineering strategy directly supports business goals.
* Building a high functioning organization. The Sound domain is core to everything we do at Epidemic and the DRM space is rapidly evolving. This will require you to shape the organization to manage both complex ongoing product needs and large scale strategic movements.


**Requirements**
 To succeed in this impactful role, we believe you should have:
   

  

* Proven experience as a Software Engineer and in technical leadership roles, specifically managing other managers.
* A strong strategic understanding of platform-level challenges and a deep appreciation for complex technical systems in a tech-heavy environment.
* Demonstrated ability to translate product vision into actionable technical strategy and scalable solutions.
* Experience in organizational strategy for engineering teams, fostering growth and enabling high performance.
* A change-driven mindset and a passion for evolving technical landscapes.
* A track record of promoting excellent engineering practices and a commitment to quality.


 This is a chance to shape the core of Epidemic Sound, directly impacting our ability to scale and innovate in a rapidly evolving digital landscape. You'll guide critical technical and organizational developments, empowering our engineering teams to build the foundational technology that powers our global soundtracking mission and ensures our long-term success.
   

  

**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Apply now by clicking the link below! We embrace a hybrid model but love collaborating in person, so we spend the majority of our time in the office.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Technical Co-Founder & AI Engineer — Brand Intelligence Startup [Equity-based Compensation Opportunity]
description:
**🔥 Brinna AI** 
 —
 **Reimagining the future of Brand Management with an AI Powered Brand Intelligence Platform.** 




  





 Are you a skilled full-stack engineer with a passion for AI? A founder at heart, or do you aspire to become one? Passionate about tackling complex problems through technology? Do you thrive in the 0-to-1 startup phase and want to build something that genuinely adds value for the brands of the world?
 



  





 If so, join
 **Brinna AI** 
 and co-build a company almost from the ground up and own a meaningful stake in a game-changing product.
 



  





***Note:***
*This opportunity is mainly equity-based, with no initial monetary compensation until we secure funding later this year. However, if this is a potential deal-breaker, we can offer a modest cash compensation for the ideal co-founder.* 




  





*This is a full-time hybrid role based in Stockholm.* 




  





**This Is Us** 




  





**Brinna AI** 
 , a promising new Stockholm-based venture, harness the power of AI to revolutionize brand management, ensure consistency and providing valuable insights for brands. As the demand for maintaining brand consistency has surged with the latest advancements in AI, we aim to become the intelligent antidote to brand inconsistencies by being at the forefront of this essential shift of paradigm. Currently, we're working with global brands and have already generated revenue through various bespoke developments and solutions. Our next strategic move is to pivot towards developing a comprehensive
 **AI-driven platform** 
 , further elevating our impact in the brand management sphere.
 



  





 This is a joint-venture with massive growth potential. With the right team, we anticipate scaling to
 **$10M in ARR within the first year of launch** 
 .
 



  





**What We Are Looking For** 




  





 We're seeking one or two driven, tech-savvy, and ambitious
 **Technical Co-founder(s) & AI Engineer(s)** 
 with an opportunity to join as a co-founder(s). You’ll be a core member of the founding team, with significant influence over technology, strategy, and execution — along with meaningful equity upside.
 



  





 As a co-founder, you will have the freedom to push boundaries, dive deep into code, and actively contribute to shaping the company’s vision and technological backbone. You will also be instrumental in building and mentoring a high-performing team to tackle challenges head-on and achieve ambitious growth.
 



  





 This is a challenge for someone with the grit, grind, and determination to build, innovate, and scale
 **Brinna AI** 
 into a global leader in tech-driven brand management solutions.
 



  





**Who We Think You Are** 




  





 🧗‍♂️
 **Founder mentality** 
 — ownership, resourcefulness, and the ability to thrive in ambiguity.
 



 📦
 **Product-first engineering mindset** 
 — focus on delivering customer value over pure technical complexity.
 



 🧠
 **AI/ML expertise** 
 — hands-on experience building and deploying AI/ML models, with a solid understanding of modern architectures, tools, and frameworks (e.g., transformers, LLMs, RAGs, model APIs, graph database technologies, etc.).
 



**💼 Full-stack expertise** 
 — strong experience in frontend & backend development (React, TypeScript, Tailwind, Next.js, PostgreSQL, a plus. Open to other stacks as well based on solid rationales and personal preference).
 



**🗣️ Strong communication and leadership skills** 
 — ability to influence company strategy and mentor future team members.
 



**🚀 Startup experience** 
 — prior work at an early-stage company or high-growth tech startup.
 



**⚡️ Bias for action** 
 — you move fast, make pragmatic trade-offs, and iterate efficiently.
 



  





**Why You Should Join Us** 




  





**🎭 Culture of Innovation and Autonomy:** 
 You’ll have real ownership over your work as well as the success of the platform and the team.
 



**⚒️ Hands-On Impact:** 
 Play a crucial role in the development and refinement of a product desired by the market, with the opportunity to innovate and shape its future.
 



**🤝 Collaborative Environment:** 
 Work with a passionate, forward-thinking team and a well-established creative agency dedicated to disrupting the industry through innovation in a mission-driven environment.
 



**💸 Equity & Ownership:** 
 Receive a substantial equity stake in a high-potential startup, giving you a direct influence on the direction and success of the company.
 



  





**Next Steps** 




  





 Are you ready to take on the technical lead in a rapidly growing startup with enormous potential? Let's talk! 🚀

title: Research Engineering Lead
description:
**TL;DR**
 We’re looking for a hands-on research and engineering leader to get the best performance out of commercial and open source frontier models, in order to power the future of AI software engineering. You’ll own experiments end-to-end—from dataset design to model alignment and performance optimization. Must be curious, experimental, and obsessed with squeezing the most out of models.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
* Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (according to industry veterans)
* Work, learn, have fun: We’re building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis


**What We’re Looking For**
* You’re a natural leader who is obsessed with building the best technical team in the world
* You’re a bold, unconventional thinker who learns at lightning speed
* You love working at the intersection of algorithms, data and machine learning
* You have a deep intuition for what works when training and fine-tuning LLMs
* You understand that synthetic data is the core of making the best AI systems during this decade, and are excited about generating data and increasing quality
* You know how to design high-quality and fast-paced experiments and have strong sense for effective evaluation
* You are relentless in debugging training runs just as much as designing new approaches
* You’ve got a pirate’s mindset: pragmatic, resourceful, and fast-moving


**Your day to day**
 In one sentence: Create the most powerful ensemble of LLMs into lovable products.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Identify and update the most important metrics to optimize from a product perspective
* Collaborate with fellow engineering leaders to build a world-class team of brilliant, ambitious people
* Design, run and analyze experiments grounded in real-world coding and product use cases
* Develop and maintain training pipelines, distillation workflows, and synthetic data generating systems
* Work closely with infra and product engineers to scale training efforts and ship results


**Our tech stack** 
 We're pragmatic in picking the tools that make developers move as fast as possible, and have a platform team to support you.
   

  

**How Applying Works**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call
* Complete a technical take-home exercise
* Dive deeper into your way of thinking over two technical interviews
* Join us for 1-2 days of trial work on-site if possible. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you are interested please apply through our application system.

title: Data Engineer
description:
*Vår vision är att skapa en skalbar, säker och självbetjänande dataplattform som möjliggör realtidsbearbetning, maskininlärning och avancerad dataanalys. Den nya plattformen kommer att integrera både molnbaserade och lokala system och ge sömlös åtkomst till strukturerad och ostrukturerad data via en centraliserad datasjö! Vill du ta nästa steg och bli en del av vår satsning kring vår moderna dataplattform och AI? Då är detta rollen för dig!* 




  





**I rollen får du:** 




 • Designa och bygga datapipelines och dataarkitektur för en robust och skalbar plattform i AWS.
 



 • Optimera dataflöden och transformationer för att säkerställa hög prestanda och tillgänglighet.
 



 • Arbeta med realtidsbearbetning och batchhantering av stora datamängder från olika källor.
 



 • Automatisera och förbättra interna processer genom Infrastructure as Code (IaC) och CI/CD.
 



 • Säkerställa datasäkerhet och compliance i enlighet med policyer och regelverk.
 



 • Möjliggöra en plattform för utveckling, produktionssättning och livscykelhantering av ML och AI applikationer (MLOps) och Generativ AI.
 



 • Samarbeta nära molnarkitekter, data scientists och produktteam för att möjliggöra datadrivna insikter.
 



  





 I denna roll kommer du att vara en central del i uppbyggnaden av vår nya dataplattform. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer att innefatta designa, implementation och underhåll av pipelines som möjliggör dataflöden mellan dataproducenter och konsumenter. Vidare innebär rollen att transformera data så att den är optimerad för analys, tillgänglighet och relevans, utifrån ATG:s samlade behov. Tjänsten innebär att utveckla, underhålla och testa datapipelines för produktionskvalitet. Du kommer att samarbeta tätt med andra inom ATG för att tillhandahålla data för analys och dataapplikationer så vi tillsammans skapar en kundupplevelse i världsklass. I den här rollen kommer du att arbeta med stora och komplexa mängder data från en mängd olika strukturerade och ostrukturerade källor för att möta affärskraven i organisationen.
 



  





**Är det här du:** 




 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och för att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du som söker har en teknisk bakgrund samt högskoleutbildning. Du har även några års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet som Data Engineer och programmeringskunskaper samt ett stort intresse för nya tekniker. Vi ser att du har djup kunskap om traditionella och moderna databasteknologier samt kunskap och erfarenhet inom machine learning. Vidare söker vi dig med erfarenhet av att transformera, bearbeta och extrahera information från stora datamängder.
 



  





 Vi ser att du är en problemlösare med god kommunikationsförmåga. Vidare är du noggrann och effektiv i ditt arbete och du drivs av passionen att säkerställa leveransen av data. Du trivs när det är ordning och redan och du är nyfiken samt ambitiös som person. Då vi är i starten av arbetet med vår nya plattform ser vi att du är prestigelös och gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap. Vidare söker vi dig med en god kommunikativ förmåga på både engelska och svenska, eftersom en stor del av arbetet sker på engelska.
 



  





 Vi ser att du har några års erfarenhet av:
 



 • Att designa och bygga dataflöden i en molnbaserad miljö (helst AWS).
 



 • Databasteknologier såsom PostgreSQL, Oracle eller liknande.
 



 • AWS-tjänster för datahantering, exempelvis Glue, Athena, Redshift, S3, Lambda, Kinesis.
 



 • Att bygga och optimera ETL/ELT-pipelines för stora och komplexa datamängder.
 



 • Programmering exempelvis i Python, SQL eller Java.
 



 • Containerteknologi och serverlös arkitektur, såsom Docker, Kubernetes, AWS Lambda.
 



 • Att automatisera infrastruktur med verktyg som Terraform.
 



 • Datasäkerhet och efterlevnad av riktlinjer och policyer.
 



 • Versionshantering med GIT och CI/CD-pipelines.
 



  





**”Jag tror på frihet under ansvar”** 




 Det bästa med ATG är att vi har väldigt sunda värderingar som man verkligen känner av i vardagen. Alla jobbar för att hjälpa varandra och leverera så bra tjänster som möjligt. Som ledare är jag öppen, inkluderande och tydlig. Jag tror på frihet under ansvar där mitt mål är att skapa rätt förutsättningar och uppgifter för att teamet ska trivas och utvecklas. När jag inte jobbar, tar fru och barn det mesta av tiden i vardagen. Annars så fixar jag ganska mycket med hus och trädgård. Jag gillar att åka snowboard och skridskor eller spela Playstation med sonen
 *.* 




**- Rekryterande chef, Andreas Lindén, Manager IT Oracle Infrastructure Services** 




  





**We are the game** 




 I närmare 50 år har vi på ATG levererat spänning och underhållning till svenska folket. Vi drivs av att trygga den svenska hästnäringen och att fortsatt vara ett ansvarsfullt spelbolag i framkant. Vår vision att leverera världens bästa spelupplevelse. Hos oss är du en del av en innovativ miljö – med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar vi spelupplevelser i världsklass. Självledarskap och kompetensutveckling är viktiga delar för oss. Sedan starten 1974 har vi byggt och förvaltat systemen för våra produkter som hanterar 4 500 000 transaktioner per dag.
 



  





**Join the game!** 




 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan via vår rekryteringsportal antingen med ditt cv eller din LinkedIn-profil – det som är enklast och smidigast för dig. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida och tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten.
 



 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning och kommer att göra en bakgrundskontroll för denna roll. Tjänsten är på heltid och utgår från vårt kontor vid Solvalla, alldeles intill travbanan. Vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att du har möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete från kontoret. Var med och bygg världens bästa spelupplevelse tillsammans med oss!

title: Staff Product Engineer
description:
**TL;DR**
 We need an exceptional mid-senior full-stack engineer to help build the future of AI software engineering. You'll work across our entire stack to build features that tomorrow’s product builders need. Must be able to ship fast and tackle any technical challenge that comes your way.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
* Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
* Work, learn, have fun: We're building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis


**What We're Looking For**
* You're a technical Swiss Army knife who can solve any problem thrown at you
* You ship fast and break through walls instead of waiting for doors
* You're familiar with a variety of programming languages and understand fundamental principles behind scalable applications, tech stack, and databases
* You're comfortable not knowing everything but figuring it out anyway
* You have strong opinions about code quality but know when to move fast


**Your Responsibilities**
* In one sentence: Do whatever it takes to build a generational product
* Jump between frontend, backend, and infrastructure to build core functionality
* Define, design, and ship new features and participate in full dev lifecycle from planning and design to deployment and maintenance


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
* Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform
* And always exploring what's next


**How Applying Works**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call
* Complete a technical take-home exercise
* Dive deeper into your way of thinking during two technical interviews
* Join us for 1-2 days of trial work on-site if possible. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you are interested please apply through our application system.

title: Associate AI & Management Consultant (Nordics) - Orbit Program
description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.
   

  

**Location: Madrid for an onboarding period of 6-9 months with an option to extend and a planned relocation to Stockholm/Copenhagen after. Customer base will be in the Nordics region, involving travel to meet clients in person.**
**The Team**
 Our Value Engineers (VE) are the trusted advisor for customers and work on the intersection of technology and business. Value Engineers partner with sales and customers to create compelling solutions to critical business problems. A great VE understands the customer, the technology, and the sales cycle making it what may be the most interesting, challenging, and fulfilling role in enterprise technology sales.
   

  

 You will be joining the Global VE Center of Excellence which is an international, diverse, and dynamic organization at the core of the Celonis Value Engineering team. As a team, we enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and share a sense of belonging to a community that wants to learn and grow together. The team culture is one based on building trust, continuous development, and improvement through coaching & mentoring. You will be reporting to the Manager Value Engineering Graduate Program.
   

  

**The Role**
 Talented individuals launch their careers in the enterprise software world by joining the Orbit Graduate Program as an Associate Value Engineer.
   

  

 The
 **12-month program** 
 is a unique experience to fast start your Value Engineering career that highlights hands-on learning, mentorship, and a team culture where we rely on each other to learn, grow and achieve. The program is designed to develop essential VE skills & competencies and establish strong lasting relationships allowing you to grow your career at Celonis.
   

  

 Your journey will start with onboarding & enablement to develop your business and Celonis skills through a combination of hands-on experience in customer engagements and different pieces of training which cover amongst others the Celonis Process Intelligence, domain knowledge, presentation & demo skills, discovery & objection handling as well as value selling.
   

  

**The work you’ll do:**
* Work as part of the Nordics Value Engineering team on customer engagements
* Collaborate with customers to uncover their core business challenges and determine how Celonis Process Intelligence can help them achieve their business objectives
* Pitch the Celonis AI value proposition and vision to customers and align our solutions with their AI strategy.
* Prototype and develop AI solutions tailored to customer needs, including both traditional machine learning and LLM-based solutions.
* Execute proof projects showcasing the value of Celonis Process Intelligence in the context of our customers’ strategy, business initiatives, and challenges
* Collaborate with customers and partners to design and build solutions in the Celonis Process Intelligence that drive value realisation and ensure a positive return on investment
* Frame the strategic and quantitative business value Celonis will bring to our customers’ organization and deliver presentations to senior executives that outline the opportunity, product solution, and business case to drive investment decisions
* Build strong relationships with our customers by winning their trust through technical, product expertise, and business acumen to act as a trusted advisor.
* Collaborate and share customer insights & feedback with internal Product and Engineering teams to influence product innovation
* Create re-usable collateral, best practices & tools within the Global VE Center of Excellence and feed them back to the regional Value Engineering team
* Travel to the Nordics region to meet clients in person to ensure the success of customer engagements.


**The qualifications you need:**
 We are looking for people who enjoy solving problems, think outside the box, and are not afraid to make and learn from mistakes. You have a bachelors and/or masters degree level in the field of Technology & Management, Industrial/Business Engineering, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics or a comparable degree program, as well as work/internship experience. You’re curious, self-motivated, enjoy continuous learning, and you want to work in a lively environment characterized by high growth.
   

  

**You are successful as a Value Engineer if you:**
* Have a passion for technology, data, OpenAI and LLMs and the impact it can have on the world
* Have a hunger to learn new technologies; knowledge or hands-on experience in SQL, Python is a plus
* Any exposure to process mining principles and completion of Celonis Rising Star modules would be a welcome indicator of your eagerness to develop in this field.
* Are able to think analytically and creatively, especially in applying technology solutions to core business problems
* Are focused on creating and adding value for customers
* Have an entrepreneurial mindset and the ability to multi-task, prioritize and execute
* Are able to build relationships with senior management and influence decision-makers
* Are confident to present to C-level executives and larger audiences
* Are willing to travel to the Nordics region to meet clients in person
* Are an effective communicator and fluent in English and in Finnish, Danish or Swedish.


**What Celonis Can Offer You:**
* Pioneer Innovation: Work with the leading, award-winning process mining technology, shaping the future of business.
* Accelerate Your Growth: Benefit from clear career paths, internal mobility, a dedicated learning program, and mentorship opportunities.
* Receive Exceptional Benefits: Including generous PTO, hybrid working options, company equity (RSUs), comprehensive benefits, extensive parental leave, dedicated volunteer days, and much more.
* Prioritize Your Well-being: Access to resources such as gym subsidies, counseling, and well-being programs.
* Connect and Belong: Find community and support through dedicated inclusion and belonging programs.
* Make Meaningful Impact: Be part of a company driven by strong values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future.
* Collaborate Globally: Join a dynamic, international team of talented individuals.
* Empowered Environment: Contribute your ideas in an open culture with autonomous teams.


**About Us:**
 Celonis makes processes work for people, companies and the planet. The Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses industry-leading process mining and AI technology and augments it with business context to give customers a living digital twin of their business operation. It’s system-agnostic and without bias, and provides everyone with a common language for understanding and improving businesses. Celonis enables its customers to continuously realize significant value across the top, bottom, and green line. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.
   

  

 Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.
   

  

**Celonis Inclusion Statement:**
 At Celonis, we believe our people make us who we are and that “The Best Team Wins”. We know that the best teams are made up of people who bring different perspectives to the table. And when everyone feels included, able to speak up and knows their voice is heard - that's when creativity and innovation happen.
   

  

**Your Privacy:**
 Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis’ Accessibility and Candidate Notices
   

  

 By submitting this application, you confirm that you agree to the storing and processing of your personal data by Celonis as described in our Privacy Notice for the Application and Hiring Process.
   

  

 Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.
